Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: WHFlorida
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here three times. All three times we have had an excellent experience. The front desk staff is friendly, rooms are clean, and decor feels just like vacation. We have always found great deals on-line so the prices are perfect for our large family. We love it here, and will definetly come here again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Overall good but lacking in a few important areas (customer service being one).”
Reviews.Author: mcglynndon
Reviews.Content: Things we liked: large unit, overall pretty clean, screened in patio, free DVD rentals. Things this place is lacking in: beds are not up to what you would expect in a "resort". Time to re-evaluate the mattresses and old fashioned comforters folks! We also had two bad "room service" issues. When we checked in on Fri nite my step daughter called the pizza place on the brochure given to us by front desk. We were told the food would come from their sister resort a few miles away (Bahama Bay). After an hour+ of waiting we called to check on the order - they had a "computer problem" and lost our order. Ok, understandable, so we decided to give the "sister resort" food option another try the next day (last night actually). My wife and I were heading out to Disney for the night so we ordered ahead to pick up a pizza and salad at Bahama Bay. When we got to front gate, security guard acted very angry that we were wanting to come in to the restaurant without the restaurant having notified him. Once this was resolved we finally got to the restaurant to pick our food - it was not ready and we were told we could wait out by the pool for them to finish it. This was frustrating as we had called ahead hoping to expedite the process. When it finally came we decided to just eat out by the Bahama Bay pool but it was like pulling teeth to get silver wear, cups, paper plates for our pizza and salad. No concept of customer service. That said, the pizza and salad were great! We won't be coming back to either property because we can get better service (and better bedding) for the same price at a few other similar resorts in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great villa”
Reviews.Author: ktownon
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days on a golf junket with Caribe Cove as our home base- spacious well equipped villa-lots more room than just the 2 of us needed. Friendly helpful at check in. Lots of families and children there so we did not use the pool. Pool is situated in an inconveninet location and it s a little small for the number of people this place can accommodate - I expect it is quiet during the day(while people visit attractions) but in the late afternoon, early evening much too busy. Enjoyed the golf courses- excellent value and service and not that busy- liked it better than Myrtle Beach courses.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent apartments, location and holiday”
Reviews.Author: Naomi A
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I have just come back from a week at Caribe Cove; we stayed with 2 friends and their children and had a fantastic time. The apartment was spacious, clean, comfortable and excellently located close enough to the Disney parks to make getting their easy and far enough to feel like you were having a proper break on your days away from the parks. The pool was a perfect size, very clean with ample sun beds for everyone and the staff were friendly and very accommodating. Restaurants were in easy reach and the facilities within the apartments meant cooking in was easy as well, and the delivery pizza went down nicely! We stayed in a 3 bedroom apartment, block 5 apartment 401 which was perfectly located on the fourth floor giving us total privacy as it was at the end of the block with 2 very secure balconies overlooking trees a lake and nothing else. I could not fault this property and definitely hope to return there again, I would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price, clean”
Reviews.Author: mutleyman
Reviews.Content: We had 2 weeks here during spring break Its a great location to get to everything, restaurants,etc, try the 126 Chinese down the road - Great value when you want a takeout! 10mins and we were in the Disney parks, a bit longer to Universal but straight up the I4 and we were there in 25mins We spent a bit of time in to pool which was clean & was not too busy, kids thought it was great Staff were always polite and helpful, the card wouldn't work on one occasion but was replaced straight away once I had shown ID - Good from a security point of view The only negative was the squeaky beds, I'd upload the video my kids took if I could as it was that funny ! All in all we would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “disney visit”
Reviews.Author: John H
Reviews.Content: The Caribe Cove condos are really confortabel and spacious. However, They do not come with any maid service, so you're on your own for making beds and washing linen, dish washing etc. We were there the first week of April and Disney was extremeily crowed. The traffic deom Caribe Cove to Disney was terrible. If you're going to Disney and need a spacious plac ( we had Three Bedroom) then Caribe Cove is for you, just remember the things I said eariler.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Sher S
Reviews.Content: 3 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms, laundry and kitchen in suite. Very clean. Master bedroom and bathroom are huge with a king size bed. Second bedroom is about the size of an average hotel room. 3rd bedroom is small with 2 twin beds. We would definitely stay here again. We had a party of 5 and the large space was great. Furnishings did show signs of wear, but were still nice. Some other reviews had complained that the WiFi in the suite did not work. Ours did not work at first, but we called the front desk and they sent someone out to "re-set it". After that, it worked just fine. One positive that turned into a negative - There is great outdoor lighting all night with security lights positioned frequently along every corrider. Unfortunately, the small bedroom with the twin beds did not have curtains over the window. Just a wooden blind wich did NOT keep the security light from shinning in all night and making it hard for our kids to get to sleep. Since the light was positioned right outside the window, it was really bright in the bedroom. We tried clipping a towel to the blind, but that really did not help much at all. Next time I would be sure to take a small dark blanket to cover this window. Really easy trip to Disney World, but far enough away to feel like you are away from the crowd.

Reviews.Title: “BIG secret”
Reviews.Author: 18g22e
Reviews.Content: stayed 2011 july w/ wife 2 kids and mother. this place is a total secret. great bang for ur buck. washer/dryer full kitchen. less then 2 miles from a Publix. and off the busy strip of freeway. total oasis...

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, well maintained, easy living”
Reviews.Author: CaminoGirl
Reviews.Content: Overall I liked the resort. Positives: Huge suites! Our suite could take up to 10! We were pleased with 2 big bathrooms, that were clean and modern. Seriously affordable! If you are a family on a tight budget I would recommend Caribe Cove as you can stay for an inexpensive rate as well as prepare food in the kitchen - rather than eating out all the time. We ate breakfast at the resort, and then prepared our lunches for our day at the disney parks - saved us a ton and we ate like kings! The pool is low key and well maintained. A nice place to spend an afternoon relaxing. Loved the balconies. Screened in so the critters can't get at you. Was blissful to spend the early morning out there eating breakfast and the late evening drinking wine!! Negatives: Ants. Ants. Ants. So frustrating. I felt like I was camping really. If you didn't have all food in an airtight container you would come back to it (say a banana or an orange on the counter) surrounded by a ton of ants. They made little trails through out our rooms and honestly I found it rather disconcerting. I don't like having to worry about that sort of thing indoors. Maintenance came up immediately after we called them to spray... but then you have toxic crap everywhere. Something that needs addressing. The only other negative is that the beds need to be replaced along with the pilly linens. The beds creak with every movement and are hard! Not very comfortable at all. I wouldn't stay here again for this reason alone. In the end, I would recommend this place. For a family on a budget, this is the place, it is well maintained with the exception of the two above negatives. It is close to the parks, and is also conveniently located close to many amenities like grocery stores and restaurants. At the end of the day you will be so tired you won't notice the beds aren't blissfully soft.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: Bahamafam
Reviews.Content: Loved It! Our family of 6 stayed there in Nov 2011 for 2 weeks. We had the 3 bed, two bath condo at the very top floor. Beautiful, quiet, and friendly staff. I was worried that it would not live up to its advertised photos and description, but it was spot on! Clean, spacious, like a new home away from home. Fully equipped kitchen and personal laundry room make long stays much easier. Yes the beds are quite firm as others have said, but we slept fine. One night we heard the frogs mentioned, but that was from the patio, and we could not hear them inside. It is not as close to the parks as some other hotels, but we did not mind the few minutes more. We did have a false alarm fire scare in the middle of the night, but the response time of the employees and the fire truck was excellent. Despite that, we definately will stay there again on our next trip to the area! Much better than stuffy hotel rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Clean, but lousy mattresses and traffic jams every morning!”
Reviews.Author: MarvelousGreenMtnman
Reviews.Content: This resort is quite attractive. It is clean and well maintained. It is a fairly small resort as resorts go in the Orlando area and therefore it seems a little more personal. The pool area is nice but closes at dusk, which is too early in March when the sun sets just after 7pm. The rooms are huge and nicely appointed - great for a family of 6. There are lots of convenient restaurants and grocery stores close by but the traffic on the192 is crazy busy. Each morning we spent 20-30 minutes trying to get to the I-4. Be aware of the extra resort fees and cleaning fees. Not much you can do about them but figure that into your cost before you buy.

Reviews.Title: “Great rental for the price”
Reviews.Author: Amber692
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with our 3 bedroom rental. It was very spacious and had everything we needed. The beds were not super comfortable, but weren't terrible. Kitchen was well equiped, although it did not have any dish soap. There is a laundry room in the condo, but you'll need detergent. The staff was friendly at check in. The pool was nice, but we didn't have time to use it much. The resort was fairly close to Disney based on mileage; however, driving time was about 15-20 minutes. The price was great and we enjoyed our stay. We would return to Caribe Cove.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodations, not much to do...”
Reviews.Author: Wewillgofar
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our 3 bedroom, 5th floor condo, March 10 - 17th. Very spacious, comfortable and clean. Beds were great (not hard like some reviews would lead you to believe). The resort was very quiet and relaxing, however we found there was little to do. Although we enjoyed a few trips to the pool, it was not very big considering the number of buildings here. The resort would benefit from a tennis court, or basketball court, or shuffleboard area, or even a mini put area. Pool surroundings were very basic, although the "infinity" effect of the end of the pool was nice. The clubhouse has a dvd lending machine, which is free once you pay the daily resort fee (about $6 per day). This includes free phone calls within the U.S. A cleaning fee of $65 is charged to cover the costs of cleaning your room after you check out. You are responsible for making your own beds, washing your dishes, washing your towels (if you need to do so during your stay). Laundry soap and dish soap are best purchased at the local WalMart or Publix, located a few minutes away (quite costly at the resort office). The kitchen is well equipped, although we did not have a frying pan, so cooking an omelette was a bit of a challenge. We did enjoy sitting on the screened in balcony, where we watched the fireworks display at Disney each evening. Free Wi-Fi is available in the clubhouse, but not in the rooms. They were installing Wi-Fi capability in the rooms during our stay, but it was not available when we were there. Be prepared to do a lot of driving when you're here as the resort is off the highway and away from stores and restaurants. However, a quick drive gets you onto 192 or highway 27, where you'll find a Walmart (great for groceries, wine and beer), Target, Publix, Walgreens, etc. Further up hwy 27 is a citrus farm, where you can pick your own oranges. A customized school bus with big mag tires takes you around the grove and through a bog area. If you're busy all day at theme parks and just want to come back to your resort for a drink and a swim, then this is the place for you. The staff is very friendly and the woman selling theme park tickets in the clubhouse was very helpful and took plenty of time to answer all of our questions. One note of concern however: a security guard does NOT man the front gate. As a vehicle approaches, the arm of the gate simply lifts, and you can drive right in to the resort. Other resorts are very strict, and a non-resident cannot enter. However, we did enjoy our stay at the Caribe Cove, but I think next time we'll try another resort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for quiet and relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Ellsie_10
Reviews.Content: The pros-great place, clean, with lots of room. The kitchen is well equipped with everything you need for home away from home. The Staff is friendly, the grounds are beautiful, and the pool area is very nice. The balcony is also a great addition. The cons- if you look closely you can see wear on the carpeting and living room furniture. And as many others have said, the beds are not super comfortable, but not horrible either, just a little soft and lumpy. This was not a big problem, and for the price we got way more than we expected. Wish they had pool rules, specifically NO Smoking, and NO Foul Language. The obscene language showed up with the spring breakers the first week of March. But we would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodations, other area's lack”
Reviews.Author: flutterby238
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property from 2/23/12 - 2/27/12 in 4-304. I loved the 3 bedroom suite. It was clean and comfortable. However they advertise free wifi but it's only available in the lobby. There is an Ethernet cable in the room but it only works part of the time. This place is more like renting a condo there is no maid service. However you do have to pay for a Maid to come clean the room after you leave. On the day of check out I left my video camera in the master bedroom in a drawer with the charger. I called as I was on my way home and asked them to check the room. I was told "lost and found" was gone for the day and to leave a message and they would call me back. I did that and did not hear from anyone until I called the following Friday. When I spoke to the woman in lost and found she stated there was no camera turned in. I said to her maybe they did check the drawer like I asked. She said that they have to check every drawer and than an inspector will go through and check every drawer after the cleaning crew. She stated she would check with the inspector and cleaning crew and get back to me. About 4 hours later she called me back and said neither the inspector or cleaning crew saw a camera. So I said either you think I'm lying to you or You have a thief working for you and if they didn’t take it than they didn’t do their job and check all the drawers. I asked her if the room had been rented since my departure which she said it was and there is nothing more she could do. I then proceeded to try and get a hold of a Property Manager or GM , they don’t have either just a director of maintenance. Which I have called 3 times always got the voicemail and only one return call which I missed and called back immediately, with no response. It has now been almost a month and I have yet to speak to anyone from this property. This is not how someone should do business! Also the washer in the room is broken and ruined a large load of my clothes. It stayed on agitating my clothes the entire day we were gone. All and all if the camera incident wouldn’t have happened I would have probably stayed there again. I know it’s my fault for leaving the camera but someone should have called me back by now! I don’t like the fact you cannot get a hold of anyone at the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort, Friendly staff, beds were not good”
Reviews.Author: Mag5605
Reviews.Content: We stayed (4 adults and 4 children) at the resort in March for 6 nights and had the 3 bedroom apartment booked First of all, I would like to say that the hotel itself was very clean and well presented, and the front desk staff were very friendly and professional. The apartments was exactly like the pictures, the kitchen was well equipped and clean. The only reason we did not give this resort a five rating because the mattresses were very bad - not comfortable at all. One of the twin beds made a very loud noise

Reviews.Title: “Great resort-great deal!”
Reviews.Author: SunshineEastCoast
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caribe Cove for 8 nights in February and we were very pleased with the resort. We booked a 2 bedroom villa and they upgraded us to a three. The villa we had was very clean (carpet was soiled in a few places but nothing too bad). Bathrooms immaculate. Two of the three bedrooms had screened porches (one had table and chairs for 4). Nice for sitting out at night to have a drink. The location is sort of away from most things off Irlo Bronson Memorial Highway 192 but we liked that because it gives you less traffic noise. Target, Walmart, Publix, etc. all very close (within 3-4 minute drive) for picking up groceries or items you might need. I am not sure why there are many reviews on here about how uncomfortable the beds are because we did not experience that at all. We had comfort!! The pool area is small but lovely. We enjoyed it. The only negative comment we would make is the wifi is not great. They should have it available in the villas instead of only in the main clubhouse lobby. It doesn't work even outside the clubhouse door by the pool. We would definitely book Caribe Cove again and likely will for our next Florida vacation. We are very picky when it comes to accomodations and I can assure you for the money, this place is a steal.

Reviews.Title: “GEM OF A RESORT”
Reviews.Author: NYSeniorTraveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent value, very clean and spacious - everything we needed, only had to buy our own food (many stores nearby). Staff was especially friendly and helpful, printed directions to get around. Would definitely return, the extra fees are worth it and we were aware via internet. Very nice pool with plenty of room, the resort is one big bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely AMAZING value!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: eharm
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Caribe Cove Resort Orlando for 4 nights in late January / early February 2012 during our quick trip to the Orlando area. We selected Caribe Cove in a flight / accommodation combination package online. We paid an outrageously low price per night, and thus we were a little anxious as a result (low price = low quality??) But this was just the opposite!! The resort is definitely UNDER priced and underrated. We had a large condo (the regular one), with 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. One bathroom had a jacuzzi tub, the rooms were a/c, the kitchen was fully equipped (we don't even have a dishwasher at home!!), there were 2 patios, high ceilings, a great cable selection, etc etc. It was absolutely amazing. The staff were helpful, the pool and gym were great, and it was conveniently located to Disney (approx 10 minutes by car). We can't wait to go back again and haven't stopped raving about it since we got back.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING except for the BEDS!”
Reviews.Author: sacajewea
Reviews.Content: My family of seven stayed for two nights at Caribe Cove just 10 min. east of Disney off 192. It was one of the nicest resorts visually in the area, yellow and sunny, great pool and grounds. It was immaculately clean, spacious, and except for a "toy" coffee maker, was very well put together. Except for all the beds; with old used box springs(no springs), creaky boards, thin soft mattresses, the beds WERE UNSLEEPABLE! My husband and I took the bedframe and box base and leaned it up against the wall and slept on the mattress on the floor. After much traveling, first time we had to do that! Complained to the front desk upon checking-out, and she said they couldn't do anything about them, because the units "were individually owned". I explained that my husband and I were owners of a "vacation rentals" business for 15 years, and had to replace mattresses on a regular basis. So we were "in the know." I asked for the manager, but he "was out with the flu." So don't stay in Bldg. 1, Room 502, until they change the mattresses!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Bookit .com found us a home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: Wilbur B
Reviews.Content: As a travel Agent I think it is the cleanest resort i've seen in a long time! My family is still at the resort and they love it!!. The beds can use some work but over all very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Bookit.com found us this amazing home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: UAtraveller
Reviews.Content: We booked our 2bd at book it.com and got a bonus upgrade to the 3bd. These units are massive. I think 1000sf. We stayed 5 nights with resort and cleaning fees adding $109. Big deal. The value is very much worth it. They stock just the basics so it's up to you to provision yourself or purchase extras from the clubhouse. Items were around $1 ea. also supertarget is a couple blocks away. The place is immaculate with security and friendly staff. The unit (1-404) was clean with ample pillows, blankets , high chair, playpen and quality kitchen items. We are worldmark by wyndham vacation club owners, have stayed in sheratons vistanna's and many other RCI vacation condo's. This one was among the best ! Bookit.com or Priceline this one for a great vacation home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: bisdaknj
Reviews.Content: Since a common complaint is that people are not aware of the following, please let me start my review by informing potential readers that there is a resort fee (we were charged $101 or so), and they put a $200 hold on my credit card for incidental charges which they release upon checkout. They only provide ground coffee for the first day's stay. I have also read complaints about running out of toilet paper, but my husband says that there were extra rolls under the bathroom sinks. There was no dishwashing liquid but they did provide a cleaning tablet for the dishwasher. We spent 5 days-4 nights in Caribe Cove, the main purpose of our visit being the Disney parks. The apartment we were in was a 2 bed/2 bath ground floor apartment, which made it very convenient for us when we had to bring in the groceries or come home after a very very long day at the parks. We loved that the resort had a homey feeling vs a hotel feel. The apartment itself was clean, had more than enough space for the 4 of us, we had a kitchen, NOT a kitchenette. The screened porch gave us a chance to eat breakfast or just read the paper outside. The bedrooms were large, the beds were comfortable, our apt had walk in closets with hangers provided. We used the washing machine and dryer a lot. As for the resort not providing ground coffee every morning, we were fortunate enough to be so close to the club house, all my husband had to do was walk over there every morning and get two cups of coffee (FREE). Internet-wise, no wi-fi in the units but they provided the cable for the hook-up for the laptop (forgive the simplistic terms, i am not tech-savvy). Location-wise, this resort is close to everything: grocery stores are only about 1-2 mi east or west on Highway 192. All the Disney parks are about a 10 min drive. They had a small exercise room with only a handful of machines, the pool looked very inviting and not crowded at all. Sadly, we were not able to enjoy any of these due to our limited number of days in Orlando. My husband's only complaint is that there was no grill. It would have been perfect if there was one, even if it is for the whole building or even the whole resort. But this does not deter us at all from recommending this resort to our friends or from us wanting to go back to this resort the next time we visit Orlando. This truly was our home away from home for close to a week.

Reviews.Title: “Big, lots of room. Early check out times.”
Reviews.Author: AshandJer
Reviews.Content: These are condos and very spacious. If you have an extended stay in Orlando doing theme parks or whatever these would be nice for more of a home feel. They have washers and dryers in them, which for an extended stay is handy. A full kitchen. We had a 3 bedroom villa, it was very roomy and the big tub in the master was nice after a long day at Disney. Now for the bad. The beds are SUPER uncomfortable. Like springs with nothing on them at all. I could not sleep comfortable the 2 nights we were there. The check-in time is super late, 4pm. Much later than any regular hotel. They were sticklers and would not let us check in early. Even though you could tell there was hardly anyone staying there. Then the check-out time is super early, 10 a.m. We did get an extended check-out time until 11 a.m. But a maid came in twice during 10-11 trying to kick us out. There is a cleaning fee of $65 and resort fees and tax. Our base rate was cheap, but if you only stayed one night that would not be a good deal. The extra fees are sort of hidden, in the fine print. So beware. Also it it pretty far off I4, there are some short cuts to Disney, but not as close as it seemed in the hotel info. All in all this would be a good place for an extended stay. But they REALLY need to update the beds.

Reviews.Title: “101 USD in extra fees”
Reviews.Author: Il_Duce73
Reviews.Content: My wife and I live in the Orlando area, and we booked this hotel on Booking.com for a one-night getaway. The clearly listed "Total Price" listed on booking.com was $81.45 plus 13% tax and a 5.95 service charge. No big deal, except that they had 101 USD in fees hidden in the "Important Information" section. Anyways, both booking.com and the establishment say that the misleading advertising is the fault of the other party. A convenient relationship. After about 30 minutes, we had the fees reduced to 60 USD; It probably isn't a big deal if you are staying for two weeks as it is a one-time fee, but on a one night stay it almost doubled our cost. I'm writing the review so that others don't get caught in the same trap. Overall, the place was nice but the experience with the extra fees put a damper on the evening. The thing that irritates me the most is the attitude that both booking.com and the hotel took, denying responsibility for the way they advertised the room.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat this option for Orlando accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: Canada1lb
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from my first stay at this property, having recently purchased a condo here, where I took my parents on their first ever trip to Florida! This place made a great first impression! I am very happy to say that my stay here was just as impressive as my visits to view before the purchase! Our condo is a spacious 3 bedroom, 1600 square feet of living space. www.sunvillas.ca Master ensuite is huge, with large double sink vanity, jacuzzi tub, and large tiled shower. Patio door opens from 2 bedrooms to a screened balcony. Balcony overlooks wooded area, and is very serene. Yes, the beds are not the most comfortable, but many owners, including us, are in the process of upgrading to a great quality Simmons mattress in all rooms. Kitchen is very well equipped, including ice maker and filtered water in the fridge door. Having the full size washer and dryer is a huge advantage as well. Our unit does have free WiFi, which is a huge advantage to us, as the whole family travels with their laptops! The whole condo was immaculate for our arrival, and the starter supplies are sufficient. With the kitchen facilities there, you will want to visit one of the grocery stores nearby to have things on hand for your conveneince. Its also a good idea to bring things with you for your stay, like dishwasher tablets, laundry detergent, etc, if you will only need a small amount, as that would simplify what you need to purchase. The front desk was very helpful to our every inquiry. The resort fee of $5.95 / day covers free calls, DVD rentals, etc, but clients booking through an owner there have the choice to pay it or not, if they wish to avail of these services. The cleaning fee is mandatory, regardless of the number of nights, which may make a 2 or 3 night rental seem more expensive - but a cleaning fee for a condo is pretty standard, so should not be surprising. From other reviews here, it seems that folks who book through third party operators like Bookit or Expedia types are not informed of it, which is where the problem lies, not with the resort, as this is clearly outlined on their website. Overall a great stay - and excellent value for the money for all travellers!

Reviews.Title: “High Benefit-to-Cost ratio”
Reviews.Author: JackSparrow22
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing--especially for the price! As soon as I opened the door to the "villa", I knew that all the great reviews for this place were not unfounded. It completely felt like a very clean, spacious 2-bedroom apartment (which is why I put "villa" in quotations--it's really just a nice apartment, but I guess that's what a small villa is anyway). Most noteworthy is that the villas are nearly fully stocked--you get your basics such as soap, shampoo/conditioner, towels, beach towels, iron, hair dryer, and you also get a fully stocked kitchen with plates, glasses, silverware, microwave, coffee-maker, full-size fridge, toaster, pots/pans, and a washer/dryer! So this place is *clearly* bank for families looking to save money on things like eating out. They do not have extra luxuries like toothpaste, disposable toothbrushes, razors, shaving cream, etc., but that's just something useful to know in advance, not something you actually need them to provide. Also, there's a Target just a mile away, so you can easily pick up other extra amenities like dishwashing soap (which they provide a very small packet of), extra coffee/tea (they provide a small hotel-sized pack of these things with the coffee maker, but not a large amount). Anyway, since lots of people have already commented on other awesome specifics of this place, I just want to throw a couple of the negative things about this place out there because I didn't realize their significance earlier. First, know that they charge you a one-time $65 cleaning fee at the end of your stay (in addition to the $5.95+tax nightly resort fee), which is a significant charge and should really be advertised up front in the cost of the place (I didn't know about it until after I had made the non-refundable booking, but this place was still more cost-effective than all the other places we were looking at for a party of 5 people, so I didn't throw a fit about it). Obviously then, if you are thinking about reserving for a few nights versus longer, choose the longer stay so that you can maximize this charge; they do not however clean your place on a daily basis, so whatever mess you make is yours to live in for the duration of the rental! Second, lots of other people have said this, but I have to say this again because it is so significant--the beds suck. Everyone in my group was shocked that everything looks so great from the outside and they clearly invested a lot in decorations, etc., but they couldn't invest in good mattresses? (which is actually one of the most important things on a trip--a comfortable bed for a good night's rest after a busy day). Anyway, we all woke up with back-aches in the morning. Luckily, the location is very quiet and you can adjust they temperature in the apartments, so those other types of things that contribute to quality of sleep were very much intact. Lastly, Wi-Fi is free in the reception area, but you have to use ethernet in your room. If you want to use their computer in the lobby, you have to pay for it (which I thought was weird). The staff wasn't really that friendly, but they answered whatever questions you had in a succinct manner. Yes, parking is very much free. They offer tea and coffee for free in the lobby. Overall, despite the few negative things, the cost-effectiveness of this place won out hands down and I would definitely go back and stay here again. There's no doubt you get your money's worth, and the accommodations are indeed very nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Family of 6!”
Reviews.Author: TheSchu's
Reviews.Content: We hate that they have such a late check-in (4pm), we were there at noon and told that our room would be ready at 1pm, so we went to do groceries and when we came back at 1pm, we were told that 4pm our room would be ready. It was a warm day, so we had to keep the van running with the air on until 3:30pm, when our room was ready. We learned our lesson of not trusting people when they give you a time. The rooms need some tlc, the tv in our bedroom was broken, we called twice for a service call, and what ever they did worked for 10minutes at the most. We had a broken lamp, lamps with missing parts & an outlet in the bathroom that didn't work. The balconies are wonderful, but you have to wear shoes. Lots of space in the units, but if you have noisy neighbours the walls and ceilings are very thin. I was up until 2 am listening to our above neighbours scream and yell at each other. The pool is nice, and the hot tub is very warm. They also have a gym and sauna. The pool & hot tub is closed as soon as dusk approaches. There is only wi-fi internet in the lobby. They do have a dvd rental program that is included, which we used a couple of times. The dishwashers are very old, so are the stoves and microwaves, but I imagine that they will update sometime soon. Our stove took 1/2hour to preheat, pretty bad. Our kids slept great every night, the washer & dryer were used a lot and so were the bath tubs. The vacuum that was there had not had the bag emptied in ages and was bursting at the seams, called for a new one, but it never came. There is some customer service lacking, but with some little improvements it would be top of the line.

Reviews.Title: “Great Orlando Vacation Rental”
Reviews.Author: Christiana0564
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Orlando, We booked a three bedroom vacation rental privately through my husband's collegue. The condo was very clean and tons of room, it was great for us because we all had our own bedrooms. Two of them with walk out sliders on to a screened in porch. Full kitchen, washer and dryer and two TVs. Internet was available in room, but not wireless. The only thing negative I have to say is that the beds were not the best, but not horrible either. The clubhouse was nice; however we didn't spend any time there. Its was about a half hour drive to Orlando and 15 minutes to the the theme parks. We loved the peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort - bad beds”
Reviews.Author: vijaypurbhe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in January 2012. We booked a 2 bedroom suite. Very spacious, clean and new. Very close to the Disney parks (3-5 miles). Very affordable, even after considering the cleaning fees and resort fees. My only gripe is with the beds. Beds in both the bedrooms were cheap and made a lot of noise whenever we twisted and turned. Other than that, this resort is a great bang for your buck.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, lovely appartment, wifi ONLY at clubhouse and pool”
Reviews.Author: A_ARROWSMITH
Reviews.Content: Apologies for delay in posting (stayed here April 2010) Room, lovely. Well spaced, beds comfy, balcony large enough Bathrooms nice and large too Master bath huge bath, etc. WIFI only at pool/clubhouse. NOT in apartments Pool was WARM and we were alone MOST days. Although this resort was VERY newly opened. If the place was booked out the pool would definitely be far too small. Shop was OK, expensive but had the essentials Parking is plentiful & car is ESSENTIAL as the 192 is the nearest place for any outlet or convenience. Elevator was OUT OF ORDER for 2 days and we were on the top floor. Only 1 elevator per block so NOT good news for our 65 year old mother :( All in all, we would go again

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jamie m
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to the theme parks, It was my gift to my girls who are 11 and 9. I did so much research on tips and advise on what to do and what not to do. I came across reviews on the Caribe Cove Resort and there was a lot of negative things said about it. I decided to take my chances because the price was right. we were super impressed when we got there. The hotel was very clean and tons of room, it was great for us because we all had our own bedrooms with walk out sliders on to a screened in porch. The only thing negative I have to say is that the beds were not very cozy. The pool was nice, not giant but nice. Its was about a half hour drive to Orlando but worth the peach and quite. We cant wait to go back, Caribe Cove will be our spot to stay from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Cleaning Fee!”
Reviews.Author: westgatedirector
Reviews.Content: I booked this resort on Bookit.com and was surprised to find out about all of the etceteras that were added once I got there. My hotel room cost $140 for 2 nights and the additional fees were $75. I checked with both Bookit and the hotel itself and these fees are not clearly marked. I live in Tampa and stay in Orlando regularly for the weekend. I have never experienced cleaning fees like these. Stay at the Parc Corniche for a great condo with a reasonable cleaning fee.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely marvellous”
Reviews.Author: philf2
Reviews.Content: I read many reviews on this resort and frankly don't want to be inside the heads of those that gave it negative ratings. It can't be a pleasant place to be. This resort is one of the deals of the century. For less than $100 per night, all-in, taxes, resort and cleaning fees included, we got an approximate 1,600 sq. ft. three bedroom apartment with large screened balconies and a full kitchen. Have paid more for hotel rooms that were so small I had to go outside to change my mind. There are two large bathrooms and three televisions. The resort also has a nice swimming pool, small exercise room, free movie rentals, free coffee and computers in the office, sauna, steam room and a small store to buy some necessities. Front desk staff were first class, super friendly and helpful. We were upgraded from a two bedroom to a three at no extra charge. If you want to buy stamps or mail letters, they help with that. There was even a nice touch of some of the towels folded to look like swans on the master bed. The only thing I could think to improve would be the internet connection which forces you to sit near the TV to get access.

Reviews.Title: “Caribe Cove Resort - Very spacious”
Reviews.Author: samcc1
Reviews.Content: I booked Caribe Cove resort through a special by bookit.com. This was an amazing deal at $68.00 per night. My suite was 2 bedroom and 1400 sq feet of living space. It was very clean, spacious, high ceilings and the fridgerator even had an icemaker. Kitchen was equipped with everything you could need. The resort did charge me an extra $134.00 for house cleaning and gratuities, but over all, the best deal anywhere around for my 7 days. No parking charges, internet was free, but lan connection only in living room. Wifi was only available in receprion area, no big deal... all good. Free coffee available, no continental breakfast, but for what you get, I was not at all surprised. Shopping is also close by, super target there for groceries and anythging else. Plenty of restaurants along highway 192. Large outdoor swimming pool, and jacuzi with plenty of reclining chairs to soak up the sun.. Caribe Cove is very similar to Bahama Bay. I would pick Bahama Bay for restaurant, larger facility to walk around. I highly recommend Caribe Cove..

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort - sorry, but bad bad beds!”
Reviews.Author: BettyBoopWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: We were happily surprised when we walked in to our room...3 bedrooms, two very large bathrooms, balconies all around and a lovely fully equipped kitchen and laundry room. Couldnt believe how big the master bedroom/bathroom was! Our disappointment came at bedtime when we crawled into the huge king size bed and felt the springs! We got used to it somehow, but if the hotel put new mattresses and bedding in, it would be perfect! For such a lovely resort, I was shocked at the state of the mattresses. The pool area was great, although a bit small for the size of the resort. But, overall no complaints except the mattress.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, HORRID beds..”
Reviews.Author: CanadianGolfer945
Reviews.Content: I had seen all of the complaints about the beds prior to booking our 1 week stay at Caribe Cove but I thought perhaps it wasn't "that bad". I went down with a friend and I had the short straw in the bedroom lottery (2 bedroom unit) so I had the two twin beds and my friend had the room with the king bed. I'm a small person (115 pounds) so I don't much compress any mattress, but these didn't need to be compressed to be uncomfortable! Springs on the surface all but poking through and the noisiest box springs I've ever heard. Every time I flipped or flopped to try to pretzel myself around the sticking out springs I would wake myself up with the box spring noises. I could hear every time my friend rolled over in the other room due to his box spring noises. Just awful, really, and all we wanted to do was sleep well after being on the golf courses every day for a week. I complained on check out and was told that there is a new management company that will be replacing all of the beds in two weeks time, (if true that's early Feb, 2012). My suggestion would be to call and ask if this has happened before you book. Otherwise, the furniture is dated and not very comfortable but not awful. Clean inside the apt and around the resort. We were on the 3rd floor and didn't see any bugs. Drains in our unit were slow (tub mostly) and toilet plugging happened to us and our neighbours but they do provide a plunger in every unit! ;-) The kitchen was very well appointed but the cleaning staff don't leave a thing behind for the next people (in part to supplement their incomes I'm sure), so be prepared to bring your own everything - from laundry and dish detergent to salt, pepper, sugar for your coffee, condiments, etc. etc. There are no cleaning supplies in the units so you can't just give your sink, tub or dishes a quick scrub. Close to Walmart, Publix and a Super Target and tons of restaurants yet on the edge of the noise and confusion in the west end. The internet is wired with only wireless in the clubhouse. We brought a wireless router so that iPads and tablets could be used in the unit... it was very nice to have, and doesn't take much room in your suitcase. I would recommend this property to friends and would return myself but for the BEDS. I would appreciate knowing from another reviewer if they've been replaced as promised.. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet condo resort”
Reviews.Author: Edenfamily88
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. The condos are very quiet and the rooms are very nice. We loved our full kitchen and two full bathrooms. We stayed in the 3 bedroom and it was the size of a nice house inside. The only downfall was the 65$ cleaning surcharge and the "heated" pool was FREEZING cold.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: kaydayAlabama
Reviews.Content: Staying there as I write this. Hidden fees .. Overpriced considering beds are hard and livingroom furn is wicker not comfy. Fairly spacious. Pool says heated but seemed not to be. Desk staff was ok. Was supposed to be in a 3 br but got put in a 2! Condo wasnt very clean. Sauna and steam room were nice. Overall there are much better deals around Orlando/ Kissimmee.

Reviews.Title: “bring your own toilet paper”
Reviews.Author: DSKing
Reviews.Content: As mentioned in other reviews we paid the resort fee and the cleaning fee. At the time it did not seem to be unreasonable, until after we found out what level of service we received. When we have paid such fees at time shares, the service and resort was worth the extras. The resort is a very nice property. The lawns are clipped and cleaned, the driveways and parking lots are very well kept. The exterior of the buildings look promising, polished and tidy. Then you get inside. Dated colors, dated applicances, dated furniture, limited appeal. The DVD player and TV are basic bargin units. Wi-Fi should be a basic funtion of any resort, but not here. Maybe Apple will make an Ipad you can plug in to an ethernet cable someday. A call to the front desk for additional towels was denied. They have already stocked the room with a sufficent number of towles, no more was nessecary. A request for toilet paper, resulted in directions to a shoppng center to purchase our own. What was the resort fee for???? Nice quiet resort, big spacious rooms, close to the places you want to visit, but the 80's are are gone, and I have no desire to revisit. Next time we will find resort from the current decade.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, would book this trip again in a minute”
Reviews.Author: Toni L
Reviews.Content: This was a great trip for my family, we traveled with 3 adults and 3 children. It was so nice to have extra rooms for the kids to sleep in, and the two bathrooms was also great for getting ready in the mornings. I had read reviews about the hotel, and those who complained were obvioulsy people who like to complain. I have nothing bad to say, from the moment we checked in Lisette, the desk clerk, was so friendly and welcoming. The beds were hard but not noisy or uncomfortable. The kitchen was stocked with anything I needed to make simple meals. Close to anything that we needed. I loved the screened in balcony. I can not say enough good about this hotel. The internet was not wireless, but suited our needs. We were in building 5 on the first floor.

Reviews.Title: “Very large rooms!”
Reviews.Author: DaveCalgary
Reviews.Content: Hi We rented a 3 room condo. It was HUGE with lots of space for all of us. The place was pretty clean but the carpets were dirty. we knew about all the charges up front so there were no surprises. the laundry room was good to have. The pool seemed nice and we were close to Walmart, Target, and other stores. It was about 10 min to Disney and 25 or so to Universal. We did have access to wireless internet but it was not that strong of a signal. I think it is better in the club house. Also you need to bring laundry soap, dishwasher soap, salt, pepper, etc etc We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: Lee M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 weeks and was not disappointed. We had a 3 bedroom apartment on the 3rd floor of one of the buildings nearer to the lake at the rear of the complex.....it was very quiet and clean. The rooms were nice and large with all the facilities we needed for cooking in when the need arose. Only disappointing thing about the rooms was that internet access was only via ethernet...would be so much better if you didnt have to walk up to the clubhouse to get the wifi. It was nice to have a little convenience shop on site and the option to rent dvd's at no extra cost proved handy when trying to occupy our son in the evenings. The onsite pool was clean and nice to use although perhaps a little on the small side. The resort itself was no more than a 10-15 minute drive to the Disney parks and was very close to a Target supermarket and many other shops and restaurants. Would recomment this to friends and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Ret40
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for twenty nights and were very pleased with it. Ideally I would give it a 4.5. Large, very clean apartments. Ours was on 4th floor and had three bedrooms and well stocked kitchenette, two bathrooms and small balcony. The swimming pool is clean and close to reception so you can get soft drinks and snacks nearby as well as free coffee. It's not a Hotel but apartments so you need to food stock etc. They give you abundant towels and huge clothes washing machines. Yes the mattresses need changed but that seems common in many Orlando holiday outlets. The annoying fees are fairly common now in many places but are clear hen booking. They do however make it bad value for one or two nights but good for long stay. However daily fee includes free calls and Internet. Annoyingly free wifi is only by pool and reception. So it's a spacious, clean and well looked after place in a location that is safe and near to the main parks, with ample parking. Reception staff were always polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Good Nights Sleep”
Reviews.Author: yfriends1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed several places in Kissimmee - and we thought to try this one because of the price. I would have to say - that if you have back problems or even if you don't you should look somewhere else. There is no daily maid service - even though they charged us additional $140 when we got there. This was to include the maid service. There were limited accessories in the kitchen we went to Wally World and bought what we needed. About another $100. And the beds were the worst. It made the whole trip painful. A good nights rest is important if you are going to be up all day walking the parks. It is centrally located - and the price is average - but keep in mind what I stated above. Good luck and go Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Great place with horrible beds”
Reviews.Author: visitortraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caribe Cove for 10 days. The two bedrooms were spacious and clean. The washer and dryer came in very handy. There were plenty of toilet (4 rolls) and paper towel (2 rolls) to last our stay. The kitchen was fully equipped. We had to bring our own cleaning supply, detergent/dryer sheet, hair dryer and shampoo/conditioner. You do need to take out your own trash and recycling stuff to the bins on the ground level. We found one recycling bin located near the elevator while trash bins are more abundant around. The check in and check out procedures were rather painless and the receptionist was very helpful. Just be sure you know about all the mandatory fees in addition to the negotiated rate - $5.95 DVD rental per day, $65 cleaning for the duration of the stay, no matter how many days, and $200 deposit that would be refunded at checkout. The reason for the two stars instead of the 4 or 5 stars others gave is because the beds in our unit were terrible. I don't mean they were old, I mean they were horrible. You could feel the spring just by touching them lightly. There was absolutely no cushion on top and all of them sink to the bottom if you sit on them. Even the Salvation Army would not want something like this. When our kids tossed around at night in the other room, we thought there were strange creatures in the wild looming in our unit. We finally realized the noise was from their beds. We flipped all the beds, hoping the other side would be just a little more bearable. I had to pop three cushions from the sofa in the living room under the sheet of our king size bed in order for my husband to sleep. But since he could not turn or toss sleeping on those cushions, he was all stiff in the morning. With that kind of beds, naturally we did not have any good night of sleep and our vacation fell short of being pleasant. Whoever commented the beds were comfortable in this property must be fortunate enough to stay in a unit with good beds. All in all, if you don't mind the horrible beds, this is a good place to call home while vacationing in Orlando. If you do want to get a good night of sleep, I would not recommend it. When I was asked how my stay was during checkout, I said the beds were terrible. Apparently she had already heard that many times. I said I hope they would do something about them. She said management is aware of the issue and the beds will eventually be replaced. When it will happen is another story. So definitely call and ask if bed replacing has been done if you are considering to stay in this place.

Reviews.Title: “Caribe Cove is the place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: alicia k
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 9 days last month. It's was amazing. We stayed in the Aruba condo and loved everything about this place. It was in a fantastic area and only 10 minutes from Disney World. Check in and out was super easy and the staff was extremely helpful. I hope to stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “You MUST stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Sandra D
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caribe Cove for our family's first trip to Disney. Loved it! Great location, only minutes from all Disney parks. We had a 3 bedroom unit in Building 1. The unit was extremely clean and well-equipped. Management staff were extremely helpful when we had questions about accessing the internet in our room. They also printed our boarding passes for us, and helped us make dinner reservations at Raglan Road (go there- so much fun!!) in Downtown Disney. We will definitely be returning to Caribe Cove next year. Loved it at Caribe Cove!

Reviews.Title: “Disney World Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Theresa M
Reviews.Content: I wanted to share our experience our stay at Caribe Cove Resort in Orlando. Today is our last day and I'm feeling quite sad that we're leaving this wonderful resort. The staff were some of the friendliest I've ever encounter. They were also pleasant and courteous. We are staying in the 3-bedroom resort which was more than enough for our guests. The bedrooms were extra large, especially the master bedroom; the bathrooms were seriously roomy. I didn't want to leave out of the sunken spa tub. It was glorious!!!! It was wonderful having all our cookware, dinnerware, utensils, bowls, glasses, etc at our convenience. Disney World's food can be quite expensive so it was nice being able to cook breakfast and dinner at the resort upon our return. I woiuld recommend Caribe Cove for anyone looking to stay at a 5-star resort for 1/2 the price. If you want a bargain, look no further. This is our new home away from home when visiting Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Will not return....”
Reviews.Author: Ann T
Reviews.Content: We have vacationed at many Orlando resorts....the Caribe Cove Resort does offer convenience to the parks, but the staff leaves much to be desired, especially the management. The resort itself, (on the outside) is well kept and we had a great view from our large lanai, however, the condo itself smelled old and musty. I had to buy a candle and spray to mask the odor. The furniture was dated and the beds were so incredibly uncomfortable and loud...every time you moved, it would creak and squeak so loudly, it would wake you up (I am a very hard sleeper). The carpet was matted and dirty and it just did not feel clean. They advertise low rates..but then they tack on the $65 cleaning fee and the resort charges and it is not that "great" of a deal. We should have known when the resort was practically empty. Unless you are desperate...pay a little more and stay somewhere closer and cleaner. I would not recommend this place and we will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: bpeterson7731
Reviews.Content: My family spent 10 days in early december at the Caribe Cove Resort. We got a package deal through travelocity. This place was fantastic very clean and quite we had a 2 bed 2 bath suite. We have stayed at other condos in the Orlando area and they were great but can not even come close to the Caribe Cove Resort. My daughter and wife saw 2 gators in the pond near the pool. Close to Disney and other attractions off 192. Great restuarants nearby Beacon Deli and Giordano's. The only issue I can see is the security guard was never really in the guard shack the gates were just open or someone from inside the office would open them I guess. We will definately plan on being back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for a good spot”
Reviews.Author: Karina D
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Kissimmee, where we stayed at Caribe Cove. Overall it was a great experience. We got an awesome deal and I was a little worried that it might not be quite as nice as it seemed online...but it was. Big and spacious, three bedrooms, two bathrooms, comfy beds..older furnature, but in good condition. Friendly staff and beautiful grounds. The pool closes at dusk, which was a bit of a shame, and there is no housekeeping services if that matters to you. The kitchen was fully stocked. And CLEAN. I would certainly go back. Super Target and Super Walmart very close by too, which was very convienient!

Reviews.Title: “Great self catering resort”
Reviews.Author: sueandjason26
Reviews.Content: Returned for second year to Caribe Cove and we were not disappointed. Clean, well equipped and spacious condos. Few minor issues but maintenance and house keeping staff came as soon as needed, without delay and eager to help. Special mention to WInetta on reception for being so friendly and helpful. The only negative is the uncomfortable beds, which I believe they are addressing. Perfectly situated for the parks, restaurants and shopping, but just as enjoyable chilling by the pool. Looking to return already!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: CindyDianne66
Reviews.Content: We could not believe how spacious this place was. Huge bedrooms and bathrooms, large kitchen and dining area - you won't get in each other's way in this place :) Beds were not the most comfortable I've slept in and squeaked quite a bit, but we still slept well. We were visiting Disney and it was only about 6 miles away. We never found the time to use the pool or other amenities. On a nice, quiet side street off the main road with everything you need within a couple of miles - gas, grocery stores, restaurants, gift shops, etc. Condo was equipped with pretty much anything you might need. Nice and quiet, spacious, friendly staff - who could ask for more?!

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not great”
Reviews.Author: Carrie D
Reviews.Content: The condo was very spacious and a welcome change from our usual hotel rooms. However, there were several minor things broken - several light fixtures didn't work or were broken. We called maintenance and they fixed what they could, but at the end of our stay, we are still waiting for a master bedroom light. :/ The pull out couch bed was broken and the mattresses were all HORRIBLE. The floor was more comfortable than the pull out, and all the beds creaked and squeaked. The kitchen supplies were minimal (one SMALL baking sheet for a three bedroom condo). The scissors were broken and we had to ask for towels. The bathrooms were large and pretty clean (although, I don't understand why most places choose white). The carpets were okay, not great, not horrible. The dishwasher and washer/dryer were the LOUDEST ones we have ever encountered. You couldn't hear the TV when the dishwasher ran. The placement of vents between the bedrooms and living room were inconvenient because you could hear almost everything going on. Our main TV was broken and wouldn't work all the time. And yes, we made several calls to maintenance. Several of the dresser drawers were broken, as well. The vertical blinds were broken too and kept falling off when we tried to open and close them. We weren't told about the $65 cleaning fee until we arrived. Not a big deal, but you should be told about that when making the reservation. The lack of soap, AND NO SPONGE AT KITCHEN SINK, toilet paper, paper towels, etc should also be told upfront. They should supply you with a list of items in the rooms so you can make sure you buy the appropriate supplies before getting there. The worst was the front desk. They couldn't tell us where anything was located. In fact, they couldn't even tell us where the nearest ER/urgent care center was when our son became extremely sick in the middle of the night. And they couldn't tell us where a pharmacy was either. Every resort should have those things at the front desk. Not the greatest place to stay, but not the worst either. Not sure if we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect vacationresort!”
Reviews.Author: MrsGreco83
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 week and loved it! The apartments are big and clean! Nice interior and well-equiped kitchens, big bedrooms and bathrooms. Would denfinitly stay here again and recomend this to everone I know going to Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous - trying to book for next year already!”
Reviews.Author: Linda L
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Caribe Cove for 15 nights, just return last wkend. Staff friendly and helpful. Accommodation excellent, beds were creaky but comfortable, ample towels, linen etc. For relaxing days - pool facilities were great, aided by the fact there was free tea and coffee! Free DVD rental was useful in evenings. On day of departure we were able to take some towels from our room, stay by the pool and use the shower facilities in the clubhouse, before dropping towels at reception and heading for airport. We will definately be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: vam0m0f3
Reviews.Content: We had 2 families stay together in a 3 br unit for 5 nights. (10 people) 2 kids in the twin bedroom, 2 kids on the pullout sofa, and 1 in each of the parents bedrooms. This place was very spacious and well equipped. It was clean and tidy. The clubhouse and pool were lovely. The bathrooms were huge! It was so easy to get to Disney and we loved having all the nearby restaurants and souvenier shops along Rt 192. Our only complaint would be the beds (a bit too hard for our taste). Another note: more towel bars or even simple towel hooks would be helpful in the 2 bathrooms. For the price of this place, it really can't be beat! I'd much rather stay in a spacious villa (with full kitchen, living room, and bedrooms) 5 miles from Disney than in a tiny hotel room on Disney property that costs WAY MORE!

Reviews.Title: “A week in Florida”
Reviews.Author: ThePowellsCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Five adults and one child stayed at Caribe cove resorts in October 2011 . Accomodations were great ,booked over the internet was'nt sure what to expect . and was pleasently surprised. Very nice rooms, great staff. Close to theme parks ,15 minutes we were in Disney parking. Walmart only minutes away for groceries. Jeff & Kathy

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: MlleDeVille
Reviews.Content: This place is spectacular especially if you get it for a good rate. My family travels to Orlando every year for Christmas and since we have a member in the family with special needs, the fact that we have multiple bedrooms, bathrooms, fully-equipped kitchen, and washer/dryer in our unit makes this place the perfect home away from home. This place is incredibly clean and well maintained; we've been coming here for four years now and it always looks the same. No bugs, no rodents, and no problems. Regarding noise levels, I'm really impressed; you only hear people when you are in the front bedroom (we have two twin beds in that room) and you really only hear them when they've got kids who are excited to be heading to the parks. Despite our best efforts, my family makes its own fair share of noise with our special needs child and nobody has ever complained about us; the walls are really thick and well-insulated. The only complaint if I had to make one is that the beds are on the cheap side. Still, they are more than serviceable and are comfortable enough. Location-wise, this place is literally right down the road from Disney and you don't run into too much traffic coming home after the parks close because it is in the opposite direction of where most other tourists are headed. The drive to Universal Studios is a bit long, but you can deal with that if you spend some time on Google Maps and figure out the short-cuts to bypass traffic on I-4. We will continue to be coming here in the future and are really looking forward to our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: LaNena0413
Reviews.Content: This place was very comfortable for the 6 of us. Very private and very clean. This was perfect for the long stay we had. The downside, the beds seem too old and hard to sleep on. Other than that, the place was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Huge, nice, clean and comfortable rooms BUT...”
Reviews.Author: tasfamily
Reviews.Content: So we stayed here for 3 nights, got a HUGE 3-bedroom 1,600 sq. ft. room on building 5. The place is great, good location, all is clean, ample parking, absolutely perfect for a family or for a long stay. BUT - there are two problems: - Beds, those beds are old, creaky, uncomfortable, looks like the mattresses were purchased back in 1985. You need to upgrade your mattresses PRONTO. - Curtains, the balcony has a MIGHTY BRIGHT light that filters in at night and cannot be turned off, you need to either shield the rooms from the bright light or put regular curtains, the flimsy vertical blinds don't cut it.

Reviews.Title: “kissimmee's best kept secret”
Reviews.Author: mason35Pa
Reviews.Content: Perfect place I don't know how someone could complain about a place like this! (unless you like to complain)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, shame about the pool..”
Reviews.Author: mikey0416
Reviews.Content: Been to florida 6 times now and we have stayed in caribe cove 2 times..we stayed last year and then again in August, we enjoyed our stay and were mostly out in the day to disney, universal etc..last year I do feel the cleanliness of the pool was a lot better than in August. The pool guy could have done a lot better this past visit, we would see the guy come in and just leave within 10 minutes of being there, and we would be looking at the pool beside ourselves as to how he believed the pool was clean. The tiles were filthy, my son actually wrote his name in the dirt. The chlorine in the pool stung my eyes every time I used it, so I just stopped using it..its not a place I would go back to because I also felt the beds were so extremely uncomfortable. I need my bed to actually be soft, they are rock hard and I could barely sleep after a long day at the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: linda f
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caribe Cove from 12th of Sept for 3 weeks and really liked it. The apartment was really huge and the beds were really comfortable the grounds and pool area were well maintained. And would love to come back to Caribe Cove if ever we come to Orlando again.

Reviews.Title: “Wondering where others have stayed to rave about this?”
Reviews.Author: usssa1
Reviews.Content: Check in was easy enough,(had 8 rooms reserved) but when we got to our rooms the twin beds were for children only and the furniture was broken down. Asked to move to all 3 br and were accomodated for the price difference. Furniture was still broken down, but managed to stay in 7 of the reservations and work it out. Televisions are from decades ago and dvd players would never work, which didn't matter since the free dvd rentals in the lobby were not working anyway. Checked out of one of our condos and switched to another location and the manager on duty wouild not refund our deposit even though their continuously running hold message says they guarantee 100% satisfaction. Mr. Vasquez refused to work with us so our next trip this month we will be staying in another resort with our 8 condo reservations for 6 nights. Front desk personnel worked great with us and were very understanding and believed we would get refund on the one room with no problem, but were shocked when Mr. Vasquez refused to work with us.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: Kim P
Reviews.Content: We have just spent the past 10 days at Caribe Cove, and I have to say, it is AWESOME! I was dubious of what to expect having only heard of Caribe Cove via Trip Advisor and fully aware that things are not always what they seem. But from the moment we opened the door to our condo, we were thrilled. It was meticulously clean, very spacious and had everything we needed minus food and cleaning supplies. The beds were very comfortable as far as we were concerned, the grounds are meticulously well maintained and the staff are friendly and helpful. There were four of us in our party: two seniors, one other adult and an 8 year old and all of our needs were met at this beautiful gem of a resort. Not only will we be back, but we would highly recommend Caribe Cove. The only downside, and really, it is not much of one, is that you need to have a car. But everything is so easy to get to from the major theme parks, to Publix, Walmart, Walgreen, Target, 7 Eleven, to the Outlet Malls and Flea Markets (we got some great deals at the Visitors Flea Market and Maingate Flea Market). Loved everything about our stay here and truly enjoyed the breathtaking surroundings and serenity!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and perfect for families.”
Reviews.Author: LondonRelaxer
Reviews.Content: The facilities were everything we needed and the location was perfect. Block 4 gave us the peace we wanted with great views over the lake onto the conservation area and the apartment was big and perfect for our family. The staff were polite and helpful, we will definitely return :-)

Reviews.Title: “Like home.”
Reviews.Author: emersonkz
Reviews.Content: My family and I go to Orlando twice a year, and since 2008 and stayed at the Caribbean Cove (about six times). The resort is 6 miles from Disney, two miles from market (Publix, Super Target). The room is awsome, big, comfortable and well furnished. I strongly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: thinktink79
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Aug 19th-25th and it was perfect. We were in the larger 3 bedroom 2 full bath, it was huge about 1600SF with alll the comforts of home and then some. It was Me, my hubby, my son my MIL and my 3 nephews. We had a ball and every thing you could possably need from a vacume cleaner to dish detergent to a nice movie rental were right there on property. The staff was very freindly and checkout was a breeze. I highly recommend this loction to ANYONE.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: bobsa123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caribe Cove Resort from 23rd August to 6th September 2011 and found the complex to be ideally placed for Disney (15 mins) and Universal (30mins). The condominium was large and had a washer/dryer/oven/microwave and fridge freezer with icemaker. The rooms also contained 3 TV's and DVD player. Free DVD 'rental' was included in the room charge. The rooms and resort were very clean. The reception included free coffee & tea and an outdoor pool was large enough never to feel crowded. Overall, an ideal place to stay, with more than enough parking and facilities (close to Publix/Target and numerous restaurants).

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Resort.”
Reviews.Author: therunner68
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights. The Resort is about a 25 minute drive from the airport, but still close the main parks. We had the 2 bedroom condo for a family of 5. The condo has plenty of space and has everything you need,but food. Rooms are clean and we really enjoyed the screened balcony.The pool is nice. The resort is away from the main highways,which makes it a nice quiet place to relax after spending all day chasing the kids at the parks. We will definetly come back here next year. A GREAT value. I didnt like that check-in is not until 4 pm. But we arrived early 3. Front desk staff was really nice and allowed us to check in with no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great stay...”
Reviews.Author: sbenson11
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our forth visit to Caribe Cove, We love it there and will be going back next year. The mattresses had been a little suspect in the past but looks like the ones in the unit we stayed in were brand new and really cosy.

Reviews.Title: “A Whole Lotta Room!”
Reviews.Author: VeryGreenApple
Reviews.Content: Tips 1) Get a room in Building 1 or 2 2) $130 to be paid when you check in and make sure you have room for a $200 (or was it $250?) VISA/MC deposit that is released once you check out. 3) When doing comparisons, keep in mind you have to pay for your own toilet paper, paper towels, dish detergent, dish washer liquid, etc. They start you off with supplies, but depending on how long you are there, you will need more. 4) Bring a wireless router and configure it at home. This way, your devices (ex. Laptops, Ipads, etc) are already configured to this router 5) Bring spices, such as salt, peper, etc in ziplock bags. Nothing worse than having to buy the whole bottle at the store OR the alternative: bland food! 6) Set expectations. Pool is small and closes at dusk. Other than that, there is nothing to do. If you have your day planned to be off site, or plan on relaxing at home in nice A/C, then you are good! 7) If you plan to visit a beach, go to Sand Key Beach in Clearwater. It is 1.5 hours away by car. You will pass through Clearwater beach....resist the urge to stay there because Sand Key is soooo less crowded and you can rent chairs and umbrella's. There is even a snack bar that sells pizza, drinks and ice cream. Bring quarters for the metered parking. See for yourself..Cocoa Beach is 2nd on the list for Shark Attacks! http://www.flmnh.ufl.edu/fish/sharks/statistics/gattack/mapfl.htm 8) Bring your own GPS from home. This saves some cash. 9) When going to Disney, etc...don't bring unnecessary credit cards, etc. I learned that the odds are high of people losing wallets on vacation. Our heads are in the clouds most of the time! 10) Starbucks 5 minute car drive away, near Walmart. 11) SHOP AT ROSS ---TRUST ME. If you like brand names, go to ROSS Dress for Less. I went to 3 of them and the prices are waaaaay better than the outlet malls. They have everything...almost like Winners, but apparently is not the same company. 12) Stay on Ground Floor. Nothing worse than having to go back and forth to load your van if you have alot of stuff to move back and forth. Also, i saw a lady waiting for the elevator that never came. They eventually fixed it, but I was quickly relieved that I didn't have to go through that. I was initially disappointed not getting the view, but realized that it was a blessing in disguise! Back on topic, the condo itself is amazing. The master bedroom is the entire length of the unit. HUGE! King BED, his and her closets, Bathroom is gigantic --shower, soaker tub, his and her sinks and an enclosed toilet (with door). Bathroom within the bathroom. Customer service is superior. A lady called me the next day asking how everything was. She said to call if I needed anything. Screened porches allowed me to relax outside while I had my coffee. No bugs, kept critters out. I read all the reviews about the beds before I came. I didn't think it was bad, but my son said that his was really bad. It turned out that it wasn't the mattress that was bothering him, rather then boxspring would squeak everytime he had a movement. Thus my 4 Star Rating for Sleep Quality. I already started planning my next trip back to Caribe Cove and I hadn't even left yet!! Stayed in the 3 Bedroom. 6 person family (4 Children)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous apartments. Space, space, space!”
Reviews.Author: CJANDRU
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 weeks at Caribe Cove and loved every second. We had a 3 bedroom apartment on the top floor of block 5 which was very peaceful, though I must admit the bullfrogs do make a noise at this time of year - it just didn't bother us. The apartment was HUGE, 2 big bathrooms with separate showers, walk in wardrobes, utility room, fridge with ice dispenser - if only there had been a decent iron it would have been heaven! Staff were lovely, friendly and helpful. Pool is a bit small for the size of the resort, but never seemed to get crowded and infact was usually quiet. The infinity aspect is nice and the hot tub very welcome. The only reason I haven't given 5 stars is that there is no tiki bar or entertainment at the clubhouse, which I think a resort this size could use. Otherwise it is fantastic and I think we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place, just magnificent, away from all the time-share group and gimmics. Just a gem- cant wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: roderick b
Reviews.Content: My family and i had a wonderful time, ben here 3 times and find it a lovely place to stay. Would highly reccommend to a friend-easy on the budget and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay,rooms and beds need updating.”
Reviews.Author: DWE69
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a Disney vacation.The units are ok but I feel that the hotel should provide toilet paper,paper towels,and garbage bags.Warning they don't and don't use their gift shop either as it's way too expensive.They make you pay a $65 cleaning fee plus $5.95 per day usage charge and they don't even empty the garbage for you.The pool closes way to early just as it gets dark.Sometimes after dinner we wanted to use the pool but couldn't because we got chased out.It maybe wise to look for another place to stay that is more guest friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful Which Building You Get”
Reviews.Author: timberowl
Reviews.Content: I had published a review before, but felt the need to delete it and revise it. Caribe Cove is a beautiful resort to stay in, with beautiful buildings, and I felt safe parking my car there. I'm sure the majority of the resort is quiet and peaceful at night. However, I was in building number 4 (I'm fairly certain that was the building number, anyway), which faces a large pond in the back. The pond has a sign outside facing the building, which cautioned guests about the presence of alligators. At first I was excited about such a lovely view, however this pond also had a large amount of frogs. The frogs made their happy way up to the building, , I suppose to avoid the overflow of water when it rained, and while they could not make it onto the screened-in porch, they clung onto the rafters, the outside of the screen, the frame--everywhere, and made loud noises (I assume they were mating calls) all evening and night.
