The walls were so thin, it sounded like they were in the room with you. My mother had to put earplugs in just to sleep at night. I had to buy Benadryl and put a pillow over my head to sleep. It would get so loud, when I'd be talking to someone on the phone while indoors, they would ask "what's that noise?" It was like this every single night I stayed there--I was there for five nights. The hotel has already replied once that no one has complained of frogs--this is likely because people assume the hotel is well aware of the presence of the frogs, and they know there's little that can be done, short of killing them, which would be inhumane. I didn't want them dead--I just didn't appreciate being given a room that didn't allow me a restful night's sleep. Before anyone responds with anything contradictory, I would ask them to stay in a room on the first floor of building number 4 for a night, with a porch overlooking the pond, especially a night during which it rains (it rained almost every night of my stay). Also, I think it's worth mentioning that there is a housekeeping fee and a deposit which are expected upon your check in--they're not included in your initial fee. These may all be for very good reasons, but they were not mentioned during my booking with Travelocity and these caught me off guard and lowered the amount of spending money I had available during my Disney World vacation which I'd scrimped and saved for for months. There is no housekeeping during your entire stay, just FYI. I did not personally find the beds very soft, or comfortable. I could feel the springs. The staff was courteous and polite, and took outbound mail for me, and even provided me an envelope for it free of charge. I would consider staying here again, as it did have some decent amenities at a reasonable price, but I would be very sure to request a building away from the pond, and suggest anyone else do the same.

Reviews.Title: “large rooms but loud frogs”
Reviews.Author: jdmded
Reviews.Content: The condo is large with a good design but updates are needed. The veneer was coming off the counter in the kitchen and the bathroom. The items that were supposed to be provided according to the welcome packet were not what was in the room. We called to get the other items and were told the packet was out of date. The beds were hard. The pool was fine and the front staff desk was nice. The worst part for us was the sound of frogs (or some other creatures) "singing" loudly all night. There isn't much the hotel can do about this but be aware that it was distracting. We got a great rate though so we got the price of a hotel room we got a three bedroom condo. All in all, worth it for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort BUT...”
Reviews.Author: DianeD19
Reviews.Content: This villas are beautiful, clean, quiet and spacious. Unfortunately, the owners of these villas really went extremely low budget on the beds. We had a 3 bedroom villa and ALL the beds were horrible, felt like sleeping on the lowest grade sofa bed you could imagine. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone with back problems. Ten days and even my kids were hurting. I complained to the front desk a few times and was advised that they were aware of the problem and they were trying to convince the owners to change the beds. I was told It's their number 1 complaint. The tv's are old and small and there is no wi-fi in the villas although a cable is provided for hook-up. Although the place was nice I would not go back due to the beds.

Reviews.Title: “Very comforting!!!”
Reviews.Author: ArshEdison_NJ
Reviews.Content: This resort was a pleasure to stay at. We stayed here last week and enjoyed our stay. It was us and our two kids. Although we had the third floor, the elevator took only a second to come up and take us to our destinations. It's not far from Disney or International Drive, which made it very easy for us. Having the Super Target nearby was a blessing. The people and service is very nice. The rooms were clean and very comfy. They had pots and pans, glassware, cutlery...all that you need in good place to stay. If you are simple and dont want too much noise, this is the place to stay. No bothers. We got there, did grocery shopping, came to the resort, ate, slept and were out to the parks vacationing. Came back and it was all good. I would definitely recommend this place to others!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased and would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Pghadams
Reviews.Content: I was nervous after reading a couple reviews but decided to go with Caribe Cove based on the amount of good reviews. Very clean and upscale accommodations. Manager let us in to our room early even though when i called for early check-in the women said they don't allow it. We were very comfortable and enjoyed the pool. Took no time to get to all of the parks. A bit of traffic on the I-4 which is the the main highway but got through it. The grounds are landscaped beautifully and well taken care of. Would most definitely stay there again. Great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Can't complain!!!”
Reviews.Author: Liz0914
Reviews.Content: we are working parents that save to bring our kids to a vacation......Full clean kitchen, a lot of space, great place, no onsite activities for the family just the pool...if you have something plan everyday will be a great place or unless you are a layback person will enjoy also...I will come back. O by the way matres are,little hard

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: tinks186414
Reviews.Content: Can't really fault this place, for the price we paid it was great, you do get charged extra per night $8pp if I remember which was a bit naughty but quite a few of these type of places do apparently. We went September and more or less had the place to ourselves, only ever shared the pool area with 2 other families so sunbeds were not a problem!! The apartment was great for us 4 adults that didn't want to pay extra on seperate rooms for each couple as we had seperate sides of the villa with our own bathrooms, handy fully fitted kitchen,laundry, tv and a balcony for those must have night caps. it was clean as was the pool area. It is a tad out of the way so not for those without a car, Yes I'd go again.

Reviews.Title: “You get more than what you paid for”
Reviews.Author: njdaddy
Reviews.Content: This property is good for spacious, clean accommodations. The rooms are incredibly huge and clean. Plenty of closet space, incredibly huge deck that's netted to keep out the bugs, every kitchen utensil you'll ever need. It's only a half mile from 192. Pool is kinda on the small side and there's not much to do on property but if you want roomy clean accommodations with 2 or 3 bedrooms at regular hotel room prices, you can't beat this place. P.S. When they say check out time is 10 a.m., they mean it; they knocked on the door at 10:03 a.m.!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and would stay again, but beds need improvement.”
Reviews.Author: MTLotts
Reviews.Content: I visit the Disney World area often and have stayed both on and off Disney property. This was my first stay at Caribe Cove and we had a 2 bedroom villa (room 4407) and stayed 7 nights during the last week of June 2011. Check in was easy and the room was very spacious and was located on the back corner of the building with a nice view of the woods. The room was spacious, basically a 2 bedroom apartment with dining and living room. Patio area was fully screened in to keep bugs out and had a ceiling fan. It had a full kitchen with double door refrigerator with water and ice dispenser, full size stove/oven, microwave oven, toaster, blender and coffee maker. There were a lot of plates, bowls, cups and glasses. Utensils were basic. There was a kids high chair and play pen that we did not use. The internet connection is hard wired and is located by the TV in the living room and was very difficult to find at first. The cable was extremely short and only allowed use about 2 feet from the TV. Next time I would bring a cheap wireless router, or a my own cable (at least 10 feet). Overall the cleanliness of the room was okay. Could use some improvement, but wasn't filthy by any means. Bathrooms were clean and there were plenty of towels for both the bath and pool. I did see a carpet cleaning company there daily servicing various units. Beds could definitely use an upgrade. This was probably the most disappointing part of the resort. They are cheap inner spring mattresses and were very noisy and very uncomfortable. There is only one pool and it is located at the front entrance by the clubhouse. The pool area was clean and there are quite a few tables with umbrellas and lounge chairs. Hours posted are dawn till dusk, so you can't take a dip later in the evenings. The exercise room had two treadmills, two bikes, and multipurpose exercise machine. It's about a 15 minute drive to the Disney parks and there are several restaurants and a grocery store located a couple minutes away. As this is a vacation villa, you will need to provide your own sundries (laundry soap, toothpaste, razors, etc.) and remember you will be charged a $65 cleaning and a daily resort fee. The fees are mentioned on the various websites. Overall, an enjoyable stay and we would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Really loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Trialjeff
Reviews.Content: There is nothing to unlike about this resort. This was our first stay at a non-Disney resort, and when we go back, we will stay there again. It's about 15 minutes from the Disney properties, and maybe 20 from Universal. LOTS of places to eat nearby, and a good supermarket which is close. The rooms were clean and spacious. The bathrooms were huge. New washer and dryer (byo detergent). They gave us plenty of towels for a family of four, and we rented a 3 bedroom. The staff was very pleasant and gracious. We were lucky to have a 1st floor room, ask for one.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: tr0pical123
Reviews.Content: OMG.. I can't write enough words to describe how great our vacation at Caribe Cove was. The rooms were spacious and clean, it looked just like the website but better. This was the best deal in Florida. Everything was in short driving distance from our location. The staff were friendly and professional, they were just the best. We liked having our choice of movies at night, when we weren't too tired from sightseeing. We can't wait to come back again soon!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful vacation”
Reviews.Author: blanktgrl
Reviews.Content: I stay in the FL Disney area at least twice a year. This is a nice clean affordable resort. The suites were a very generous size and extremely clean. Every morning my family would go for a swim in the pool. There was plenty of seating both in the sun and shade around the pool so everyone was comfortable. The suite has a full kitchen and there are two Publix close by so saving money on food was easy. Finding the internet access could have been a little easier. It took some looking. The beds were okay. I expected them to be a little better since so much attention was paid to every detail. The washer and dryer in the unit were very helpful since I have a two year old. There was also a playpen and high chair. It was a very relaxing vacation. At checkout I spoke with Lizzette. She was pleasant and helpful. Overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be staying there!!!”
Reviews.Author: blancajimenez36
Reviews.Content: This has been my second stay at the resort. The first time our experience was not a good one. The service, housekeeping and front desk weren’t very pleasant. They locked us out for 2 hrs. The couldn’t find anyone to fix the problem! Having rented 2 bedroom units, totaling 6 rooms. I was only given a 2 night free stay in 1 unit. The bathrooms are still disgusting!!! The mold starts at the bottom on the floor of the shower door. Inside the shower is worse. You see the mold all over the grout, The toilet had an orange ring around it, and the bath tub is the same way.. I had to go and purchase a bathroom cleaner with Clorox and clean it myself. My family nor will I, ever return to this Resort. Not even with a free ANYTHING!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - SUPER CLEAN!”
Reviews.Author: thetroutdale
Reviews.Content: By far the cleanest lodging I have ever stayed in! We booked a three bedroom unit on the top floor of bldg. #3. We did not want to leave. It was so quiet and overlooked a beautiful area full of trees and birds. The kitchen was fully stocked and there were ample towels for bathing and pool use. The pool area was wonderful. Easy access to the the main routes to everything! After a busy, loud day at parks or shopping returning to our unit was a true Zen experience! We will return - very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for family dont wait to book this Place.”
Reviews.Author: rjf27
Reviews.Content: The people who work at the caribe are first class, and i have stayed at the best villas in Florida, keep up the great work ,rjf27

Reviews.Title: “We thought it was fab.”
Reviews.Author: marieintheusa
Reviews.Content: I just spent the previous week at Caribe Cove Resort after booking through Expedia. On arrival we found the staff very pleasant, she did charge a "resort and cleaning" fee to my credit card but I knew about this in advance...most Orlando resorts charge this I believe. We upgraded the apartment to a 3 bed/2 bath and it was massive....we were amazed at the space. The place was spotless, not a speck of dust anywhere and the unit was more than adequately equipped....we loved the laundry facilities! The balcony was great, accessable from 3 rooms and very comfortable. Overall, it was great value, what we paid for what we got was amazing. My only complaint (but not really a complaint) was the mattress on the king bed was uncomfortable, a little bit on the cheap side but it didn't stop me from sleeping!....We are going back again to Caribe Cove in September and we cannot wait!

Reviews.Title: “JUST GROSS.”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Katie_K
Reviews.Content: This is by far THE WORST place I have ever stayed in my entire life and I've been all over. Carpets are filthy; food and debris under fining table (had to have maintenance come vacuum); fridge dirty handles and hair inside; mattress is thin and so flat there's a fold in the side, full of springs in master and kids mattress; DVD player won't play movies and front desk doesn't know what to do. I could go on but I'm busy washing the sheets and pillowcases. Spend a little extra and stay somewhere nice. If you're a clean person then you definitely don't want to stay here. If you don't mind and this is what you're use to then help yourself. You get a good size for the $ but if I could get a refund and leave then I would. Instead I'm spending my first night here cleaning and washing everything. I don't want to touch anything and I definitely don't want my son touching anything until I clean up. Pitiful.

Reviews.Title: “OK but boring”
Reviews.Author: buthshannon
Reviews.Content: Ok i stayed here with hubby in May for 5 nights !! My opinion on this hotel is that it's really boring!! nothing is going on ! if you're planning on just sleeping here than you'll be ok though rooms is not that clean either. There were stains on the carpet you'll have to clean after yourself at all time. The washer and dryer is super small as well!! the only thing i like about this hotel resort is the kitchen. Nice kitchen!! I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice lodgings clean, but!”
Reviews.Author: debmtl
Reviews.Content: What they don't tell you is that you have to bring your own soap, shampoo, dish soap, pen, paper, They are more than helpful when you ask for these items you can purchase them all at their convenience store. The additional 65.00 per booking and 7.95 per day is for the use of free video rental, who wants to watch movies when they are on vacation, and free phone calls local and local long distance, like I want to spend my time on the phone. Just beware, ask all the questions, I am not sure if there is more I haven't discovered yet.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely terrible”
Reviews.Author: Kelsey0287
Reviews.Content: the worst travel planning experience EVER! I planned my trip through hotels.com, and thought I was getting a good rate as it was only 79 dollars a night. NOTHING IS AS IT SEEMS! When I got there, they automatically charged my card an additional 73 dollars cleaning fee before i could even get into my room. I WAS ONLY PLANNING TO STAY ONE NIGHT! it doubled the rate of my room. i tried to cancel, but the cancelation fee is the price of the room per night including all fees (cleaning), so it would have been pointless. aweful customer service too. if you ever call there you better have the afternoon to spend waiting for someone to answer. NEVER AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place with lots of room for the family”
Reviews.Author: dlt45
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed Caribe Cove resort. We traveled back and forth to Disney and it was usually only a 15- 25 minute trip. There were places on the way to eat and shop. A Target was about 3 miles away and was convenient for groceries and forgotten items. The kitchen was equiped with necessary items. We were only given one package of soap for the dishwasher(one load) and none for the sink so bring some from home. There is a computer hookup in the TV cabinet and your unit may or may not have the cord to attach to the computer. There isn't a desk near by so we used the coffee table. No wify in the room. The lighting in the unit wasn't bright enought for reading and the bathroom lacked towel racks but the towels provided were nice. These are just minor complants because we did enjoy the resort. They had free movie rentals in the lobby which the kids really enjoyed. The pool and hot tub were great. The unit was beatiful, clean and well maintained. It was great having a kitchen, washer and dryer, 3 Tvs, 2 bathrooms and rooms for the kids. Overall, a very nice place to stay and visit Disney.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite place in the world.”
Reviews.Author: AliciaTedrow
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at this hotel. It is beautiful! We stayed in the 3 bedroom and it was excellent. The fact that they charge a cleaning fee and a resort fee is reasonable and NOT a reason for this gorgeous place to get a lower rating. The cleaning fee is so that the next people who stay will get just what we did when we walked in. I beautiful, clean, place to stay for 8 days. Because there is no cleaning from staff while you are there and you are making a mess that someone should have to pay for it to be clean. They scrub the carpets and everything after each person. And not an inch of dust was to be found. So I had no problem spending what I did to have such a clean place to spend my vacation. It was just the two of us and the resort did give us enough toilet paper, paper towels and dish washing liquid to last us while we were there. We didn't have to buy any. We did however buy some laundry detergent to make use of the laundry room so that I could wash the clothes and towels and we could go home with clean laundry and I wouldn't be doing a weeks worth of clothes right after come back from vacation. The flat screen t.v.'s are a little on the small side BUT we didn't watch much t.v. the internet cable does come out of the tv in the living room so it is a little inconvenient if you want to surf the web in bed. Speaking of the beds the bed in the master was hard and loud when you move around. However I am used to a pillow top mattress so I am a little spoiled. but I do think if Caribe Cove wants to do any upgrades the mattresses would be a great idea!!! The things I was surprised they provided were hangers, towels, hair dryer, blender, dish washing liquid, trash bags, all kitchen needs, high chair, and packnplay. We didn't use the last 2 but we thought it was nice they provided it. If you need to print directions do so before leaving home. They make you buy a card for 15 minutes of internet access for like 4 dollars to use the computers in the lobby just so you can print something. Overall this resort is amazing and we are already planning our next vacation and we WILL be coming back to Caribe.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location....”
Reviews.Author: gail--r
Reviews.Content: While this was a very well maintained facility, I found the location to be far from all of our family activities and I spent a great deal of time commuting. The condo itself is clean and spacious and a very good value for large families. It is quiet and relaxing although the beds are not of very good quality and the carpets could use a good shampooing. The kitchen was immaculate and well appointed. It was nice to be able to do a load of laundry.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families”
Reviews.Author: traveler_Van
Reviews.Content: General: Stayed from May 12-18, 2011. Note: Weather was high 80s and humid. Traveled with husband and 2.5 year old child. From MCO airport, we crossed 2 toll bridges and at the time, we paid $1.75 - one was $1 and the other was $0.75 - have exact change. Hotel Location: Within 20 minutes of a drive to Disney and about 40 minutes to SeaWorld. Didn't go to Universal Studios so can't say about the distance to/from hotel. From MCO airport, you actually pass by Disney. You travel along Irlo Bronson and before the hotel you pass by SuperTarget, Publix, Olive Garden and other restaurants, banks and shops. There is a security guard on site but you're free to go in/out during the day, the gate is closed from 10pm onwards and you just show your Key Room to the guard. Resort is located off Irlo Bronson and is somewhat near a residential area; construction is being done across the street and we were woken up to a loud sound (more below). Overall the area was clean, not sketchy and we felt very safe and appreciated that we were within minutes to shopping, food and banking. Hotel Room: Stayed on the ground floor, thought it'd be a problem but being 4.5 months pregnant I liked just walking straight to my door. We stayed in Building 1 and unfortunately our screened-in balcony faced the lot and somewhat of the garbage bins. (Note: Not totally sure if the loud noise was the construction or from the bins.) Even with the humidity, there was no smell coming from there so we enjoyed many meals outside. We got the 2 bedroom Suite and it really would suit up to 6 since there is fold-out sofa in the living room. There is plenty of space so you really wouldn't feel cramped with maximum capactiy. The pictures they have online is exactly what we got so no surprises. They do provide starter kits - couple of toilet rolls, dishwasher soap, a sponge but YOU have to buy your own stuff to last your stay. They do have a little store in the Office and the prices weren't overly inflated compared to Target. King bed in Master was hard for me, we have a pillow-top mattress at home and this was hard. I had a hard time sleeping. 2nd bedroom had 2 twin beds, no one stayed there so can't comment on that. But the 2nd room had a massive closet, honestly you could get one other person to camp out there. There was ensuite laundry, full-size kitchen and proper plates/cutlery/cups in the cupboards. Depending on what you are cooking, they pretty much had the basics but don't expect every type of cookware. You get wired Internet and it was only accessible in the living room. At least it was free so no complaints. Master bed had access to small screened balcony but I don't recall any chairs so I guess it's for fresh air. Master bath had a nice soaker tub and room-for-2 shower. Everything was clean. 2nd bathroom had a standard tub/shower combo. There is no desk but you do get a 6-person dining table but again, Internet access for us was in the living room where the TV was so we did any work on the coffee table. Temperature control was fine and we had no problems. We really liked being able to open up the balcony and let in fresh air without bugs getting in. Hotel Cleanliness: The place is carpeted except the bathrooms and kitchen. Looking at the carpet you can see the vacuum marks so I guess they do clean it after all but I'm not there to watch them clean it so I can't say how clean it truly is. Overall, the carpet never felt sticky and we all sat on the floor or went around the room without getting bug bites or dirty feet. So, we were fine with the cleanliness. They also provide a vacuum, broom, mop and bucket if you need to do your own cleaning. There is a $65 Housekeeping Fee which I believe pays for the 'deep cleaning' of the room. This is mandatory and charged at the hotel. Hotel Amenities: There was a 'warm' pool. I didn't think it was hot at all and when the sun goes down, parts of the pool is in the shade. It does overlook a little lake and wasn't busy when we went. There was small hot tub but never went in due to pregnancy and our young child. Resort provides a DVD card where you can rent from the Office movies, in your suite the living room has a DVD player. This is included in the resort fee. Again, there is also a little store where you can buy cleaning products, chips, drinks, etc. I didn't see a restaurant onsite so I don't think there is Room Service. Buildings 1 and 2 are the closest to the pool and gate. There are elevators but never had to use them. There are no corridors so you have exterior doors. This normally detracts us from staying at a place but the security and the location of the Resort was no problem for us. Free parking was an added bonus. Check-in was pretty painless so no issues there. There is a small Fitness Room and at the Office, you can access the Sauna. Never used those amenities so no comment there. In addition to the Housekeeping Fee ($65), you do have to pay the $5.95 Resort Fee and a $200 Deposit, payable at the Resort. Calls are not included, even local calls so beware of using the phone. Cons: -We never knew where to put our rubbish or recycling. I would recommend better signage for guests. My husband finally found it when he explored our building but it was too late and we chucked everything in the garbage. -No WIFI and if you're sharing the suite with other people, you have to take turns with the Internet cable. -Firm mattress -Questionable public transportation. We did see bus service along Irlo Bronso so it may be possible to use buses. But along the route to Disney, I didn't see bus shelters so be warned that you may have to stand in the open heat waiting for a bus. Overall: We were there for Disney and SeaWorld so the location was excellent and we always felt safe. The close distance to other services was handy especially when packing for the next day's adventure. We did pass a Premium Outlet which I heard is open most days till 11pm, but I think that was near SeaWorld but we never tried. I would highly recommend this place to families.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay - Huge, Luxurious Rooms, Close to Disney!!!!”
Reviews.Author: holliwd
Reviews.Content: Pros: This resort was fantastic. The rooms were huge! If space is what you desire, this is your place. The prices were also very reasonable. The resort is very close to Disney, and about a 20 minute drive to Universal. The location was fantastic. It was down the street from a super Target and a large chain grocery store. Liquor stores and dozens of great dining options are all very close by. The kitchen was huge with a full size refrigerator, stove, oven, and microwave. A toaster, blender, and all kitchen utensils were in place for use. The hotel was very clean. 3 rooms had their own separate entrances to a fully screened in deck with furniture. It was very nice. I can't say enough great things. Cons: As a word of caution, you should know there is a $65 cleaning fee, $5.95/day resort fee, and a $200 (refundable) security deposit; none of which you are made aware of until check in. Fortunately, I had read the reviews and was not surprised. Had I been unaware, this would have left a bad taste. This is more like a time share than a hotel. As such, there is no daily cleaning service. However, there is an adequate supply of towels and extra linen as well as a full size washer and dryer. In addition, a vacuum and broom are stowed in the laundry room. This was a non-issue. Considerations: It helped when I read in the reviews that toilet paper, paper towels, shampoo, lotion were not supplied. I knew to buy it upon arrival. I found an initial stock in the room, but it is not replinished. It too was a non-issue since I was already aware. The beds are not the most comfortable. Overall, this place was fantastic! I travel a good bit and typically stay in 4 star or higher. I was not disappointed. I would stay here again and again. My family and I loved it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay Away From Disney”
Reviews.Author: twopiersq
Reviews.Content: We normally stay on Disney property but we are glad we chose Caribe Cove. We had tons of space, 2 covered porch areas, great pool, gym, sauna, steam room, free movies, 2 bathrooms, full kitchen, etc. Very friendly staff all around. The location actually was much better than expected... If you take the 429 (toll $1) you can avoid all the tacky gift shop areas and use the "back door" into Disney. No traffic. SuperTarget just down the road for food and other stuff. Just to repeat what has been before... You NEED a car to stay here... your transport options are very limited this far out. And there is a seperate cleaning fee... But they did a great job about communicating that to us before the visit and at check in. We had a perfect stay and will probably be back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! Couldn't have asked for more for our 8 days in Orlando.”
Reviews.Author: chewy96
Reviews.Content: Booked this facility though Travelocity for an 8 day trip to Orlando. It was amazing. The condo was so spacious. The kitchen was enormous and nicely appointed. The pool and clubhouse facilities were very nice. As an added bonus they have an onsite DVD rental machine which was very convient. Staff was friendly and courteous. Condo was very clean and nicely decorated. Located very close to all restaurants and Disney atractions as well as shopping. Will definitely be back and will recommed to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Shando26
Reviews.Content: Rooms were spacious and equipped with anything you may need to prepare home cooked meals. The screened in patios were great for dining. Beds were comfortable. Very clean. Pool was clean and perfect temperature. Pool was small but seemed to accomodate the guests fine. A playground and a bbq are two things I wish they had but did not. Staff was helpful. Close to shopping, restaurants and Disney. Would recommend it for a family stay and would definitely stay there again. The price is amazing for what you get. Remember it is like a condo and you need to supply soap for dishes, dishwasher, laundry etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: HectorEnrique
Reviews.Content: We were there for 5 nights and it was great. We rented the 3 room villa and it was very clean and comfortable. I highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations, unbelievable good resort!!”
Reviews.Author: DrRobert78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caribe Cove for 7 nights. Upon arrival we were pleasantly suprised by the spaciousness and cleanliness of the appartments. We traveled with our young son and were pleased with the spacious rooms. The whole complex was very nice and well laid out. Staff was very friendly and helpfull. Pool is relatively small, but fulfilled the requirements. Views of the adjacent pond added something to the relaxation. Free internet in the rooms via a cable connection (so bring a laptop). Wi-fi would be a potential improvement. Located just outside Kissimmee (Which is a plus!!) making it wonderfully quiet. Armadillos and racoons stroll the grounds when dusk sets in adding to the outdoor feel. We will definitely be back!!

Reviews.Title: “We would most definately stay again”
Reviews.Author: Taralaralou
Reviews.Content: We was very happy with our stay at caribe cove, the apartments were very clean and spacious and had everything you needed, although a full length, a safty deposit box and a airer to hang wet clothes would have been nice if im to be really fussy. The pool was nice for a evening swim and the steam ,sauna and jacuzzi were ideally located in the pool area the jacuzzi was rather hot though. The staff in the reception area were very polite and helpful. Be careful if you order from any delivery menus recommended in the apartment folder as they seem to rip you off! We have a said that we would consider staying here again should we ever come back to orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience!”
Reviews.Author: Steph51048
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just took our kids, ages 4 and 7 on a Disney vacation and had a great experience at Caribe Cove. The staff was very helpful, it was CLEAN and exceded our expectations in every way! Great location- about 15 minutes from the Disney parks. I would definitely go back, in fact I wish I was there now!!

Reviews.Title: “nicest places ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: mamarelaxin
Reviews.Content: Our family just got home from Fl. today. Caribe Cove was as nice if not nicer than the pictures I had seen online. The room(s) were spotless and roomy. We saved so much expense on food having the full kitchen to come 'home" to at night. The kids loved coming home for an evening swim, snack, and free movie to watch. We all slept very comfortably and would love to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, affordable comforts of home.”
Reviews.Author: Meme2759
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a seven night stay. The condo is very spacious and had all the comforts of home. The staff was responsive to all of our needs. Upon check in there was an unhappy guest and the desk clerk handled the situation with a calm, poised manner. We had trouble with the inroom internet, and it was fixed within 15 minutes. The kitchen and bathrooms were very clean and were stocked with toilet paper and tissues for each bathroom. The kitchen appliances were spotless. The only negatives are that the carpets and floors were in need of a good washing. The floors had been swept/vaccuumed, but were very dirty, not just stained. We really enjoyed breakfasts and cocktails in the evening on the screened in porch. The pool was very nice, but closed at dusk, which made for very limited use. The spa was not warm enough to be considered a hot tub. The locker rooms and showers were very nice and clean. There were towels and lockers to lock your belongings in.

Reviews.Title: “great value and location”
Reviews.Author: vod999
Reviews.Content: we booked this property for 5 days as part of a two week vacation, we very pleased with the very spacious 3 bed condo, it was very clean and had everything we required for a self catering base. the staff were pleasant and the pool was a hit with the kids, we stayed in block 2 across from the clubhouse.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Golf Trip”
Reviews.Author: Steelerfan48
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caribe Cove from 4/7 to 4/12 to enjoy some golf before tghe season started up North. Caribe cove was ideal for our trip since it was fairly central to the courses we played. We did not run into any problems with the front desk or anyone for that matter. Caribe Cove sure beats sharing a cramped hotel room. The rooms offered us the privacy and space of home in a very pleasant setting. I would recommend Caribe Cove to anyone needing the space offered in these great condos and the convenience of location for a greqat trip. Will definitely be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Hansjons
Reviews.Content: Clean, almost new. Nice apartments with most everythin you´ll need.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book this resort!”
Reviews.Author: t_hNJ
Reviews.Content: I booked this through Expedia for my travel for a week after reading all of the reviews and looking at the photos. I thought it would be a very nice place. When I arrived to check in, I was told that we've been upgraded to their sister resort, Bahama something it was called. I had checked out the sister resort prior to booking this resort and the reviews were horrible, it was much cheaper and the entire place is outdated. Initially, Caribe Cove wouldn't tell us the reason for the upgrade, however, we later found out that they were overbooked and had no room for us even thought I had a confirmed reservation. I told them I didn't want the upgrade and they told me that I can cancel my resevation. This was around 7 pm and I had no where else to go. Few people who arrived after us were also told that they have been upgraded. They are running some scam. You pay more money to stay at their nice resort and then they move you to their sister resort which is way cheaper. Please don't book this resort. Thanks to Expedia, they were able to relocate us to a much better place for the same price that I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Highs & Lows”
Reviews.Author: MaiTai1702
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice and clean place to stay. Everyone was helpful that we encountered. The condo was clean and the kitchen had the bare necessitys. The complex is easily accessable and has many good restaurants and grocery store within a few miles. I don't know if I would call this a resort because of the limited facilities they have, and when you are paying an additional $ 6.00 a day for what they do have plus the cleaning fee it really isn't a bargin place to stay. The BED in our condo was Horrible, medium firm and noisy. If you have any problems with the condo they are taken care of. BERNARD is the man, he can fix anything and knows about everything.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: sportshots09
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our Disney Trip and we had a great time. The days were long and enjoyable and our stay at Caribe Cove was exceptional. The only negative was check-in and check-out times, check-in was too early. We have three adult daughters and the rooms were perfect. The master suite was exceptional my wife and I enjoyed the privacy and the space, My wife was able to enjoy a long bubble bath in a huge tub after a long day of walking Disney. The full kitchen and laundry room made it like home away from home, When we returned home we did not have a a day of laundry waiting for us that was a big plus. We will return to this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, spacious accomodations close to area attractions”
Reviews.Author: snow84
Reviews.Content: Good value for the price, close to attractions. Lots of room for family of 4, suites included full kitchen with basics, washer & dryer, nice screened in pattio. Staff were friendly, courteous, and repsonded immediately to requests.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a peaceful time after the busyness of the theme parks.”
Reviews.Author: rockfan1_11
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this resort twice. First time in 2007 when it just opened. Then again at the same condo in 2009. Both times the condo was spotless and well furnished. There was no sign of wear and tear after 2 years. Rooms are of a good size and there is a formal dining room as well as informal seating in the kitchen area. There is a large table and chairs on one of the balconies for siting out dining. Bedrooms are well furnished as are bathrooms. Pool area is clean and well furnished as are the changing rooms. Lovely gardens and plenty of parking places. Staff were friendly and helpfull. 30 minute drive from Orlando International Airport. 15 minutes from attractions. Close to supermarkets Publix and Walmart where you can get good bargains. Would go back to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: indyfan58
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an ultra clean, quiet, modern complex close to DisneyWorld, this is a great place to stay. We stayed over Spring Break with two college daughters. The rooms are spacious, very clean, well equipped - even provides large beach towels! We would recommend this to anyone. The private screened porches are wonderful after a long day.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, loved it”
Reviews.Author: foolish501
Reviews.Content: I spent about 3 days looking online trying to find a condo to stay in in Orlando, used TripAdvisor to review all the resorts, and after numerous headaches trying to work out where to stay, the only common fault i found with Caribe Cove was the $65 cleaning fee which was mentioned on both the resorts website, and travelocity who i booked with. I thought that was a very reasonable fee to pay. When i got there i was promptly greeted by somebody at the front desk, after a painless few minutes, we had our room key. We stayed in a 3 bedroom suite, and were highly impressed by the condo. My wife & I both commented that we would be happy to live in a condo like this. Loved sitting out on the screen porch in the morning and having coffee, loved the free dvd kiosk to give us something to do in the evening after a busy day. The condo was super clean, very roomy, and quiet. I would highly recommend this resort to anybody. If i was to vacation in Orlando i would certainly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great vvalue”
Reviews.Author: Simon1110
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 3 bedroom 2 bath condo. The unit was very large with a nice screened in lani facing a pond. The furnishings were very basic and the carpet was stained. The kitchen was well appointed with mostly everything you would need. The microwave and washer and dryer were loud. The master bath fan wasn't on its own switch so to have the light on over the sink you had to listen to the loud fan. The beds were uncomfortable. It would have been helpful if they supplied coffee filters, dish soap, and dishwasher detergent. It was the first time I stayed in a condo where I had to pay a cleaning fee of $65 ( it should be free if you stay 5 or more days) and a resort fee. The decor in Registration area was very low budget. The coffee was terrible with powdered creamer and you had to pay to use the computers. The grounds were also nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Orlando, unbelievable value for money.”
Reviews.Author: BeachGalAtHeart
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to enjoy the best of what Orlando has to offer, at a price that won't break the bank, I cannot recommend Caribe Cove highly enough. We promised the kids last year a family holiday that would be inclusive of some Disney magic, while hoping that we weren't setting ourselves up for a tourist trap too big that we couldn't climb ourselves out of. Enter Caribe Cove... Child friendly, easy drive to the theme parks, without leaving the adults or their wallets out to dry. The villas were very spacious and clean, It was a great escape from our busy day to day lives, and provided something for everyone. After spending a week there my husband and I were planning another visit next year, inviting along some of the extended family.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: mama2sons
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 week. The resort is very quite and beautifully maintained. Our unit 2304 was very clean and furnished just as pictured on the web site. The beds were comfortable.. The location was perfect for us as we did disney,sea world and busch gardens tampa. It is only 10 mins to disney, 15 with traffic. You must have a car to stay here though. Our freezer was not working properly when we arrived and when I called the desk there was a maintenence man at our door withinminutes. He fixed it promptly and was very courteous. I loved the screened porch our unit had. The cooking utensils did leave a little to be desired, but we managed as were did not do much fancy cooking.

Reviews.Title: “Great find close to Disney!”
Reviews.Author: AURebecca
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caribe Cove for 6-nights during a Disney Vacation and were very pleased with Caribe Cove! Our unit (a 2-BR Condo) was just as described and provided us plenty of room to "stretch out" during our stay. The kitchen was ample in size and all of the necessary items were provided. Our only issue was that the hot tub was not very hot at all. We only used it once, though, so hopefully they fixed it. The location in a quiet area and is an easy 15-minute drive to Disney attractions. We would definitely consider staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Condo, but not having any daily service was a surprise.”
Reviews.Author: wall311
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed for a week from March 4th to March 11th and we had some difficulties with the card swiping lock system on the doors. Did not receive adequate information and details at check in regarding this being a totally self serving room, which means you supply all the toilet tissues, paper towels, dish washing soap.... Also there was not service for clean bath towels or rags. We had to wait nearly an our outside our Condo while the maintenance staff attempted to gain entry into our Condo, due to the card swipper not working properly. Again the room was very spacious and the Condo was in overall good condition, but the lack of information provided by the Management at check in was a little frustrating, We may give them another opportunity in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place...lose the mattresses”
Reviews.Author: argyletraveler
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Caribe Cove. Nice big 3bdrm. 2 bath "villa". About 20 minutes from Universal where we were visting, Like the other reviews....nice pool, good clubhouse with nice workout room, locker rooms, free coffee/tea and a little shop that sells newspapers, ice cream, things for the villa -- buy them -- they are only a couple of dollars for Tide, dish soap, toilet paper, etc. -- if you buy large at Publix you wil never use it all. They also give you a card for a kiosk of free DVD's - which was great. Caribe Cove is off a very heavily traveleled highway but is nice and quiet. Good area for families -- near a publix supermarket for groceries, super target, cracker barrel for a quick lunch/dinner and some fun cheap t-shirt/gift shops - we like the one with the giant wizard out front! Such silly fun! There are about five huge "villa" buildings -- all within walking distance of the outdoor pool and clubhouse - we were in building 3 worked out just fine. There is a nice outdoor screened porch on each unit to sit outside - we had our breakfast out there every day and it was a really nice perk. Oh and there is a great soaking bathtub in each unit as well. Not jacuzzi however. Now to the beds at Caribe Cove -- miserable! - hard as a rock, crazy squeeky -- we were at this resort for four nights and never got a good nights sleep -- even after a long day at the parks. If you're reading this Caribe Cove folks - lose the mattresses!! Lastly, we had several folks rolling in to the resort late at night (3/4am) really loud and a few of them fighting with each other. However, we spoke to management and security and never heard another peep after night two of our stay. If you run into that problem see the manager at the clubhouse. It was pretty obvious when the bars close in that area... Overall, Caribe Cove was very nice -- staff was pleasant -- stay was great with the exception of the beds. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay when visiting the parks.”
Reviews.Author: Sylygrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days over presidents week with out eight year old son. The place more than met our expectations. The three bedroom was very spacious and had a lovely screened in patio. The pool was on the small side but adequate. The gym was also small but I only used it once in favor of walking outside since the weather was beautiful. The only draw back was the cleaning fee, I thought it should have been halved since we were not there for the entire week. All in all a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Caribe Cove wowed us again!”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkTarmale
Reviews.Content: My husband and children stayed here for President's week. We also stayed here two years ago and loved it. Well it didn't disappoint the second time. We rented a 2 bedroom condo for the four of us. The children had their own room with two twin beds, a tv, a walk in closet and their own bathroom. My husband and I enjoyed our king bedroom suite with a master bath and walk in closet. The full kitchen, washer/dryer, living room and screened in porch really top it off well. This unit is not as large as the 3 bedroom but that one is too big for us! Really, these condos are very large and quiet. We heard the people above us walk around one night but that's it. The clubhouse also has a large pool, hot tub, sauna and steamroom. A new feature is the free dvd machine in the lobby which are current so my children could see some new movies. If I had any complaints-which really I don't but just some suggestions. I wish there was a bar/cafe by the pool and better coffee. The coffee in the lobby is free but it is absolutely awful. Also, there is usually just one person at the front desk and if you're checking in/out it can take a while. However, at around $80 per night I can deal with it. ***Caribe Cove is off the I192 strip so it's very quiet. Also-there is a Super Target about 1 mile west on I192. Much better than the Publix and better prices. They have a Starbucks but be prepared to wait. They're very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: lizter3
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed in a three bedroom for 9 days...more than enough space. The condo was quiet (overlooked a small pond in building 5) and clean (immaculate!). The staff were friendly. We didn't mind the $65.00 cleaning fee or paying $7.00 for basic supplies (toilet paper,dish soap and laundry detergent). We were wowed by the space and cleanliness and couldn't have asked for more. I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, secluded resort close to all attractions !!!”
Reviews.Author: mbke
Reviews.Content: We stayed only four nights in February and it was worth the money. Don't stay 1 or 2 nights, because you have to pay a housekeeping fee upfront. The apartment was equipped with all the necessities, like kitchen pots, utensils,toaster, blender, plates etc. The pool area was clean with jaccuzzi hot tub, sauna and steam room. there is a Publix, Target, Walgreens and 7 -eleven within a mile. Many restaurants closeby- like Cracker Barrel, Houlihans, Red lobster, Black Angus Steakhouse etc., souvenir stores, Domino's Pizza, chinese places etc. If you plan on doing theme parks every day, you won't have time to use the pool since it closes early at 8pm. This resort is good for large families who would like to save some money. If you plan on a few days without the theme parks this particular resort does not offer much - there is not much there to do here. If you want a nice hotel with a great waterfall pool and a lot more to do - book a room at Marriott World Resort or Caribe Royale (both on International Drive). I would strongly recommend these. Tip : Remember to get your rooms close to the clubhouse/pool area - buildings 2 or 1 !!!!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME, QUIET, WONDERFUL BEFORE AND AFTER YOUR ORLANDO ACTIVITIES!”
Reviews.Author: jackievl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from January 31, 2011 to February 8, 2011. We have an 8 and 6 year old. We stayed in a 3 bedroom suite and LOVED it! From the moment we walked in, we felt like this was our home away from home. It was meticulously clean (our carpets were slightly damp from being steam cleaned). Staff was great, we had a problem with our internet cable and someone was there immediately to fix it. Other than that, we had no problems, so no need to call the front desk or maintenance. It was so nice to buy food and be able to eat breakfast and supper here, plus pack a lunch to save money in the parks. We arrived back between 6 and 9 every night, and a couple of nights, the pool had already closed, which would have been nice. We were able to access it a couple of nights though until after 9 p.m., and a couple of other guests were also in it. It is unsupervised, and I think they just kind of leave it open some nights, and close it other nights. The pool was warm, and we swam in it even when the temp was in the 60's. It was smaller than at other hotels, but it wasn't busy and we enjoyed that. The pool area was well maintained. Just know before you go that you will have to buy a couple of things for your place, like toilet paper, dish soap, etc. We didn't mind this at all, as it saved us hundreds in eating out, which we would have had to do had we chosen a hotel room. The cleaning and resort fee we knew about ahead of time, but we had only paid around $700 for the 9 day stay, so when we added that it, it was still very reasonable. We loved it, and would definitely stay there again. Cleanliness and comfort are our top priorities, and this place has both. 2 things about Caribe Cove are that you definitely need to rent a vehicle if you stay here and plan to tour around (which we would have done wherever we stayed), and that the beds and bedding could have been a bit more comfortable (but we still slept well as we were all exhausted from our days in Orlando!) STAY HERE, you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “mislead by the ad placed on expedia.”
Reviews.Author: carousellover3
Reviews.Content: the place looked very nice on the outside i never reached the rooms due to the suprise of a $75.00 one time cleaning fee. I couldnt justify paying that when i barely paid that for a one night stay.. so i cancelled my room.. they were gracious enough not to charge me for the stay. so i had to find another place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort condo, would certainly stay at this location again.”
Reviews.Author: ellishayesjr
Reviews.Content: Everything was fine about Caribe Cove Resort except the mattress needs to be upgraded.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well maintained and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: madambaseball
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were there 1/8 - 1/14 with our three adult children and 2 of their significant others. We stayed in Condo 4-104. It was great. You will find all the comforts of home in the very roomy 3 bedroom condo. It was super clean. We drove there from PA and they allowed us to check in 2 hours early. The resort was super quiet, in a great location and the staff there was accommodating. Yes, you have to pay the $65 cleaning fee, and the daily facilities charge for use of the pool, hot tub, etc but it is reasonable. You will need to buy your own paper towels and toilet paper but the money we saved by staying there made this no big deal. Unfortunately the week we were there the temperature was cold. We would have liked to go in the hot tub at night but it closes when it gets dark outside. You get free dvd rentals which are great for at night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for family”
Reviews.Author: Nancy_s_leong
Reviews.Content: It's an excellent choice for family. We have read many reviews, and be prepared on the cleaning fee, etc. We have family of 6, two adults, two seniors, two kids (12, 10), we all very happy with this condo which has everything we have asked for. We stayed in the 3 bed room in 5th floor, very quite and clean, we all can sleep very well. We had spent most of the time at the theme parks, but did cook dinners for couple of nights, and ate breakfast every day before leaving for the theme parks. We dropped by the check-in office for free coffee before we headed to the parks. Very friendly staffs, and free rental movies, free internet. It'll be better that if the condo have wireless, we need to hook up the connection to my laptop in the living room, but we don't have much time checking our laptop anyway, it worked out fine. I highly recommend this condo resort, will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant location, huge, well equipped rooms, great facilities”
Reviews.Author: kingbuxon
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent ten days at Caribe Cove, our children loved the pool, we loved the huge well appointed apartment that contained everything that you could need. It is in a lovely peaceful location yet we were able to get to Disney in ten minutes and Universal in twenty five. Would definitely go there again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place right where you want to be”
Reviews.Author: Meurtelken
Reviews.Content: Caribe Cove is a wonderful place to stay. Off the busy road, but still in the center of many interesting sites. Very close to Disney and the great malls, shops and supermarkets. Close to Celebration, Davenport, Orlando, Winter Garden Village, .. Many restaurants in the neighborhood to enjoy a good meal. Caribe Cove resort is very clean. The staff is more than willing to make you feel at home. The apartments are spacious, fully equipped and comfortable. We stayed at a 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom apartment with 5 people and we had a terrific time. You should do the same. Don't hesitate!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely AMAZING place to stay!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kukla_62
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our two adult children to Orlando for Christmas vacation, we stayed from Jan 1 to Jan 8, 2011. We stayed in the 3 bdrm, 2 bathroom suite (building 4 room 104) I can not say enough good things about Caribe Cove. What we got for our money was amazing. Our room was extremely clean and had all the necessities of home. A full kitchen with every possible utensil and pot you could ask for. It had a full size fridge, stove and dishwasher, and a full size laundry room with a washer and dryer. The grounds were beautiful and well kept. It is a little out of the way of the main hustle and bustle of the main strip, but that was perfect for us. Yes you do need a car if you stay there. The front desk staff was very polite and helpful. When we booked our vacation we were told there is a ONE TIME fee of $65.00 (NOT $120.00) for housekeeping and a $5.95 dollar a day resort fee ( which all hotel resorts charge in the US). On the I92 there are an abundance of restaurants and shops. We loved that we could do our own groceries and cook our own meals. However if you like to eat out, there is no lack of places to eat. In the club house there is a gym, a heated pool and hot tub, which we took full advantage of and let me tell you it was great. There is always free coffee in the lobby and two computers with internet for your use. There is also a small gift shop, and free DVD rentals to take to your room. This resort is not a 5 * hotel, so if you want room service for your meals, or want maid service daily, well stay at the Ritz, you won't find it here. What you will find is all the luxuries of home and your privacy! The resort does help you with park tickets, but do require 24 hours notice. I would like to comment on "Dibaash" comment, there was no reason for dirty dishes, you had a full size dishwasher in your condo, as well, I have stayed at many hotels in my days, including several 5* hotels, and not one of them has done my laundry.. So your comment about "dirty clothes" does not apply, you had a washer and dryer to do your laundry! Yes you will have to stock up on bathroom tissue and paper towel, but the resort does have some when you check in,. you do however have to supplier your own when you run out,, Publix or walmart or the resort gift shop does have some to purchase for $1.00 a roll. I can not say anything negative about this resort. One of the nicest resorts I have ever stayed in!! We will be back :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: mistry11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 12/26/10 through 1/1/11 and found this place very clean & comfortable. It was great to have a full 2 bedrooms, 2 baths and and kitchen & living room for the price of just a hotel room. There were plenty of restaurants nearby and only about 6 miles to Disney but hwy 192 gets pretty backed up at time so give yourselves at least 20 minutes during the morning theme park hours. The pool and hot tub were nice but there was not much else here for the kids to do but then we didn't spend much time there anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 53417John
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Been their 3 times we stay in room 1304 it was as clean as could be . Love the size of the condo over 1600 sf with 2 full bathrooms . pool was heated so we were able to used it . their are no hidden charges it is staded very clear 65 cleaning fee . if you go their check out Miller Ale House on 192 you wont be dispointed!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there.”
Reviews.Author: dibaash
Reviews.Content: Caribe Cove is beautiful on the surface...spacious facilities, but many hidden costs not mentioned on their website. You have to supply your own toilet paper, your own paper towels, your own dish soap. There is no housekeeping services throughout your stay and yet you are charged $120 at check in for housekeeping. They don't tell you unless you ask that it is housekeeping when you check out. You get nothing while you are there...no beds made, no clean towels. The list of things we were to find in our unit included blankets for the beds in each room. We had none! Not even one. We argued with the front desk for two days and finally just gave up and went without. They also say in their literature in the suite that you can buy theme park tickets at their office in the reception building. Well, you can't. We grew to love Walmart while we were there because the resort provided NOTHING. So if you want to go on vacation and not go to the bathroom, don't mind living with dirty clothes and dishes and don't mind sleeping as an iceberg, and want to pay more than you expected, it's your place. As for us, we'll never give them our business again. And I'll make sure everyone I know stays away.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: TravelMom055
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay @ Caribe Cove. The weather in Orlando was unusually cold, so we did not get to experience the pool area, however, all other amenities were in good condition. The laundry room and full kitchen were a money saving and convenient tool when travelling with kids and grandparents. Why pay higher hotel per night, per person fees when you can have a home away from home. Situated in a quiet area, this was ideal after a long day at the parks, which were only 10 mins. away. There is a back road we took to the Disney parks and hotels that avoided the I-4 traffic, and gave us more time at the parks and less time on the roads. Convenient to most major food chains + Super Target + Walmart. Highly recommend this location. Be aware of the cleaning fee + hotel security deposit required - no issue, but make sure you have room on your credit card. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but beds are very unconfortable”
Reviews.Author: AnaZ33129
Reviews.Content: We spent three days in this resort. We got a 3-bedroom apartment. It was spacious and clean, but the beds are terrible, I mean, very bad. I could hardly sleep. My son could not sleep in his bed because it was worse than mine, so he had to sleep on the couch. For that reason I will never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort, can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: chappell_betty
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Caribe Cove Resort from 11/23 thru 11/30. Oh wow this Resort was awesome. We really enjoyed our stay. We had great service and everyone was pleasant and nice, especially the receptionist Gloria. The rooms and facilities were great. I would difinitely recommend this resort to everyone that wants to stay in a clean, and beautiful resort. We would most certainly return without hesitation. "The Parker"

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!! Planning our next trip right now.”
Reviews.Author: Pamela085
Reviews.Content: Love the place. The location is perfect. The staff is very attentive. The front desk called not long after we checked in to see if everything was satisfactory in our room. This was a big plus for us. We've stayed in a lot of expensive places and there was never a call. The price is steal for a place this gorgeous. All the amenities of home are here. If you have children this is a wonderful place to spend your Disney Vacation. If you and your partner just want to relax in quiet this is the place for you also. Anyone who stays here will not be disappointed in my opinion. Thanks again Caribe Cove for a wonderful time. We will see you soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Itfittsu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were so amazed. Our room was very clean and everything you needed was right there. We will surely stay there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “spacious and very clean apartments quiet location”
Reviews.Author: chompercharlie
Reviews.Content: Very spacious apartments quite well equipped in a nice setting our apartment looked out over a lake and trees which was lovely. Email was though via ethernet not wireless which meant connection for only one laptop and no wi fi for iphone. Liked the quiet location but pool ( though very clean) was quite small. Gym was however well equipped and both pool and gym virtually empty. Service generally extremely good and staff very helpful. No storage was however available for our luggage on the last day of our trip ( we had to be out of the apartment for 10am and our flight was not until 6.50pm) which was a pain as this curtailed our activities on the last day due to anxiety about leaving our luggage with three expensive laptops ( sad computer obsessed family) in the hire car. Overall though very clean apartments and a good choice if you don't mind a slightly longer drive to the attractions. Dr B Paterson

Reviews.Title: “Dirty rooms!”
Reviews.Author: the4enghs
Reviews.Content: This condo was in a very nice area too bad it wasn't a nice stay. Our room was nasty! The carpets were black they were so dirty, the tile had a film on them. We did see the carpet cleaning people cleaning another unit. The bathrooms were moldy. When we wiped the tables off the paper towels were nasty! They also say that there is wi-fi in the rooms and there wasn't, only in the office center. My family was very disappointed with this condo. The grounds are very nice and kept up. The manager was very understanding and refunded us the $75 cleaning and departure fee. I would never stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wow Doesn't Get Any Better Than This”
Reviews.Author: elansing1979
Reviews.Content: First let me say there is a $65 cleaning charge (plus tax) no matter how long u stay. there is also a 5.95 a day resort charge. but those charges are always told to u before booking. Ok...we drove to orlando from nj and were very tired....we got there easy enough....they give u a card for free dvd rentals when u get there.....we opened the door to our unit (building 4, 103) and omg IT IS HUGE (WE ARE HERE NOW); there are three large bedrooms; master bedroom with a king sized bed....its like a suite...the bathroom is bigger than our bedroom at home; two other bedrooms; one with queen bed; other with two twins; they supply all dishes, cups, wine glasses, utensils, pots, pans; there is a dishwasher; washer and dryer in unit; they also supply vaccum, iron, iron board, plunger; the place was spotless upon arrival. i just cant say enough; there is internet in unit via ethernet cable (not wireless); very fast; there is also a screened in patio overlooking pond....i am so happy we did this.....very close to disney; there is a publix supermarket 2 mins down road....U WILL NOT BE DISAPPOINTED.....there is no cleaning until u leave so u will need dishsoap, paper towels, etc......to clean while u are there.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific place!”
Reviews.Author: Travelbounce
Reviews.Content: Okay, after all the bad reviews, I have to wonder just what these people expect in a "self-service resort". This is not a hotel - if you want someone to pick up after you, go to a hotel. We loved our stay. We checked in around 6pm on a Saturday night and Ahalya treated us like gold. She was helpful, answered all our questions and gave us tips to help us get around. She was super and we couldn't have asked for better service. I do have to address the cleaning charge. First of all, yes, it is a bit excessive but let's face it, they have to clean the room whether you stayed 3 hours, 1 day or 10 days (we spent 8)!! I want a clean room when I check in and obviously this is how they maintain things. The room was SPOTLESS and believe me, I am picky! And, FYI, Expedia clearly states ALL the extra charges on their website. There were 4 adults in the 3 bdrm condo and we had plenty of extra space. The only downside is that the mattresses were pretty old and creaky and should really be updated. Having a balcony that was completely screened in was such a bonus! We spent a ton of time sitting out there, enjoying the bug-free atmosphere. We overlooked a small lagoon which was really awesome (Building 4, Unit 501). We saw tons of birds, a gator, and even a bobcat early one morning. Awesome. The resort is a little further away than most, but if you love the chance to get away from everything, it is great. A car is a must. Overall, we had a fantastic stay and will definitely book here again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “No help from the staff when there is a problem - I dont recommend”
Reviews.Author: LAnn_10
Reviews.Content: Caribe Cove would be great if you had no problems with your unit. We travel a lot with our kids and prefer a condo because of the space. Caribe Cove's units are huge and very comfortable for a family of 4. Other than that, we were not impressed. When we first got to our unit we noticed a few issues. The curtain rod in the master was tilted and pulling out of the wall. ,the carpet was worn and a lot of marks on the walls. We then contacted the front desk so that we wouldnt be blamed. Then as we unpacked we noticed several other problems. The only outlet in the master bath didnt work, the counter top in the kitchen was coming up in several places and the headboard on the master was pulling out of the wall (they are hung on the wall). Then when my daughter took a shower in the 2nd bathroom the tub was filling up with water. We then contacted the front desk and was told that the maintenance man was on break and he would come over when he got back. We waited over an hour and nobody. When then called back to the front desk and was told he was still on break. We waited another 15 minutes and nothing so we called and said we were ready for bed and would call back the next day after we got back from the parks. When we got back the next day we called the desk and was told that they would send him over. Over an hour later nobody. So, we called back and he arrived about 15 minutes later. He came with NO tools or anything to fix the drain. All he needed was a screwdriver to unclog the drain. We showed him all the problems and he told us that he didnt have the tools to fix the drain or the outlet and that he would send over the head guy while we were gone at the parks the next day to fix everything. He also said that they knew of the issues with the headboards but they wont fix it. So, at this point we have spent half of our trip with only 1 shower and 1 outlet between 2 bathrooms. Well, nobody showed up the next day. My husband finally had to show up at the desk the following day (we didnt get back until real late the day before) and stress our issues before the head guy went to our unit. My husband showed him everything that was wrong and the head guy said that this unit should of never been rented out because of all the problems. He also said that housekeeping was not doing their job because all of these issues should of been reported. The manager never called us, we were never asked if we wanted to be moved..NOTHING!!! In the end out of 6 nights the only thing fixed was the drain. We had 3 girls getting ready in 1 bathroom because the other outlet was never fixed. We were told they were sending over an electrician (never showed). Oh, the dishwasher didnt work very well either. We started it one day before we left in the morning and it never ran a full cycle. It would work every other cycle. When we checked out my husband stressed our issues and that nobody ever came back to fix anything and the manager on duty only said sorry. We called the property manager twice now and havent heard back from them yet. It seems like a very nice property when you drive up but its a disquise. They do very little to keep it up and dont care at all if there are any issues. I am sure our unit was rented out again without fixing one issue. They do offer great a great price but spend your money at another property. You dont want to spend your vacation having problems and the property not fixing them.

Reviews.Title: “Don't click book! Horrible customer service & extra fees”
Reviews.Author: MeredithR
Reviews.Content: Horrible horrible horrible experience! We decided to extend our sons make a wish trip and stay a few extra days. After all day at the parks my family and I arrived here excited about or huge room reservation. Well the front desk line was long and customers were being slammed with extra fees left and right. Shocked customers were walking out. The front desk staff was short, rude and downright nasty. As I was waiting for my turn a couple came in and the wife refused the room talking about how dirty it was. Which is hilarious considering they tack on Large LARGE cleaning fees. We were staying for only one night, actually needing to check out early so even less then 12 hours! Yet our cleaning fee was $80??? I refused to pay it and we told to leave the hotel. Which we did and we were left trying to find another hotel at 9 at night with three tired kids 6 and under in the car.

Reviews.Title: “extra charges”
Reviews.Author: ireneflorida
Reviews.Content: booked through hotels.com for 1 night, after reading a previous review about cleaning costs, i phoned them to ask about them, i was told the only extra cost was the tax which is standard, upon arriving at the resort i was asked or my credit card.they asked for 200 dollars as a guarantee against breakages and damage which was ok. they then told me that i would have to pay 80 dollars for a cleaning charge, i had no choice but to pay because i was told i wouldnt get my money back anyway, whilst i dont blame the resort it seems sillly to pay apro 75 dollars to stay for one night and then pay 80 dollars to clean the apt, there were only the two of us and we stayed from 4pm to 10am the folling day, other than that the apt was clean and tidy and the resort was great. just beware of this charge when booking

Reviews.Title: “Worth every cent!”
Reviews.Author: Giselle2002
Reviews.Content: I first discovered this resort a few years ago on trip advisor. Back then it was still new so it was a no brainer. I booked a two bedroom as it was five of us . We live in the Caribbean so it takes us a full day to get to the Orlando area. I prayed all day that this place was not going to be a dump. When we arrived I was very impressed with the cleanliness and size of these apts.The apts look exactly as they do on the website pics. Just bigger in real. How refreshing is that? My husband (who is very particular) and I head straight there every time we visit Orlando because we have found nowhere of this standard for this price. Yes, I agree with some reviewers that the front desk staff could do with more training, but the people like Cathy, from housekeeping, who go out of their way to make sure you room is of the highest standard, make it all worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lissee2003
Reviews.Content: WOW!!!!!!!!!!!This place was great!Let me explain,my family which consisted of me,my husband,3 adult children 24,24,27,and a boyfriend and my 3 yr old grandson were on a trip to Disney world.We booked into caribe cove to find 3 very spacious rooms and 2 beautiful bathrooms,complete with a jacuzzi tub,shower and tons of space!!!!!!!!!!! They had a full size washer and dryer and a full kitchen that was well stocked! You are going to need to go to walmart for more coffee and more dish and laundry detergent.Now the bed issue,there not the best but not the worst either,they are cheap mattresses but soft so they are not brick hard!By the other reviews I thought I was going to have to buy a matress topper when I got there but thankfully that was not the case.Now about the front desk people,thet were ok,no there not the friendliest people on earth but the could be easily amused and bended the rules just a bit for check out,we could stay till 11 am.,and I do think we managed to check in at 3:30pm,we did have key issues,if you put your key in with your cell phones they will be voided oops that happened alot!But we managed to get more keys and life went on............ all in all we loved our stay,the pool was great and we had a great time!!!!!!Hope you all do too!

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy. Will Return”
Reviews.Author: Mxman005
Reviews.Content: Working in the Hotel industry, I am very critical when staying at other hotels. We really enjoyed our stay at Caribe Cove. Spacious room's and had plenty of room in the living area. Well stocked kitchen had all the utensils we needed. The surrounding area has plenty of restaurants and grocery stores for all your needs. Its a bit out in the middle of woods but your close enough to the theme parks that its a short enjoyable trip. You don't have the hustle and bustle of Orlando all around so you feel more relaxed. The only negative is the cleaning fee but really if you stay their for an extended period of time its not bad. Already trying to plan my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “NICE FACILITY”
Reviews.Author: nekuon
Reviews.Content: The facility was great. Location pleasant. Amenities desent. The only short fall is their customer service. The front desk representative and manager needs better customer service orientation. She (both ladies) lacked all aspects of customer’s relations. The night manger was extremely rude. Every other employee was friendly and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Beware Sky High Cleaning charges - and not that clean anyway”
Reviews.Author: Blindio
Reviews.Content: Booked on the Expedia UK site and on arrival told I had to pay $80 for cleaning - not a huge expense but we were only staying one night !! This was not detailed in value either on my confirmation from Expdia or on their UK website. We queried with the check staff and they showed us the US website which did show the charges. Well We may not have booked given that the Charges were more than 50% of the cost of the room. Check in staff would not waive so we asked for the manager - whose name was clearly shown on a slide in nameplate, in reception. The check in lady dealing with us said she was the manager and I pointed out the different name on the wall - get this - she opened a drawer took out a nameplate with her name on , walked over and removed the other one and came back and said - see I am the manager - Basil Fawlty eat your heart out. We either paid or lost or booking and money and when we got to the room we found breakfast cereal on the floor - not clean and very expensive charge avoid this place No waiving of the fee and Expedia refused to refund anything

Reviews.Title: “Not good, not bad”
Reviews.Author: lovedisney333
