Reviews.Content: We traveled to Orlando (myself, husband, and 9-year-old daughter) on the last week of August and after many reviews, selected the Caribe Cove for our stay. The good and the bad: Good: 1. clean and spacious kitchen 2. roomy 3. decent space 4. clean pool, although small Bad: 1. not clean in 2nd bedroom and one of the bathrooms! -- water not drained on tub with bugs on it. 2. carpet old and dingy -- dirt on the corners 3. dusty furniture in 2nd bedroom. 4. elevator old -- leads me to believe hotel was a refurnished - not brand new. Overall, it was a 20 minute drive to Disney - pool was small, but clean. To be fair, I would give it a 5 out of 10. Would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation for the entire family... bulls eye!”
Reviews.Author: godivaleeflorida
Reviews.Content: Top Favs 1. SPACIOUS 3 bedroom, dining, living, foyer, washer/dryer, screened in balconies, large bathrooms, sep tub/shower, 1,600 sq foot of space 2. Quiet and peaceful 3. Pool with sauna, jacuzzi, etc 4. Stayed in Building 2, 2 min walk to pool 5. Free dvd rentals and good wi-fi Turn Off's 1. 200 returnable deposit fee 2. 80 bucks cleaning fee 3. Staff could of been more cheerful and friendly 4. Pool looked big on website's video player, but not sooo big in reality

Reviews.Title: “Roomy, family-oriented condo hotel close to all Disney Parks!”
Reviews.Author: ID273
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at Caribe Cove (we usually stay at Bahama Bay, their "sister" resort instead), even though we "checked-it-out" (looked at the rooms) several years ago just after they opened; we just never "tried it" before. But, we're certainly glad that we finally did - my husband and I stayed in a 3-BR, deluxe suite (because of a nice price break at this time of the year); it was SO roomy that we almost found ourselves at first "getting lost" in the suite! WOW! They're big! Our suite could have easily accomodated 6 adults, with room to spare. The resort has been open 3 years now, and, it IS beginning to show its age already (especially with the carpets - off white; WHY do hotels always seem to prefer to use such LIGHT carpets?? - and the fading of overwashed furniture slip covers, and a few of the table lamps didn't function at all), but, overall, I think you'd be hard pressed to find a cleaner, nicer, or just plain BETTER resort in Kissimmee, for the price, with everything included (full kitchen, great appliances, huge fridge/icemaker, dishwasher, dishes, utensils, pots, pans, cookware, etc., just bring your own food! There is a Publix AND a Walmart close by. And - if you tire of eating in the condo - there is just about EVERY fast-food or chain restaurant known to man on Highway 192, and they're ALL only a few miles away), located at such a close distance to the Disney Parks. The beds are all very comfortable, there are flat-screen TV's in the bedrooms/living room, there's a full dining area with service for 8, two lanai/balconies, and the garden TUB in the master BR is great for soaking and long, relaxing bubble baths! We especially enjoyed kicking back each night on our huge, furnished balcony with a glass of champagne to watch the fireworks at The Magic Kingdom and Epcot (we were staying in building 5, room 503, but all of the higher floors - either 4 or 5 - with rooms facing EAST have decent firework views). The main drawback of Caribe Cove is that there is only ONE pool at the clubhouse (entrance to the complex), so you may have to walk some distance to get there, and it's not as BIG as it seems in the photos, so it stays very busy throughout the day. Also, we're not sure if there is a shuttle service to the Disney Parks (there is one at Bahama Bay, but it's fairly pricey, and doesn't run often enough), so we'd recommend having your own vehicle, especially with families. And, some people might be put-off by the fact that it is basically a "self-concierge" facility, you take care of your own light housekeeping during your stay, even though everyone is required to pay a final "cleaning fee" of $65 plus tax/esort fee, which ends up being $93 (and a $200 security/damage deposit, which will be refunded when you leave). My husband and I actually PREFER this, though, as that allows us our privacy, we like to cook, and, since a full-size washer and dryer is provided in each condo, dirty towels are not a problem (there are plenty provided throughout the condo as well, even larger towels for the pool). Overall, we feel that Caribe Cove would be an IDEAL location for a family, or groups, to stay, and, we highly recommend it; it's almost a "home-away-from-home", with a very friendly helpful, onsite staff, too. And, honestly, we HOPE to return as soon as possible!

Reviews.Title: “Superb resort, comfortable & quiet”
Reviews.Author: ally045
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caribe Cove in July 2010. Very impressed with the apartment - spacious, well equipped & very very clean. Staff were always helpful. The only time anything went wrong (the microwave stopped going round!) it was fixed immediately. The pool is lovely, and the whole place is so quiet, forest on 3 sides, and the road has almost no traffic. Oh yes - check your route by map - the road is not on sat-nav! Would recommend Caribe Cove to anyone. Leave some time off from theme parks to cool off in the pool.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: jalisa
Reviews.Content: we had a 2 bedroom and 2 bathroom condo type room. for 2 adults and 4 kids teenage boys. there was plenty of room. Well worth the 500.00 for a whole week. It was clean and plenty of towels. The kitchen was fully equipped. It also had a washer and dryer. There is a supermarket about 2 miles away and a 24/7 Super Walmart around 3 miles away. Disney World is 6 miles away and Universal. Plenty of restaurants near by. IHOP, TGIF, LONGHORN and local restaurants. Only bad thing is the beds are very uncomfortable very so bring an egg crate or something. also you have to go to the main lobby for internet.

Reviews.Title: “Very worth while”
Reviews.Author: apcc
Reviews.Content: Caribe Cove is a great place to stay. We loved it. We suggest to have tennis courts and Basketball Courts. Very spacious. The staff is excellent. We enjoyed our stay from beginning to end. Nothing but good things about Caribe Cove.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: minniedaisy
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Orlando with family of 5 including 2 teenagers and 1 tween. We have way outgrown a traditional hotel room and have to have space for sanity reasons. Booked a two bedroom two bath villa at Caribe Cove and loved it. The villa was spacious with a large master bedroom/bath, a second bedroom with two twins, second bath, dining area, large kitchen, living area with sleeper sofa, and private balcony. Kitchen had all amenities (utensils, microwave, coffee maker, etc). It was very clean. Check in was quick and the staff was consistently friendly throughout the 5 night stay. Free DVD rental is included for use on the DVD player in your living room. They give you a card that you swipe on a machine in the lobby and choose the movie. It includes new releases. The only possible drawback would be it is a large complex with one medium pool, but we did not even go to the pool our entire stay. We were out and about, coming in late and crashing. Not centrally located but very reasonable driving to various attractions. So you know, there is no housekeeping service. You wash your own towels with the included washer/dryer. You pay a $65 cleaning fee as part of the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, well priced, and plenty of room!”
Reviews.Author: JGFamily5
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at Caribe Cove during the week of the 4th of July and we were delighted with our experience. I saw their advertisement on the Orlando Travel & Visitors Bureau. The price was very reasonable and the pictures looked beautiful. When we arrived we found the rooms to be just like the pictures. It was clean, the rooms were large enough for our family of five, and the staff was friendly and helpful. It was only a short ride to Universal Studios and Disney. We also found a day trip to visit NASA in Cape Canaveral enjoyable and quite manageable from Caribe Cove. My family loved the place and I would both recommend it and return with my family when we return to the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place To Stay!”
Reviews.Author: charrishenjoyinglife
Reviews.Content: My and family and I enjoy every moment during our visit to Caribe Cove Resort. We were a little shaken when our names were not on the reseveration list, but the manager on duty was so helpful and reassured me that everything would be fine and it was! The rooms were exceptional in style and cleanliness. Well, the mattress was not as welcoming as everything else, hey cant have it all. We are looking forward to staying here again as this was our first visit to Florida and did not know what to expect.Curiosity satisfied!!!!!!! Just be sure to bring your extra personal items for your stay in the room, other than that you will definitely enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spring Vacation Getaway”
Reviews.Author: jessero
Reviews.Content: Largest hotel room we've ever rented. We got the 3 bedroom, everyone slept comfortably. I loved it, we had stayed at the other location previously and the service is always A+!

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Treasure!”
Reviews.Author: clandrum
Reviews.Content: I found this place on the internet and took a chance. Wow! was I pleasantly surprised. It exceeded our expectations. My husband and I were celebrating our fifth wedding anniversary and booked the three bedroom villa. We had more space than we knew what to do with! The units are fully equipped with everything you could possibly need. Walk in closets with plenty of room. Ladies, you'll love the kitchen! The room was just as you see it on the virtual tour (go to caribecove.com). We went food shopping at walmart and saved tons of money by mostly eating in which was just fine for us. The grounds were lovely and well manicured. It is quiet, & peaceful. The only negavtive, if you can even consider it a negative, is that the workout room is relatively small. The pool area is also mid-size but meets the need if the resort is not too crowded. This is a good, private area off the main strip and away from the maddening crowd. We have already told our friends about it and are considering returning for christmas.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this place and can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: ibgeno
Reviews.Content: We just got home from a month long vacation in the Orlando Florida area. A friend recommened we stay at Caribe Cove Resort. On his recommendation we booked our stay with them. For about the same price as a standard hotel room, this is what we got. We were on the first level in building four. The view from ourt patio was incredible! Woods in the background with a small pond in front of the wooded area. Nearly every night, we sat out in our screened-in patio and saw birds and small animals like raccoons and opossums drinking from the pond. We found it relaxing to return after a long day of doing tourist things like Disney and Universal. Our unit was spacious (1600 sq ft) and quiet. It had a full kitchen with cups, silverware, pots, pans, containers, etc.(Cooking breakfast and packing a lunch saved us a small fortune on eating out) Each unit also has a diswasher and washer/dryer, wired internet connection and cable tv with HBO. The carpets did have some stains, but overall, the place was clean. The grounds were also beautiful! The staff does a wonderful job maintaining everything. Every day we saw crews enter vacant units to clean carpets, power wash patio screens or paint before the new guests arrived. Everything looked as nice as the photos on their website. The clubhouse for the resort is located at the front entrance. It has a workout area with equipment, a small store to buy things like toiletries, cards, soda, icecream bars, etc. and an area with computers for guest use. They sell stamps and mail letters for guests and even set out complimentary cookies and coffee. Guests can get free movies from the clubhouse to watch in their unit. There is not a huge selection like at a video store, but there are plenty to choose from and many of the titles are current releases. There is an outdoor pool just behind the clubhouse. There is also a steamroom, sauna and locker rooms for guests. Caribe Cove Resort is in a great location. It's only about a fifteen minute drive to Disney...a little further to Seaworld or Universal. There is a Super Target and a Super Walmart within 3 miles. There are also several restuarants nearby. However, it is far enough away from the above mentioned things to still be quiet and somewhat secluded. Just so there are no surprises, Caribe Cove charges additional fees beside the cost of the unit. There is a cleaning fee of $65.00 and a $5.95 per day service charge for internet, phone and workout equipment usage. This is charged up front when you book in. All units are smoke free. If you choose to smoke in your unit they will charge you an additional $200.00 to get rid of smoke smell. (You are permitted to smoke on the patios.) Check in was at 4:00 pm/ check out at 10:am. Each unit comes with one of standard things like tissue, tp, soap. After that, you must supply your own. We just picked up what we needed at Walmart. They also don't have maid service, so if you mess it up, you clean it. The only thing that we were disappointed with was that the mattresses were not very comfortable. They really need to be replaced with higher quality ones. Aside from that, we loved our stay here and would highly recommend it to anyone. I think it would be difficult to find such a nice place for a similar price. We can't wait to get back! Thank you Caribe Cove staff for a wonderful vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and excellently maintained Units”
Reviews.Author: bowes5
Reviews.Content: Great Complex, the location is less than 15 minutes from Disney, ideal for Family break to visit all Theme Parks Orlando has to offer. Very spacious accomodation, and great value for money, staff all very helpful. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “What a steal”
Reviews.Author: rcrawley12
Reviews.Content: After spending hours upon hours online searching for the ideal place for our family disney adventure I came across this awesome place. It seemed too good to be true. I read all the reviews and trust trip advisor and decided to book a 3 BR condo. I dare anyone to find a better value in the orlando area. Yes th beds were not the best, were Hampton Inn peopel and love a good bed, but we were traveling with 6 kids 12 and under so sleep was not an option. The carpet was that of a large family oriented place, it was stained but did not smell at all, im sure we added to the stains. Nothing else bad to say at all. Full size kitchen with all the full size coforts of home. The master suite was bigger than most hotel rooms with a door opening to a screened in balcony. It was not in a busy noisy part of town but had easy access to plenty of dining and retail as well as grocery stores. The pool was great along with hot tub, steam room and sauna. Easy access to the disney parks 10 mins i would say. A little longer to universal. But wasy access to I-4 for Busch Gardens fans. We will surly stay here again. Final bill for 7 nights was right at $800 tax fees and all. GREAT VALUE for a new safe friendly condo.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay - even better price!”
Reviews.Author: scottandlily
Reviews.Content: I don't normally take the time to review but this was a great bargain and a lovely place to stay in the "Disney" area! The price of $89 a night for a 3 bedroom suite complete with a screened balcony (with table and chairs), full kitchen/dining area, living room and laundry room ensuite was not your average bargain! We were 1 couple (master bedroom), 1 single woman (mid 40s) and one young mother (25) and 3 year old. Our only goal was to do Disney this trip (3 yo is our grandson). We stayed 5 nights and were extremely happy with the staff and the service as well as the accomodations. Clean suite as well as well groomed grounds. Pool was perfect for a late afternoon break and lots of places to eat close by. Note: You must have a car to stay here, but the short 15 - 20 minute drive is easy to area attractions. We always rent a car so no problem for us. Enjoy! Have already sent relatives there and they are back happy!

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT listen to the negative reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: DaveNew
Reviews.Content: I will have to admit that before I left for Orlando that the negative reviews here had me a bit concerned about Caribe Cove, but learned soon after I arrived that the complaints were all full of it as some exaggerated things deliberately. I will try to be as thorough as possible of my entire experience at Caribe as I just left from there yesterday. The staff were very friendly. I was expecting after hearing the negative reviews that I would be checked in by some person that would have a "I don't give a rats rear end that you chose to spend your vacation with us" attitude. However, the girl (did not get her name) that checked us in was as friendly as can be. She spent time explaining things and even answered our questions. I was always greeted by the staff whenever I entered the building. I saw smiles every time I walked in there, so I have no clue what the complainers were talking about. There were normally one to two employees at the desk. I did see them answering the phones, so I am not sure what people were saying that the front desk does not answer their phones. My only guess is probably they can only do one or two calls at a time. If more than 2 guests call then they cannot pick up. Just a guess. I stayed in building 5 room 303. I came to learn that the descriptions "few" people gave in their negative reviews concerning the rooms were not accurate. The room was very clean and it had a fresh smell when I walked in. The one complaint claimed that their security deposit ($200) was not refunded because they were accused of smoking in their room. I can say that it will be quite obvious that you smoked in the room because they do smell very fresh. The guests probably were not smokers but had either a cigar or a friend over that smoked. You will know in these rooms whether someone smoked or not. There were also plenty of towels that Caribe provided in the closets and on the towel racks. I had the impression that they did not supply towels for some reason but there were at least 12 or more towels in our room. Many of the complaints involving the beds not being comfortable are partially true. If you have a foam mattress at home or have some top notch bed then you might be disappointed with their mattress. If you are used to bed springs or simply have a mediocre bed at home then you will be just fine. I have a bad back and was able to fall asleep quick. Their bed springs were not stiff at all. You literally will sink nearly to the bottom. It actually felt good to me when dozing off. I did have an occasional pain but flipping on my side from time to time solved that. I did discover some problems that I reported to front desk. I told the lady that my one patio doors would not open. I informed her that the lights outside would not turn on. The one outlet in the bathroom also did not work. She was very polite and wrote the info down and told me that she would inform maintenance. It took about an hour or so before maintenance came knocking at my door. Turns out that the patio door lock was not broken but that the door itself was off its track as that took him 15 seconds to fix. The outside lights was easily fixed as he simply pressed the reset button on the outlet. I would never have thought of that since nothing was plugged into the outlets. The outlet in the bathroom had the Test/Reset button that were stuck. He was unable to get the reset button to press in, so he gave me an option of him running out to get a new outlet or have someone come back in the morning. It wasn't important to me. The maintenance guy was very polite from beginning to end. Yes, I did find some spots on the carpet. I could also tell that Caribe did what they could to have them removed. If you are expecting Caribe to replace carpet every 3 months then you might be disappointed. I think some people were being a tad bit anal on this one. If you go looking for problems then you will find it. If you go looking for any speck of dust then I bet you will find it. However, I realized that carpet used over and over again will get spots on them. The rooms smelled and looked clean. If it smelled like Coppertone and sweaty socks then I would be complaining too but it didn't. The rooms were all very large. Huge closet spaces in each room. Extra blankets if you are somehow cold in Florida. Absolutely loved it. I had to learn how to use the DVD player. Usually I have to hit some input button or hit menu to access the DVD player on other TVS. If you go there then you might have to figure it out as well. In my room, I had to click the up arrow button to go one channel more than 99 to get the DVD to appear on screen. Caribe obviously cares about it grounds keeping. I 'constantly' was seeing men working to keep the grounds looking good. Every day I had seen maintenance cleaning, painting and so on. Even the elevator we used was cleaned daily by a friendly guy that would greet us with a hello and a smile. They do have free DVD rentals that you can check out. They are not a Blockbuster video company so ignore the complaints that someone gave. If you think you will find 1000+ movies then you will be disappointed. My guess is that they have around 15 to 20 movies per category (Kids, Thriller, Sci-Fi, Action, etc). The movies were more recent and not the black and white garbage or movies from the 70's. The pool wasn't huge but was nice to relax by. It never was overly crowed when I was there either. I read a negative review that Caribe does not supply pool towels. First, don't be a lazy a** and bring the freaking towel from your room and stop complaining. Second, when I checked out on Thursday (17th) at 10am, I asked Gloria if my family and I could hang out around the pool since we were no longer guests of the resort. Our flight wasn't until 3:50pm and didn't feel like sitting at the airport or driving around all morning with a rental car. Gloria was as friendly as can be as I rarely meet people as nice as she was. She said that we could stay and use the pool and even offered us pool towels. Pool towels are available, but you have to ask for it. We brought towels from home believing that Caribe did not supply towels from certain negative reviews when they supplied more than enough. Laundry detergent is not supplied in the rooms. I don't know why some believe that Caribe Cove is to supply your detergent for your soiled clothes. Target is just over 2 miles down the road on 192 on the right hand side. Buy your food and laundry supplies there. Tide detergent is also sold across from the front desk at Caribe Cove. Caribe Cove supplies one roll paper towels, and one role of toilet paper per bathroom. I read some negative reviews where they seem to expect Caribe to wipe their backside for them. Having such an attitude will spoil the vacation. I almost let the negative reviews convince me that Caribe Cove might be a problem place before arriving. Caribe Cove certainly proved them wrong. I wonder if these same complainers whine to their rental car provider for not supplying gas to their car that they use up during their driving around. As for your $200.00 security deposit. I again listened to those negative reviews here that claimed that Caribe Cove would not release their hold on the money. Caribe Cove releases the hold upon check out. However, Gloria made it very clear that YOUR bank might take a few days before lifting that hold. Don't assume Caribe is holding your money. You just might have to wait 3 days or so before your bank releases the money. It's just like waiting for a check to clear. People here were so quick to blame Caribe Cove. Don't listen to those goofs as they can seriously affect your overall experience there. The air conditioning works exceptionally. My wife and I practically had icicles hanging from our noses as it got quite cold in there. Someone before us must have set the air to below 60 degrees. Our room was 66 degrees when we arrived. It did feel good though walking in from the heat. The air conditioning unit was outside between the two patios. I was surprised at how large it was. I live in a home much bigger than the resort, but my air conditioning unit is smaller that what they use. You will not have to worry about the air not being cool enough in these rooms. Yes, there was a guard on duty at night. He was very polite to us as we had to check in around 11:30pm one night. Some complained that he was not on duty when they showed up. I have to assume that night guards have to go potty just like any other human being. However, a gate is still down so don't assume that some stranger can just drive in when the guard is not present. They did have a box that appears that you have to swipe your room card to get in if the guard is not present. I guess some complainers just prefer a grand entrance from a security guard as they feel their money demands it. The fact that some would complain about that tells me that they are goofs no matter where they go on vacation. Room 303 did have a wonderful view of trees and a pond. Some complained that they had a parking lot view, or a view of a dumpster. I have to say that people are not loitering around the parking lots there. The patios are screened in entirely to keep bugs out. The dark screen they use will not make you as noticeable sitting outside. It was so hot outside that I doubt anyone would want to spend their days in the lot staring at you eating up in your balcony. The dumpsters that I saw were simply a large green garbage can with a lid on it that was kept by the side walk. It wasn't like a huge dumpster that you could see everyone's mess exposed with bees and flies in it having their meal. We just have some people coming here looking to exaggerate their bitterness with life is my guess. The pool was a bit of a walk in the heat. I would simply drive the 15 seconds over to the pool instead. It was no big deal so don't let people make you think that the pool is just so far away that it is not worth going. The workout room is closed in by glass windows. The workout room was closed during my visit. I saw fans, so I assume possible water damage was the reason (not sure so don't quote me). I never really saw anyone hanging out in the lobby area so if you do not like being watched while exercising then I do not see it being a problem there. Here are my recommendations for having a good time at Caribe: 1. Pack an extra roll or two of toilet paper from home to bring with. 2. Bring 2 large garbage bags from home in your suit case. We brought 30 gallon bags. 3. Find a bottle with a screw top lid and pour enough detergent in it that you believe will be sufficient to wash all your clothes when there. You can also purchase some when you arrive. 4. They supply you one small dish washing package for the dishwasher. Either go to target and buy paper plates, paper cups, plastic silverware, and so on to keep from using the dishwasher, or pack a little dishwasher detergent to run the dishwasher more than once if needed. I was able to get away with one single wash. All you need to bring is a zip-lock sandwich bag full of cascade. Cheap problem solved!! 5. If the beds hurt your back too much because you were accustomed to a nice bed at home then buy a $25.00 king size air mattress at Target. It will deflate and fit nicely in your suitcase when done. I personally believe that the mattress was just fine. 6. I don't know if you are like me, but Caribe Cove was very quiet at night. I need noise to sleep. Pack a noisy fan if you are like me. 7. Bring your GPS to find places. Caribe Cove was nicely located to practically everything. 8. DO EXPECT a cleaning charge around $107.00 (includes other things as well) and a $200.00 hold on your credit card UPON Check-In. If you do not know this then I can see how it might strike a nerve with some. However, you can't complain for your ill planning. I knew these things before I arrived. Expect to pay upon check-in. 9. This one does not relate to Caribe Cove. If you get a rental car then do NOT pay for their insurance as it is a scam. Your car insurance will cover it to begin with. Thrifty really went out of their way to try and scare us to get their expensive insurance. Don't fall for it. Just call your car insurance company before leaving if you want to make sure that your rental car would be covered. 10. Don't go looking for problems!! If you do encounter dust then you can either let it ruin your vacation, or you can take the 5 seconds it takes to wipe it away. You will find that the counters are clean. Do complain if you find shampoo residue, food stains, hairs in the drain, and so on that I am certain you will not find, but give us a break that you found some dust somewhere. Don't let the other negative reviewers spoil your vacation initially like it did mine in the beginning. I walked in my room the first day looking for trouble because of those goofs. However, it took about 2 days for me to realize that Caribe Cove was an awesome place that truly cared about me enjoying my stay there. My only complaint is that Florida in June was too damn hot!!!! I definitely will recommend Caribe Cove to my friends and anyone else that asks me where to room at. When I plan on returning to Florida then Caribe Cove will be where I am going to stay. I saw other resorts while there and they clearly do not keep up with their place like Caribe did. I was very happy. I just regret assuming the negative reviews to be a genuine possibility. At least it did not take me long to realize that these whiners were all full of crap. Caribe Cove is definitely the place to relax at.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: CasanovaFamily
Reviews.Content: This is the most beautiful place that I stay in Orlando, It`s so beautiful,quiet,and relaxing,the pool area is great,the rooms are big,clean and comfortable and they have everything you need .I hope we can stay in Caribe Cove every time we visit Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Rude and Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Whoaty
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, 1pm we were met by Gloria , we arrived early and was told since we didn't pay for early check in we would have to wait until 4pm. We advised Gloria we had no idea about early check in and she smartly stated, " If you would've booked through our website you would've known. We drove around and got some supplies for the week and returned @ approx. 230pm and were told nothing was ready and we would still have to wait until 4pm. We were finally allowed to check in and when we got to the room there were dirty towels sitting outside of the room and forgot to put our room keys in our folder. Initial check-in inspection revealed cracked furniture, dirty carpet, spots on the bathroom wall and a broken latch on the front door. We also discovered the ice maker was broken. The next evening we pulled out a blanket to watch television and discovered hair all over the blanket. We pulled out all of the blankets only to discover there was hair throughout 4 separate blankets The next morning we notified the front desk, Gloria, who said she would tell someone about it. When asked would she be sending someone over she stated I will tell someone. Maintenance finally came took the broken furniture, fixed the ice maker after 3 tries. We took the blankets to Gloria and asked for the manager, after requesting him 4 times, Gloria kept stating she was the front desk supervisor, he finally came out and asked what was the problem. He looked at the blankets and said they looked more like mattress covers. We notified Bookit who made good on their end and offered concessions. Stay @ Caribe Cove @ your own risk. I hope you don't run into Gloria. As as result of this trip we purchased a timeshare to avoid running into another Gloria or another Caribe Cove. If not for the inconvenience of packing the entire family up and having to pay additional fees elsewhere we would have left. Bookit is working on finding us somewhere else to stay, we only pray they do. The only good thing we found so far is the peace and quiet and the pool. I'm not one to complain but this is ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel next to disney world!”
Reviews.Author: superpug
Reviews.Content: We went with all my family to Disney World, aunts uncles, grandparents, kids, teens, adults... Everyone was there. We had a blast, awesome pool, with sauna, and steam room, great views from the rooms. LOVED the private patio. Just a 7 minute drive to Animal Kingdom. 15 minutes from universal, and sea world. Please stay here, you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected stay, but wow, what a stay!”
Reviews.Author: trails60
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to fly home on 26 Feb after having stayed in a villa. Due to snowstorms, our flight was cancelled and we were stuck in Orlando for 3 more nights. What now? I looked on internet to find accommodation large enough for the 5 of us and all our luggage. There it was, Caribe Cove. I phoned and booked for 3 nights. When we got there it was only 3 PM and the wonam at the front desk would not let us check in, she was NOT friendly at all. We were wary after the first contact at Caribe Cove. We went to have a meal and when we returned at 4 PM other employees were at the front desk and they were extremely nice and friendly. When we got to our 3 bedroom condo, we were in awe. What space and what luxury. They were painting some spots on the wall and apologized for that. We didn't mind though. We found the plug on the big bath (garden tub...eh....isn't that a big tub in the garden??) missing and one of the lightbulbs was broken. I phoned the frontdesk and the man there knew my name. He would send someone over and yes, 5 minutes later a man came to look at the problem and 5 minutes later we could take a bath and the light worked. We enjoyed the swimmingpool, spa, sauna and steamroom. And the free coffee and delicious cookies. Als we watched one of the free dvds. Of course you need to buy your own detergent when you're in a self catering accommodation. That is normal. A Wal*mart is more or less around the corner. Anyway, we loved it so much that for our next holiday, we have booked a condo again!! Our compliments to Kathy at front desk, she was great!! Thanks for making our extended vacation even better than it already was!

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: MinnyFamily
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home after a 4 day trip to Disney Parks. The room was wonderful for our family of five (3 young children). The room was very large with great space for moving around and the place was very very clean. The staff was friendly enough and even allowed us to check in an hour early, which was great since one of our children was sick. The location to the parks and food establishments was fabulous. The grounds were very quiet and kept very nicely. I believe each day we saw grounds crew tending to the grounds. We will certainly stay here again when we come back to Disney. Thanks Caribe Cove for a nice vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, well equipped and spacious apartments”
Reviews.Author: Banana13021
Reviews.Content: We were looking for somewhere to stay for extended family for just a couple of days, before heading along to the Gulf coast. We usually stay in villas, but can't book them for 'just a day or two' especially at this busy time of year, just before Christmas. We got a great nightly rate of just $68 per night and got an apartment with rooms easily the size of many villas we stayed in, 3 large bedrooms, 2 huge bathrooms, full sized kitchen and lounge, even a good sized laundry room fully equipped with full size washer and dryer. Oh and free internet connection. The staff were courteous and helpful, the apartment was spotless. The location is just a few hundred yards from the busy 192, with it's shops, grocery stores and restaurants and it's a really easy drive to the parks, especially using the Sherberth Road or 429 routes. There is a cleaning charge on check-out, that you have to pay, regardless of how long you've stayed, I think it was around $50. So long as you know in advance, there's no 'suprise at the charge' and even adding that onto the room cost, it's still a great value resort. We wanted a place as a base and wasn't looking for an 'all singng, all dancing' resort with loads of facilities and it suited us. Having said that, there was a swimming pool, a small gym and a small shop (though it unfortunately didn't sell anything as useful as milk, it did have soft drinks). For the few days we were there, we had a great time and would recommend it, we were only sorry that we weren't there longer.

Reviews.Title: “excellent please”
Reviews.Author: fridachi
Reviews.Content: It´s a wonderfull condo with indredible apartments. They are huge with many and enormous rooms, big kitchen with everything, many bathrooms, private loundry. It´s perfect for a family, it has all the amenities that someone could need and the price it more than correc for an apartment like that. And they have also a pool but if you are going to the parks, i don´t think you would have time to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet family getaway - restful between visits to Disney and Universal”
Reviews.Author: sibbaldgrant
Reviews.Content: Excellent rooms, facilities okay on site, shops nearby to enable purchasing of any consumables. Wide choice of Restaurants in close proximity

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place for Families....”
Reviews.Author: dammish30
Reviews.Content: We spent 11 days at Caribe Cove in February 2010. Everything about this experience was great. Rooms clean (although the floors could have been a little cleaner). I did spend a great deal of time washing floors. I am sure the housekeepers have their hands full with check ins and outs so they must not spend a great deal of time on the details. Pool extremely heated which is what we needed in February. Club house serves up warm cookies every day and at check in they give you a movie card to rent movies for FREE. This was a nice feature. No security at entry point, however, although it looks as though the place was built with that intention ... perhaps with the lack of people traveling, they can no longer afford to pay security. All in all, a good experience and the staff nice and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Margo41
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Caribe Cove from March 28 to April 4, 2010. We are a family of 6 - 2 adults and 4 kids (20, 22, 17, 4). Loved it!! Will go again!! Check in, as well as check out, took less then 10 min. The stuff was very helpful throughout our stay. The room was clean and looked just as the picture. All appartments have screened balconies - a safety feature among everything else - my 4 years old son played there all the time and I did not have to worry about him falling out or anything like that. The kitchen had everything we needed, and with Wal-Mart being so close to the hotel, we enjoyed home made meal every evening. Another very helpful feature is the washer and dryer. We actually came home with clean clouth. Tips: bring your own laundry detergent, dish soap, dish washer soap, garbige bags, toilet paper, paper towels, beach towels. One more thing - about the mattresses. We found them very comfortable - my husband's back problems did not bother him during out stay there. We will absolutely go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: JimCayman
Reviews.Content: Excellent place, wow the look inside was like a magazine, great pool, good price, close to Walmart, Target, Publix. Bad: You need a car because its off the main road, poor front desk service in the day, the night staff was so much more friendly, Overall very good place to spend a vacation

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families visiting Disney on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: CameronWisconsin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caribe Cove March 20-26 and found the accomodations to be great. The rooms were spacious and looked just like the websites we visited. There was some dust and some of the carpets had stains, but overall it was very nice. We stayed in a 2 bedroom with 5 people and had plenty of room. One thing I will mention is the uncomfortable beds, the mattresses are very cheap! The full kitchen helped us save money on dining costs, as we cooked most of our evening meals here. When we arrived, we went to a nearby Wal-Mart and stocked up on food and toiletries -the hotel only provides 2 rolls of toilet paper, 1 roll of paper towels and a pack of dish detergent to do only 1 load of dishes. For a family of 5, that wasn't enough and they charge for any additional toiletries. I loved the washer and dryer-it was very convenient and we came home with clean clothes! The building grounds were beautiful and well maintained. The pool was very warm and clean although we only used it a couple of times because it opens at sunrise and closes at sunset, and we were at the parks until dark most nights. We found the staff to be friendly. There is no shuttle service to any of the parks, so you definately need your own vehicle to get around and keep in mind, parking at the Disney parks is $14.00 a day! Overall, we were very pleased with our stay and would definately return. It was a money saving alternative to staying on property.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place, but remember its not a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MTMartin
Reviews.Content: We found the place after days of searching high-priced "Disney" hotels and were blown away when we realized the quality of Caribe Cove. Truly an apartment in every regard. Everything is quite new and in great condition. It even smelled new. The bottom line: this is definitely the place to stay for a Disney vacation. Here are a few things you should know. DISNEY COMMUTE: It took us about 30 minutes to drive, park, and enter every park. We travelled with a two-year old and returned to Caribe mid-day for a nap. This took a lot of time out of a highly priced day at Disney. If mid-day hotel naps are required, and you can afford it, stay at a Disney Resort hotel. KITCHEN: Having the kitchen was very nice and saved us an enormous amount on food. Keep in mind that this is not a gourmet kitchen. Plan meals that require only basic kitchen tools. IMPORTANT: Think of this as renting an apartment, not a hotel. There is no daily maid service. A washer an dryer is provided, but no laundry detergent. Only one load's-worth of dish washer detergent is provided and no dish soap. Toilet paper is provided, but only what comes on the holders when you check in. If you need more, you'll have to buy it. There is a Super Target and Publix about five minutes away. CUSTOMER SERVICE: Most of the complaints on Caribe Cove focused on the lack of customer service. Sometimes I think people are looking for something to complain about or tend to read into someone's tone as rude when there's no rudeness there at all. Take these complaints with a grain of salt. We found a broken coaster and DVD player when we checked in. Within an hour, maintenance had arrived and taken care of both items. The front desk attendant was very courteous and helpful. Mid-stay, we decided to extend it by one night, but wanted it at the discounted priced we were already paying. One visit to the front desk was all it took. She couldn't alter a reservation there (again, not a hotel), but within an hour, she had called our room and confirmed the extra night at the requested price. INTERNET: There is WIRED internet in the rooms and one 12-foot cable is provided. There are ports in the living area and bedrooms. There is no wi-fi in the rooms. There is wi-fi in the lobby. The lobby has two-computers and a printer, but you have to buy pre-paid cards to use them. BEDS: Bed quality is good. They are typical hotel mattresses; they are nothing too special. The sheets are pretty low quality, so bring your own if that is really important to you. Bottom line again: Stay here and you won't regret it!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Mattresses Ever - Impossible to get a good night sleep”
Reviews.Author: TJFLL
Reviews.Content: To start, I think the resort still had more positive than negative. We had the 3 bedroom, it was large and all usable space. The location was close and convenient to everything we wanted to do. Every kind of restuarants you could want less than 2 miles up the road. When we checked in, we were given a room on the ground floor. I entered the room and everything in the room was not quite right. The lamp shades were not on the lamps as the bulbs were too large for the lamp shades; there were 3 large sliding glass doors out to the patio, although the doors were closed, the doors could not be locked at all(that is an uncomfortable feeling); all of the bulbs in the ceiling lights were of different brightness and watts. With the patio doors not able to lock, I packed up everyone and went back to the front desk. I told him of my issues with the room and told him to please select another room, the best one they have. He asked if I would prefer to have maintenance come to the room. I said absolutely not, I am on vacation, do your maintenance on your own time. I also mentioned that this resort charges a $65.00 cleaning charge, It did not seem to me that they are doing a good job at the cleaning and maintence for the amount of money they are charging. My next room, everthing was in order, I was very happy with the room. Of course until it was bed time. The best way to describe the mattress is cheap, cheap, cheap, cheap. Feels like a total of 6 to 8 springs in the entire mattress. The mattress will completely colapse when you move on it. The springs make a tremendouse amount of noise with any movement on the bed - "ping, chung, kong, boing" - you get the picture. We actually were all laughing, our stomachs hurt, the mattresses were so bad it was funny. But joking aside, I do not have any back problems, but after two nights sleeping on this mattress, my back hurt. Nor was I able to sleep, just tossed and turned all night. It was the mattress. And that is not funny. I did complain the morning of check-out to the front desk - I told them that I am sure that you have had complaints about your mattresses before, the girl smiled and said yes. I went on to state that for the prices that they are charging, they need to upgrade the mattresses. She smiled and said yes. I told her that I am 44 years old and in my entire life I have never slept on such a poor mattress. She again smiled, I think this time hoped that I would shut up and go away. I did. But not without thinking to myself that when I get home I am going to write a reveiw. By the way, I have never written a review before. It is with the hope that someone at the resort reads it and orders new mattresses.

Reviews.Title: “This was worth the money and then some!”
Reviews.Author: LeighLasVegas
Reviews.Content: We booked the 3 bedroom, 2 bath condo. I read so many reviews AFTER we had booked our trip but BEFORE we went on vacation tahyt I was worried I had made the wrong choice.... We were a family of 9 and that being my husband and myself plus our 4 kids 14.11.4.3 plus my sister and her 2 kids 9 & 6 mths old. The minute we walked in and got settled in, I knew we had made the perfect choice. Yes we did go out and buy several bath towels plus some groceries and dish soap and laundry at the nearby Super target. So we did do laundry on a regular basis but we went home with CLEAN clothes. This place was so worth the money for 5 nights. And though its a little bit of a ride to the theme parks it was still worth it because of the $$ we saved to stay off propety. I would recommend it to anyone.... And if a little dust worries you, bring some anti-bacterial wipes and do a light cleaning and whatnot prior to use. It was nice to come back after being at dif theme parks all day and part into the night. For dinners, we didnt feel like cooking so we ordered take-out from pizza to Chinese Food etc... We used the dishes that were provided and if anyone wanted leftovers there was a microwave to re-heat. The fridge we had stocked with juices and sodas and was alwas good to go.... If you're looking for a wonderful and money saving hug rental - we recommend this place!! I dont know about rude front desk staff either as we gave our names and checked in and was in a clean place pretty fast... BTW - we didnt count on checking in early...we went to gatorland for the morning and part of the afternoon to avoid that headache....

Reviews.Title: “The rooms smell brand new like when I bought my new car smell”
Reviews.Author: ldmantrip
Reviews.Content: I went to the resort with my family. My daughter said wow its smells like your new car when it was new. I guess its that new furniture or carpet smell. I believe this is one the newer resorts only a couple years. That's very important to us we dont like it run down. The rooms are extremely spacious above the average. The people are not that experience but are really nice you can tell they try , but for the price and what you get. You can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “problems overshadowed any possible values in this place”
Reviews.Author: travelgooses
Reviews.Content: Prior to our visit, we read the reviews on Trip Advisor and had done so with out last FL resort. The previous resort rated poorly but turned out to be an above average place to stay. The Caribe, on the other hand, seemed to have an overall positive rating but turned out to be a poor choice. Although the location was relatively quiet with large sized accommodations and nice bathrooms, the negatives outweighed anything that was likable about the place. It began with the reservation process when the agent told us that we may be able to check-in early if we are in the area--a statement that was totally false. When we arrived at the check-in counter, the clerk kept putting us off and did NOT set a good standard for customer service agents. She told us that the room was being cleaned and to check back later, which turned out to be an untruth. When we finally received our room assignment, we could easily see that the rooms had not been cleaned anytime recently nor was any attention paid to detail. (This fact is a disturbing one because guests are required to pay a 65 dollar cleaning charge with each visit.) There was a layer of dust on several pieces of the furniture, makeup stains on articles in the bathroom and a dirty pan in the oven. Moreover, the beds were uncomfortable and there was a constant glare of fluorescent balcony lights that shines in one bedroom to the effect of full but unnatural daylight. Even with two layers of bed coverings over the window, the light still came through. The walls are also thin and the neighbors' televisions and toilets can be heard in the bedrooms. On some mornings, the water was only lukewarm when showering. There was only one packet of dish soap, which was a huge inconvenience because there was also a shortage of cooking pots and pans. The pool area closed way too early in the evenings. If they want to improve this place, they can begin by offering more thoughtful customer service agents. They should not pretend that early check-in is possible and certainly not employ rude agents at the check-in counter. They need to install light blocking shades, paint the walls, clean the rugs, replace the mattresses and springs, and stock this vacation place with adequate amounts of necessary items. With all of the choices of places to stay in FL, I do not recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “"Absolutely fabulous"”
Reviews.Author: shamul0ver
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 10 Days just before Christmas. 2 bedroom condo huge!! Immaculately clean and very comfortable. Parking near your condo building and elevator, great when you bring in your shopping. Some people complain about the resort fee (just over $5 per day) and the cleaning fee (about $65 dollars), but I think well worth it as grounds were super and a very large apartment to clean, I wouldn't want to do it for $65 dollars. Furniture better than average. We hav a little problem with the remove for our TV. Stopped at club house on our way out in am and was done by the time we got home. Can't ask for better than that. We are going again end Feb. Lovely and quiet and very close to disney and the highway. Can't wait. Visitor from Canada

Reviews.Title: “Watch your Credit Card Statment!!!”
Reviews.Author: DocFo
Reviews.Content: The place was nice but they will try to get you for smoking in your room and charge you $200 even if you dont smoke or smoked in the room.... after call and call they have yet to give me my money back and said its my word against theirs..... if you plan to stay just watch your statment when you get home!!!

Reviews.Title: “don't waste your money on this resort”
Reviews.Author: voyage123New_york
Reviews.Content: While the accomodations are acceptable, the service is terrible. I wish I can upload pictures I took how certain views are horrible. The resort is owned 90% by foreigners ( Europe I believe), which explains the reviews they put since they all go back for vacation . THe front desk is not accomodating at all. We stayed for a full week with a view on an overflowing dumster, at night they were several animals in this dumster. Please don't make the same mistake I made. There are a lot nice hotels and resorts in the area, look around. All the best...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Travellers774
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 3 bedroom condo. It was amazing. Loads of space for 3 adults and 3 children. Full kitchen and laundry very handy. Close to Disney. Has a Publix and a Super Target just down the road. Quiet location. Would recommend this place to anyone travelling to Orlando with family. Danny at front desk was always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome. Large well equipped condos, really helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: topgas
Reviews.Content: Wow! We were in a fantastic 3 bed condo that was immaculate and enormous. To start from the beginning, the resort is located off the 192 Irlo Bronsen Highway, right at the western end, just before you get to the 27. There's a big sign before the junction telling you it's next left at the lights. Half a mile down the side road and you find the main gate on the right. Unfortunately the road hasn't made it into satnav/gps yet, and the flag on the Tripadvisor Google Maps is way out, so just keep going west on the 192 - if you get to the 27 you've gone too far. Reception is in the resort club building, and the staff could not have been more helpful. They'll sort out any small problems, give advice on nearby shops and chat about the attractions. On to the condo - parking right outside the block, and a lift to all floors. Our three bed condo was vast! Serious danger of losing people inside. The condo was immaculately clean, housekeeping obviously having taken great care on presentation, so first impressions were good, just what you need after a long journey. The condo was very well equipped, ice making fridge, TVs in each bedroom and the lounge, more towels than we knew what to do with, and free internet access via an ethernet cable in the lounge (so only one laptop on line at a time - but you're meant to be on vacation, not in the office!), and a small welcome pack. Resort facilities include an infinity pool - I thought it looked a bit small on Google Earth for the number of units, but "in the flesh" it is fine. Hot tub, sauna and steam room available as well as a small fitness center, and complimentary coffee and cookies in the clubhouse as well as a very small shop. There is internet access there, but $4 for 15 minutes seems steep - I think they would get more takers at say $1. It does make it worth taking a laptop, if only to check on park opening times. Location: Great for Disney, probably less than 15 minutes (we didn't do Disney this time). Universal looks on the map to be completely on the other side of Orlando, but it is still only half an hour, with Seaworld slightly less. For those with an aviation interest, Fantasy of Flight is less than an hour away. Shopping: there's a Publix left and right on the 192, a Super Target right, and a Walmart just north on the 27. We were there at a quiet time (last week in October) but the units looked around 40-50% occupied, judging by the cars. It's actually a great time to visit, as there are no lines in the parks - my son took me on The Incredible Hulk about an hour before closing, and we walked straight on, same with Duelling Dragons. You will have read about the cleaning charge - but if you factor in the fantastic rate you are getting, it isn't so bad. Oh, All in all, we had a fantastic few days, and really couldn't fault the resort management or the quality of the condo. Go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly recomend. Beautiful spacious rooms, nice quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Stargazermouse
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 3 bedroom condo at the beginning of November for 2 weeks. I was a little concerned after reading some of the reviews but we needn't have worried. We knew we had chosen the right place as soon as we turned into the entrance . Everything about the resort was well kept , new looking and very quiet. The staff were all welcoming, helpful and very friendly . We never experienced any negativity during the whole of our stay . The condo we stayed in was absolutely beautiful. All of the rooms were very spacious clean and well equipped with new furniture and appliances . The bedrooms all had walk in closets with spare bedding and were very well appointed . ( The beds were slightly hard but we slept really well every night . ) The kitchen had everything we needed with a gigantic fridge freezer, including an ice maker. A nice big microwave and a huge cooker, everything again was well maintained and clean. The two bathrooms were a joy ! The master bedroom had an enormous garden tub which was really relaxing at the end of the day and a lovely big shower room to wake you up in the morning. The second bathroom also had a nice shower room and normal sized tub. We spent several very relaxing evenings eating out on the balcony which was netted to keep out the bugs and also had a large ceiling fan to help keep you cool which was a nice added extra. The pool was a little on the small size for the amount of buildings on the complex however when we visited it was very quiet and we sometimes had it to ourselves. The water was heated and very clean and I particularly liked the infinity design . Just to mention that the resort did have public computers with printers that we could use in the club room at a cost of 4 dollars per 1/4 hour. That was fine for us as we only wanted to use them to check in for our flight home. To summarise we would definitely book the resort again and were very happy with our stay .

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: DanCRNA
Reviews.Content: Had a great 2 bedroom condo. Easily accomodated Mom, Dad, and three kids. Close to Universal, SeaWorld, and Magic Kingdom. The pool area is beautiful. Kids loved the free video rentals. Very clean, and all the ammenities of home.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for a trip to Disney”
Reviews.Author: canadiantraveler86
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Caribe Cove Resort in October 2009 with my family (spouse, 2 kids 5 and 7 and their grand-mother). We really enjoyed this place. We had a 2 bedroom condo on the 4th floor. The condo was large, spotless and quiet. We especially enjoyed having 2 balconies, where we could sit and enjoy watching some hot air balloons land on the vacant lot accross the streat. We used the pool a couple of times; it was clean and well maintained. It is a 15 minute drive to Disney, which we found very convenient. The only negative comment I have about this place is that the kitchen wasn`t very well stocked. For example, there was no foil, no plastic wrap, no salt or pepper and no filter for the coffee maker. Other than that, I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value For Money ...”
Reviews.Author: dancingducksontour
Reviews.Content: Apartment was very spacious, master bedroom had ensuite bathroom with toilet, shower, bath and two sinks ! All other rooms were of a good size and very clean upon entering. Caribe Cove itself was very quiet, the sort of place more suited to families/ couples/ friends without children in my opinion. No play areas for example. Not sure how well the resort is doing as Security Front Desk and barrier never in placeand evening Customer Service staff seemed more interested in personal calls and "were not form this area". The communal pool was also quiet and clean. Had a great time at a great price. Having been to Windsor Hills would probably pay the extra to go there next time (and WH is also not as far down the 192). Caribe Cove gets an all round thumbs up from here !

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, can't beat the price for what you get!”
Reviews.Author: girlygirls
Reviews.Content: I was so pleased with Caribe Cove in every aspect. Front desk attendents where helpful and gave great suggestions and tips. The rooms where more then we expected and so roomy. It was in a quiet location away from the busy roads but 5 minutes drive to everything you could want. (15 minutes to all the theme parks). There is a super Walmart 5 minutes down the road to get anything you want. One suggestion is to get bottle water while your at Walmart. The water in the Orlando area is very bleachy tasting and was horrbile to drink, even to make coffee. Great place, great price! Would suggest this place to everyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay but kinda far away from anything other than Disney”
Reviews.Author: krisans
Reviews.Content: We rented three 3 BR condos at Caribe Cove for our close family and friends that came to our wedding in Orlando. This place is on 192 W, around 7 miles from I-4. It is close to Disney but far from anything else. There are a ton of cheap gift shops nearby but no good restaurants. They do have a Publix, Walgreens and a super target a few miles away. The hotel itself is well kept and the staff were quite courteous to us. They had a king bed, a queen bed and two bunk beds in the three bedrooms. The bed I slept in was pretty bad as most of the reviews suggest. The patio area was beautiful and the place is very quiet. Plenty of parking and the property is gated. They do charge the cleaning fee and an extra $6 per day but they do inform you when you check-in. We enjoyed the place but if you have plans to do things outside of Disney, this place might be a bit too far from those things. It is a great value for the money if you are traveling with family.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Stavco
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Caribe Cove for a 5 days last week. It was great. We had a two bedroom condo that was perfect. It was exactly like the pictures on the Caribe Cove website. It was very quite and comfortable. The staff was helpful and very friendly. It is not a 24/7 hotel so you do have to provide some of your own stuff. There was plenty of towels and when they get dirty you have a washer and dryer to clean them. There is no room service so if you want your bed made, you do it yourself. They provide a roll of paper towels, a roll of toilet paper in each bathroom, teabags, sugar and sugar substitute, and some coffee. The kitchen is fully stocked with pots, pans and utensils. There is a microwave, blender, and toaster. At night there was a guard that asked for your room key to verify you were staying at the resort. If and when we return to Orlando, we sill stay definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, roomy, beautiful - but UNCOMFORTABLE MATTRESSES!!!”
Reviews.Author: smileywrylygirl
Reviews.Content: This resort was gorgeous to me. After having a terrible flight in and a terrible trip overall so far, I was very pleased when I arrived to find a spotlessly CLEAN and pristine 2 bedroom condo that was incredibly spacious. I was horrified about the $65 cleaning fee (which I already knew about) jumping up to $100 with room taxes and some other fee. Be forewarned and prepared that u will have to add at least $100 extra - we stayed 4 nights. Oh, the counters look like granite in all of the pix that you will see but they are actually laminate. I was kind of disappointed about that. The only truly detestable thing about this resort is the horribly uncomfortable, thin, flimsy, cheap, board-like mattresses. I just cannot believe that they would spend so much money to beautify this place and then turn around and slack on the mattresses. I honestly needed a massage after I left. HORRIBLE!! Especially if u intend to do any recreational activities on it. I loved just about everything else about this resort but because of the mattresses, I cannot recommend it cuz I was barely able to sleep or get comfy on them. :( If u can stand to sleep on a solid woooden board, u will probably be okay with them. LOL

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money, but too many extra charges”
Reviews.Author: honza123
Reviews.Content: - Got it for $99 / night on expedia. They add $7 a night for something and $65 one time fee. good: - large (2BR, 2 Baths, 2 terraces, a living room with dining room and kitchen, storage room, small laundry room) - clean - well equipped kitchen (microwave, toaster, blender, all kind of plates, etc), fridge with an ice machine - quiet (but this was in Sep with about 20% occupancy) not so good: - the cheapest mattresses - internet hook up is too short so you have to sit on the floor or move the sofa (a small thing, but who did it in such a stupid way?) - the extra fees are quite nasty way how to make a low price and then get some many out in a different way - checkout time and inflexible staff: even with a nearly empty hotel they were not willing to allow us to check one minute after 11:30.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: arkansasjb
Reviews.Content: Very inexpensive stay in a 3-bedroom condo. The condos are very roomy with inexpensive furnishings. Uncomfortable mattresses.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in this resort if you have a chance to cancel it”
Reviews.Author: MississaugaCanada09
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 stayed in this resort from Aug 7 to 15, 2009. When we first checked in, the room was really dirty, the washroom, the hallway and the kitchen are all dirt and hairs around, the floor was never cleaned. So I went down to the office and asked them to come up and clean, the cleaning manager and the cleaning lady came and took a look and the cleaning lady just sweep the floor and left. That was already a bad impression when we first arrived. After a few days, and it is the first time I use the washer and dryer, and after couple of hours and found out my load of clothes were all ruined, so I called the office again, after a guy came and checked and checked, he discovered that the timer in the washing machine were broken, therefore, if my load of clothes stay at wash, it will stay at wash forever and ever and ever and ever. I have couple of expensive clothes and couple of brand new clothes that I just bought from the premium outlet. After few discussion, the front desk manager said that, it is my fault that I have ONE towel in my load. The resort is not responsible for anything. They are very rude and they have no customer service knowledge at all at this resort. They only know how to take your money, the $65 plus the daily $5.95 is a ripe off. You wont have the chance to watch the DVD that they are offering, so this is the resort not worth staying. They even say, they dont care of what other people review their resort. All the people at the front desk are asshold, rude, you name it. If you have booked this resort, I would recommend you to cancel and find somewhere else. You better cancel it now instead of cancel it there as they only give you back $20/day worth. I would definitely not recommend this resort to anyone in this world. Beside, I would recommend the management to get ride of all the front desk people, specially, the manager, the supervisor.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: lovejeeps
Reviews.Content: Caribe Cove was everything we expected. We stayed in 2 bedrom suite. It was clean and spacious with all ammenities. Front desk employees were very friendly, especially Margaret. Tips, go to a supermarket to pick-up spices and detergent. would go back in a heartbeat. Loves the heated pool. Margaret if you read this its Mr Dias( Karl)

Reviews.Title: “trip to remember”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkTrips
Reviews.Content: i have traveled to many locations in florida and i have to say the location of this resort is the best in my book. the room looked brand new for being two years old you can tell that the maintenance team cares about what they do.check in was abit rough but other then that the trip was great and i will return hopefully when we return we wont have to deal with gloria again(not a very happy person).big thanks to Carlos and Tammy for all the help with directions and advise on places to eat texas brazil was perfect....

Reviews.Title: “dishonest - beware”
Reviews.Author: biged
Reviews.Content: I was traveling to Disney, and decided to try this " resort " outside of Disney. First of all, I was surprised you had to pay " up front " for the room reservation, and then to pay a $65 charge for " cleaning" was a bit much. I made the reservation about 3 months in advance. Well, after showing up there with " prepaid " reservations, I was instructed to pay a refundable deposit of 200 bucks. 200 bucks, why? First of all, they disrespect with the cleaning fee, and paying upfront, however the $200 deposit sent me over the edge. To me, this place is a dump, and they are disreputable shysters running this place. I was told if I didn't like it, I could leave right now! I wouldn't recommend this joint to a dog, if I had one.

Reviews.Title: “Just returned from Caribe Cove Resort.”
Reviews.Author: sweet4
Reviews.Content: I was very worried about going to this place, as i emailed the manager before i left, as i read the reviews,then booked,then i read the last ones and i was so worried.It was fine my teenage daughters loved the gym,so we had a good time,they now have free dvd rentals which came in handy,i would not return,we would rent a villa next time. Oh yea the bed was so uncomfortable like the op said.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort Overall; Despite what others may have written”
Reviews.Author: tswan10
Reviews.Content: My team stayed at this resort last year and had a blast! The rooms were clean and the staff was great! Mrs. Gloria was very and helpful to us. I plan trips for many teams and am very picky about where we stay and the quality of the places we reside in. This property gave us privacy and the ability to be able to feel like this was our own property during our stay. The price for a 3 bedroom 2 bathroom 1600 feet condo was very acceptable. We enjoyed cooking daily and being able to do our laundry for free. We are planning to stay at this location again this year and any other year we come to play at the Disney World of Sports.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok!!!”
Reviews.Author: CtBusymom
Reviews.Content: Don't even think about checking in early..not even an hour early....they will say no...anyway check-in was quick and not complicated @ all...they will put a $200 hold on your card and charge you about $107 right away for the cleaning & resort fee...when we first arrived to our building it was kind of hard to see where your room # was but we found it...we were a family of 6...3 adults and 3 children...let me say the place has very nice and huge...my 4 year old will run around and not stumble over anything...the place was clean and smelled good...if you're staying there for more than a couple of days definitely buy toilet pager, paper towels, etc...basically buy your own detergents like if you were home...the pool was pretty neat...even though we went @ a busy time it really wasn't busy @ all...the kids had fun...please make sure you buy laundry detergent because they will not give you any more towels...or supply you with the first complimentary box of detergent...internet was a little hectic but once connected it was ok...be careful with the washer and dryer...it messed up two of our loads and I refused to wash anymore of our clothes in them...the dryer seemed like it was full of lint inside and outside it was crazy...the shower curtain in the 2nd bathroom had mildew which was pretty discusting...you basically have to do everything yourself in this place...which I didn't mind...the staff there seemed like they really didn't want to be bothered with you anyway...I can say that when we checked out around 5:00am the front lady was very pleasant and even offerred coffee to us....there is everything nearby...supertarget down the street and a super walmart...omg..they definitely need to upgrade those mattresses..they are terrible...my 4 year old had a very had time sleeping in them....besides that it was just ok...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value/Huge Condo/Huge Salt Water Pool/Staff Seemed Miserable”
Reviews.Author: PinkFlamingoSanibel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caribe Cove Resort for 2 weeks. The first week we paid $89 a night. Since we liked the place so much I was going to cancel our other reservations for another resort and extend this place for another week. I thought first I would ask the front desk how much they would charge us. They said $109 a night. I asked if I booked the same way I did the first week if we could have the same condo and wave the second cleaning fee. They agreed so I went online to Expedia and booked for $77 a night after Expedia coupons. For the money we could not have gotten a better deal. The condo was huge and nicely decorated. Beds were fairly comfortable - 7 out of 10. Best parts of the condo: high ceilings which made the place look huge, huge bathrooms with huge showers, outside screened in lanai the length of the entire condo and we had a great view of the woods. The outside including the landscaping was very attractive and clean. The club house was nice but the exercise room was small. If you wanted to use weights they only have one machine with multiple stations. However, all stations are attached to the same weights so only one station could be used at a time. The pool and pool area was excellent. Huge salt water pool where one end of the pool had no top part of the wall and the water just flowed over. Huge steam room and sauna right offer the pool. Bathrooms off the pool area but watch out when you walk into the clubhouse. If the tiles are wet and/or you are dripping water the tiles are so smooth you might fall and really hurt yourself as I almost did several times. The only down side is that the pool is only open until dusk. I'll give you a tip however. There is only one person working the desk at night and if that person is kept busy they will not shutdown the pool until they get some time to do so. So use your imagination on how to keep them busy and extend the pool hours. If I had any complaints it would have to be that the carpeting looked like it was in need of steam cleaning and that there were some parts of the condo that was not clean very well. Also there was this lady named Gloria at the front desk that I believe just hated life. Not friendly at all and made you feel like you were a real pain to be standing there but I figured I would only have to put up with her a couple times. In fact most of the staff seemed pretty miserable. All in all we got a great price for a really nice place where it was pretty close to Disney World. We have stayed at many places around the area and I would say this has been the best place we have stayed at. I would recommend this place to anyone as long as you don't let the staff ruin your day and don't mind keeping the place clean yourself

Reviews.Title: “I think I have found my Orlando home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: HappiCamperLSU
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from an eight night stay at Caribe Cove. It was a ridiculously good value for the money we paid (roughly $75 per night +$6 resort fee+$65 cleaning fee). For our roughly $90 bucks a night we received: *A 1600 square foot residence with three bedrooms (one king, one queen, two singles), *Two HUGE bathrooms each with a shower and tub. I miss them ! *A great kitchen with all amenities. * a washer and dryer (!). *a nice screened balcony overlooking a wooded area. *A nice pool area . * Friendly service. *Fast to Disney parks, no traffic delays like other areas. * Very clean. *Free movie dvd rentals. *tv's in three rooms. * Great closet space. * Beds were fair-nothing special, which with a bad back worried me-but I slept great. *Night time security gate entrance with Guard. A self-sufficient traveler will enjoy this place. It is what it is, a large, clean, comfortable place that feels like home. It is perfect for large groups and family. It is not for the customer who demands a high degree of interaction with hotel staff. You will not receive Five star double diamond service here. I experienced polite staff members who were there to assist me, but not pamper me. There is a difference. My wife loved it because we could pack light and wash our clothes frequently. We also saved a lot of money on food as we ate in often. I loved the room for all of us (three kids) to spread out and get some breathing room. It never took more than 15 minutes to reach any park. I would rate the time to Disney Parks as excellent. Overall, the location is a bit out on Irlo Bronson a few miles off the main strip, but there are restaurants and shops, stores very close. It does not have a resort feel, and I would not recommend it for someone who wants to walk out to a huge pool with slides and waterfalls. That said, the kids loved the salt water pool and with about 15 people there it did not seem too crowded. There were adequate supplies, untensils, dishes, a hair dryer, ironing board, high chair etc. Our toilet overflowed one night and maintanance came out promptly and cheerfully to fix it. Overall it was almost perfect. I would definitely recommend Caribe Cove and plan on returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Seasoned travelers; property met our expectations”
Reviews.Author: bang4mybuck
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are very picky travelers; however, the property met our expectations and our needs. We booked a 2 bedroom unit for 5 nights; $99 per night and the 4th night was free. Check in was quick. As picky travelers we requested a different unit after we viewed the property map. Our unit was quickly changed without any hesitation. The unit was very clean. Trust me; it was very clean. This is coming from a germaphobe and whether we stay at a Ritz-Carlton, Four Seasons or Marriott property, I always clean the doorknobs, handles, telephones, and bathroom fixtures with bleach.
