We did not plan on using any of the few amenities on site because we expected to spend most of our time at the parks. The pool was small; however, it was clean. We used the sauna and steam room and they were also clean. The staff, though few, were cordial. Other travelers we encountered on the property were well mannered. This property is not a hotel so you will not get the same kinds of services. It is also not a timeshare property so you don't have to worry about being solicited to buy in. **Word of advice: One thing I have learned from years of extensive research for our traveling plans, if you book your trip through a website travel website, the staff will not take strides to make changes to accommodate your wishes and you will be assigned the least favorable rooms. It is best to check the internet prices, then call the property directly and request the internet prices. They will oblige since the profit will go to them and not the internet travel site. Trust me; I always do this. It sometimes works with airline tickets. Our trip cost $2600. That included 5 nights at Caribe Cove, a premium rental car (Nissan Maxima), 4 round trip non-stop airline tickets, tickets into Disney and Universal studios for 4; we went to the parks each day.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet place”
Reviews.Author: TeensOnt
Reviews.Content: Overall, we had a very positive experience with this resort. The rooms are exactly as they look on the Internet. We had a 2 bedroom suite. If you have teenage daughters, be prepared to surrender your bathroom to them. The 2nd bedroom had a small sink and mirror while the master bedroom had two sinks/mirrors. Guess where they got ready every morning! The rooms are spacious. As others have said, there is very little in terms of supplies, not even salt & pepper. It was still less expensive than going out all the time. I have a couple of gripes with the price. What they don't tell you is that there is a fee to have a DVD in the suite, even if you don't use it. Also, to use the computer/internet in the main lobby is $4 for 15 minutes. Also, I have no idea why they put pebbled floors on the balcony. Hard on the bare feet. The resort was extremely quiet when we went, first week of May, which was nice after a day at Disney. If you are a party person, this is not the place for you. The pool is very small for the number of suites but there was hardly ever anyone there. It's just a basic pool, no slides or fun stuff if you have small kids. The maintenance staff were very responsive. They came and fixed the ice maker, the telephone and brought extra pillows right away. It's about 15-20 minute drive from Disney and even farther if you are going to Universal/Sea World. We rented a car so that was no problem. There's a Publix grocery store and liquor store just past Orange Lake as well as a Super Target which also has groceries. Much to my daughter's delight, there is also on Olive Garden and Pizza Hut close by. Caribe Cove was a great place as a home away from home after a busy day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: 3Sam
Reviews.Content: I researched different condo-type accommodations for months before settling on Caribe Cove. I am so happy we went there. We had a 2-bdrm, which was just perfect for the four of us (including 5 and 7 year olds). So much space to relax after the long days of walking. Our unit was very clean (big deal, so there is a little stain here and there on the carpet. They were freshly vaccumed). Also clean were the pool area, hallways and grounds in general. Screened-in porch was perfect. Ate breakfast there every morning, and some dinners. Great not to contend with bugs while eating a meal! Unit was well-stocked with everything we needed for a week of cooking. Plenty of bowls, plates, cutlery and cups. I simply brought some extra detergent from home for the dishwasher since I knew they only supplied one pack. Also brought extra TP, and a few other items I knew we would need that were not supplied (nor would I expect them to be supplied). Plenty of towels on hand for both the kitchen and bathrooms. It was so wonderful to have the washer and dryer too. I brought a couple of packs of laundry detergent as well so that I could freshen up our supply of clothes and towels mid-week. This was a huge help in being able to pack lighter. Brought our laptop, so the internet was a huge plus to keep on top of business goings-on at home. Pool was wonderful. Very, very warm and clean. Note that it is a salt-water pool for those that may prefer chlorinated. Plenty of lounge chairs. We never encountered too many people there, although I suppose if the resort was full to capacity, it could be overcrowded. This is a moderate sized resort, so I suppose the pool could be considered a bit small to accommodate full booking. I'm not likely to visit Florida during peak times though, so I doubt this would be an issue for me. Didn't use the sauna, steam room or fitness room, but all were easy to find at the clubhouse. I found the staff to all be very nice and accommodating. Contrary to the many comments to not bother trying to check in before 4:00 because they won't let you, I asked anyway and although they didn't have anything ready yet (this was around 11:00 am), they had me do all the paperwork and told me to come back around 2:30. We did and they gladly handed over our keys. We called maintenance to move the dvd player from the master bed to the living room, and they were at our door within minutes. Front desk called later to make sure everything was ok in the room. True, they are not full of suggestions when it comes to recommending restaurants or min-golf courses etc... but the choices are overwhelming to begin with and I didn't really find anyone we asked outside of the resort to be any more forthcoming with info. Fresh baked cookies available for the taking in the lobby were scrumptious! As for location, I am so glad I did not stay in the midst of the action. After 10 hours in the blazing sun everyday, and going through sensory overload, there was nothing better then to sit in the dark on the balcony (remember, screened in so no bugs) with a glass of wine and listen to nothing but crickets. It couldn't have been much more than 15 minutes to the parking booths at any of the Disney parks. No traffic issues at all, regardless of what time we came or left. I imagine going high season will result in heavy traffic, but figure the even greater congestion on the popular strips close to the parks such as I-Drive will make their drive much worse, even if they are closer. Everything you could possibly imagine is close by on 192. Super Target, Super Publix, Walgreens, all manner of restaurant, mini-golf, gift shops. All is at your doorstep, only a few minutes away by car (and you need a car anyway when you visit Orlando). I'd stay again in a heartbeat, and would recommend to anyone. This is a self-serve resort and if you actually do a bit of research on the place rather than just showing up site unknown, there would be no suprises with cleaning fee's and the fact that you need to supply some of your own supplies. Take into account the time of year you are visiting. Traffic is going to be bad regardless of where you stay if you go in high season. Be nice, be reasonable, and you'll likely get the same treatment back. I loved this resort, and look forward to coming back again some day. Only one minor complaint. It would be nice if they had recycling facilities. Florida in general is not big on recycling, so it is no suprise the resorts don't. But I hate throwing out cans and bottles.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly BIG place”
Reviews.Author: baloco
Reviews.Content: I was really shocked when I saw the space of those appartments. The rooms are incredibly big, the main bathroom is amazing, the kitchen is really well equiped. Remember it is self service, you will not get a breakfast nor dinner at the hotel, is like being at home. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Price, Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: mmkclifford
Reviews.Content: This was the best "hotel" I have stayed at. Instead of being a cramped hotel room with 2 double beds and one small bathroom, it was a large 3 bedroom condo. Our group included my mother and her husband, my husband and I and 3 children, 2, 11, and 14. My mother and her husband had the master suite which was on one side of the living room, dining room and kitchen area. It was a very large bedroom with a king size bed, 2 walk in closets, large bathroom with a garden tub and free standing shower. It also had a t.v. , dvd player and screened in patio with a table and 4 chairs overlooking a wooded view and pond. On the other side of the living room was another bedroom with a small screened in porch that connected with the master bedroom, living room porch. This bedroom had a tv, no dvd player but had a queen size bed. This bedroom had a large bathroom next to it that had a bathtub and freestanding shower that had 2 doors- one leading another 3rd bedroom. This bedroom had 2 single beds that the kids slept in. There was no t.v. in this bedroom, this wasn't a problem because we were too busy to watch t.v. This was an ideal set up for travel with multiple families. Our family had one side and shared a bathroom and my parents had their own side with their own bathroom. The hotel was stocked well with pans, wine glasses, pitcher, knives, silverware, serving spioons, storage containers for left overs, wine opener, toaster, blender, dishwasher, microwave, plates, bowls, mugs, glass glasses, dish towels, sponge. The closets were stocked with extra pillow, sheets and blankets. Both bathrooms had plenty of bathtowels, hand towels and washcloths. You should bring dish soap and extra dishwashing soap and laundry soap for the washer and dryer that is next to the kitchen. I brought extra garbage bags and paper towels and toilet paper. There was a high chair for the baby and a pack and play that were stored in the master closet. In the living room there was a t.v., dvd player and internet connection that we had to use a plug for and we set it up on the floor by the t.v. It was no big deal that it didn't reach to the couch. It was very nice not to have to pay extra for it. The condo was decorated in a tropical prints. It was very tasteful and nice. The rooms look exactly like they do on the Caribe Cove website. They even show you a floor plan. This was a surprisingly quiet room and we didn't see many people when we were there for spring break, although it was quite full, it didn't seem like it was crowded or that you were surrounded by crowds of people. We enjoyed the pool, steam room and sauna. It was very clean and not crowded at all. The lobby and fitness room was nice too. The had lockers and showers availble in the clubhouse next to the pool area. The clubhouse had computers availble for use with the internet and well as wireless internet. They had a small store that had chips, popcorn, snacks, soap, toliet paper, paper towels, sunscreen etc. We really enjoyed our trip and will stay here again. I booked our trip directly from the hotel site. I didn't want any hassles. The total for the 3 bedroom was $99 per night. (Split with my mom was $50 ea.) Unbelieveable for the price. There was a $65 cleaning charge added to the room and well as $200 security deposit. There is no maid service daily. I didn't miss that at all. The only thing I would bring next time is a heavy duty pan for cooking bacon in the morning. The pans were not what I am used to so I had problems burning bacon. But I totally understand why they would not have $50 fry pans here for people to use. Great Place!!

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the rip-off. Not as nice as it appears”
Reviews.Author: DunsNJ
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a trip to Orlando. Every year my family and I go to Orlando and typically we need to stay an additional night in a hotel. Expedia gives this place 3 1/2 stars- what a joke. I should have realized that things were not great when I was waiting to check in and one of the guests checking out had a complaint about a broken bathroom and the manager's response was - "well you had a 3 bedroom so I am sure the other bathrooms worked". First of all- the pool is laughable. Very tiny and only one in the complex. Secondly, you are a good distance from Disney so you must have a car. But here is the real kicker. Do not stay for one or two nights. The rate I thought was reasonable - their $99 "Special" for a night. What they do not tell you is that you must pay $75 for cleaning. What a joke- a one night stay cost $174 - not $99. When I tried to explain this to the manager her answer was- thats the way it is. My response- do other hotels charge nearly a 75% surcharge for cleaning! Avoid this place. You can do much better--try Floridays Resort.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Condo-Rude Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: Thomas-McCarty
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 LOVED the condo! The photos we saw on-line are EXACTLY what we got! It is VERY close to the attractions yet far enough away that it was a peaceful place to recharge after a long day! We were surprised by the lack of service provided by front desk... One employee in particular. I had called before our arrival and was told we did not need to bring household items yet upon arrival discovered that we needed garbage bags, laundry detergent, dish soap, paper towels...

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Charlie1308Ontario
Reviews.Content: We spent last week at Caribe Cove. The 2 bedroom condo we had was beautiful and was clean. We were in building 4 at the back so it was quiet, we really didn't hear any other guests. My only complaints are: I thought that not supplying dish soap, only one package of soap for the dishwasher, only two rolls of t. paper was on the "cheap" side. I have stayed in other resorts and these were provided. I didn't find the staff very helpful when asking for places to shop or information about tickets. Finally there is only the one pool and it is crowded...even when the resort is not that busy. Other comments about the traffic on 192 and I4 is correct, it's not an easy place to get around. Overall it was a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, Relaxing Condo....Self Service”
Reviews.Author: PickyTravelerOH
Reviews.Content: Went to Orlando to do Disney and Sea World on spring break. I wanted a nice place that had plenty of room to spend our 9 nites in so we could relax after fighting large crowds all day. I also wanted it to be away from all of the craziness and in a nice setting. This was it! We got the 3 bedroom unit which is very large. I could live in it. Pictures give an accurate indication of what you are getting so I won't describe in detail. I knocked down the cleanliness one notch only because there was a couple of spots in the carpet that somebody had spilled something that bleached out when it was cleaned. Other than that, everything looked very new. You are on your own. There is no service while you are there. If desired, you will have to wash sheets and towels yourself. If you are staying long, I would suggest you bring extra tp, paper towels, laundry detergent and dishwashing/dishwasher soap. There is a Publix a mile or so away. If you are looking to be pampered, this is not the place. Location - you are about 15- 20 minutes from all the amusement parks. I did not find traffic to be any problem, even during spring break. It is in a newer, partly undeveloped area and is .6 miles off the main road, so it is quiet. I personally didn't get to use the pool but it looked very nice, in an attractive setting. People were saying it was a little cold though. Nice 10 person hot tub and a couple of suanas are available. Make sure you factor in the one time $65 cleaning fee when comparing options. If you are staying only a night or two, this may not be the most econimical you can find.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: Allisasmom
Reviews.Content: Our trip was so awesome. The unit was beautiful with an awesome view. It was conveniently located near Disney. The security was efficient. There were staff driving around property during day and a security station at the gated entry way which was manned when we returned home each evening (after Fireworks - approximately midnight). We shopped for everything we needed at the nearby Walmart. :-) We loved Caribe Cove!

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: Michigander3
Reviews.Content: My husband and two boys (9 & 14) just got back from our Spring Break vacation. We only stayed 3 nights at the Caribe Cove because we traveled around for 1 week. We just loved the accomodations. What a beautiful place to stay!! We couldn't have asked for anything more than the 3 bedroom condo for the price and the beautiful decor. We stayed in building number 4 in condo 404. It was so nice because we faced the back of the woods with a pond to oversee. It was very quiet and peaceful. A little walk to the pool up front, but my sons never complained. We did not want to stay close to Disney because our plans were to go to Sea World and a few other places in the local area. The only problem we ran into was a broken faucet in the extra bathroom shower - we called maintenance and they were there in about 10 mins. and resolved it. We would recommend this place to anyone and will definitely go back when we are in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - Great Value!!!”
Reviews.Author: gds8249
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weeks stay at Caribe Cove. We had a two bedroom condo that was very spacious. Our daughter flew down to join us for a few days and it was so convenient for her to have her own bedroom and bath. We enjoyed all the facilities (pool, hot tub, sauna, steam room etc.) Everything was very clean! After our stay at Caribe Cove, we traveled throughout Florida and nothing else compared. We hope to stay here again next year!

Reviews.Title: “great place -great price”
Reviews.Author: kathyr40
Reviews.Content: we stayed at caribe cove feb.14-feb.21 and couldn't have been happier. I was a little nervous after reading previous reviews with regards to the bad service,but we didnt have that problem. When we arrived Saturday evening the guy on duty was VERY polite and helpful. He explained the room and gave recomendations on where to go for dinner. The room was huge and clean. A very pleasant surprise! The resort is away from the noise and it was wonderful to be able to eat in the condo after a long day at the park. Not only will you save money, but you wont have to deal with tired whiney kids in public. The pool and spa were nice and so were the steamroom and sauna(located outside by pool). The only real negative was the 3rd bedroom by the outside corridor, it really does need blackout blinds. My 6 year old son woke up crying about not being able to sleep with the light. Also, the beds are kinda uncomfortable-but hey after the parks everyone is soo tired it wasnt really an issue. Overall we really enjoyed this place and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amenities? Service? Don't believe what's listed!”
Reviews.Author: Northeast_Mom_of_3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caribe Cove last week and will NEVER go back. We found that many of the amenities listed on their site or our travel site either did not exist or were exagerated. Annoying but not necessarily a deal-breaker. What we coulld not tolerate was the complete lack of integrity by the front desk manager (Tamaria) and maintenance manager (Carlos). We had maintenance issues go unresolved for the duration of our stay, leaving one bathroom virutally unuseable. When we complained about the maintenance issues, we were told they had been fixed, when it was obviously not the case. When we told our travel-booking site about the discrepancies between the services and amenities offered vs those stated on the website, Carlos lied to to the website people calling to verify. When we complained to the front desk manager about the situation, she told us we needed to pack our bags and get off the property!! She even ordered a front-desk employee to call the police when I threatened to leave a bad review of the property on the website!!! Bottom line: HOUSEKEEPING- is non-existant throughout your stay. Need clean towels or sheets? You need to go to the store, buy detergent, andwash & dry them yourself. Some sites list mid-stay housekeeping as an alternative, but when we tried to arrange it, we were told it was not possible. SECURITY - is also non-existant. There is a guard station and gate at the entrance to the property, but it is completely unmanned and the gate is always open. Carlos insists that the station is manned after 10pm, but we entered the property after this time on 4 different nights & it was unmanned each time. I did not observe security cameras or security personnel anywhere on the property at any time throughout our stay. FITNESS CENTER/SPA SERVICES - are laughable. The "fitness center" is smaller than my bathroom. It is located inside the lobby, separated only by a glass wall. It has 3-4 cardio machines & a TV. We did not observe any steam or sauna, as are listed available on several travel sites. And the pool is substantially smaller than it is made to appear in photos on the websites. BUSINESS CENTER - The term is laughable. The front desk has a printer, copier, and fax machine for its own use. These are behind the desk, not where a guest can use them on their own and forget about privacy. You have to wait for a desk person to be free and then hope they're in a good enough mood that they will make your copies or send your fax for you. Not exactly "business" oriented. INTERNET - Wireless is only available in the lobby. Inside the unit there is 1 connection - behind the TV in the living area. The cord provided is not long enough to reach the dining table, coffee table, or bedroom. So, if you bring a laptop, you pretty much have to sit on the floor like a 6 yr old. The connection is VERY slow, borderline dial-up. Most of my pages crashed before loading. FLATSCREEN TV's/DVDs - The living area has a 25" tube TV. Carlos insists that it is a "flatscreen" because the screen is not concave. It's not LCD or Plasma if that's your interpretation. Two bedrooms have very tiny (12"?) TVs & 1 has a DVD player - but not the one in the living room. There are VERY FEW channels of regular TV available at this resort - it may be "cable" but there's not much more than the local networks, Disney & Weather. TOMMY BAHAMA DECOR - The units ARE large & they are decorated nicely, but it's really low-quality. As we were eating dinner one night, my toddler leaned on one side of the dining table. The leg on the opposite side fell out and bashed me in the shin causing a huge bruise. My usually laid-back husband nearly went through the roof when the manager threatened to charge us for it. As if our 27-pound toddler has the strength or body mass to break a table leg! LACK OF STAFF - Already talked about having no security or housekeeping people. We also never observed anyone working outdoors on the property. Late one evening we were approached by another (male) guest when we pulled into the parking lot. He had also just returned & found a 2-yr-old girl wandering alone in front of his building. For propriety's sake, he did not want to approach her alone, so my husband followed him back to his building while I brought our kids upstairs & called the front desk. It was a full 20 minutes before the front desk guy showed up to investigate and he NEVER called the police or any emergency services!! I was absolutely appalled! ARCHITECTURAL ODDITIES - There are some things about the units that are just wierd. Each bedroom has a vent in the wall into the main living area, so you can't get any bedroom completely dark or quiet as long as anyone is in the main living area (front hall, laundry closet, kitchenette, eating area, living area). Also, one bedroom is located alongside the exterior corridor leading to the unit. This corridor has a very bright light directly outside this bedroom window, which makes it impossible to get the room completely dark at night & leaves 1 person trying to sleep directly next to this window. There are also no blackout curtains in the units as claimed on some websites. I would never stay at this place again. I would discourage anyone I know from staying there. There are so many properties in the Orlando area that you can do a lot better for the same price elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Don't back down on your upgrade”
Reviews.Author: hollybop
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2 bedroom with free upgrade to a 3 bedroom through bookit. We took our 3 children, two of whom are adults, and I really didn't want anyone to have to sleep in the living room. In fact, I would have booked a 3 bedroom if it hadn't already been free. When we arrived my husband checked in and was given a two bedroom. It was lovely but not what we booked. I had read on tripadvisor about some of the problems that people had had with this very issue. A few days before we left I sent an e-mail to Caribe Cove in order to confirm the 3 bdrm upgrade. They sent me a reply saying that I should have no problems. I think that that's what saved me. I basically had to stage a sit in with my computer in hand and the e-mail exchange loaded. The poor women on the front desk. Be friendly, these people probably make minimum wage and have to put up with stupid complaints all day (like the guys who were there complaining about the cable package on the TV - no ESPN I think). I was very nice to them but said I wanted to speak to a manager. I don't know where that person was but she/he was not on site to my knowledge and I never spoke to them. This was VERY stressful for me and probably for them. My husband was hugely uncomfortable. Eventually Gloria told me that they really didn't have any available for that night but they would be able to move us first thing in the morning (7 am.) I left with this assurance and a promise that we would not have to pay another cleaning fee for the next unit. I was not back in the unit for 5 minutes when the phone rang. Someone had miraculously just phoned and cancelled a 3 bedroom reservation for that night and they would be able to move us right away. I really don't know whether the fault lies with bookit or Caribe Cove but someone is not being honest. The unit was lovely and clean and well appointed with towels(no beach towels) and kitchen cloths/dish towels. I have read some reviews on here about not having this or that. Take your own basics or buy them on the way. This is not a hotel so don't expect the same services. You have to make your own bed and if you want clean sheets or towels during your stay you will have to wash them yourself. The washer and dryer both worked terrifically well and you can buy a small bottle - enough for several loads- of laundry detergent for $2 at the clubhouse. There is no salt, pepper, sugar or anything nor should you expect them. There were 2 rolls of toilet paper ($1/roll at the clubhouse), a box of tissues and two small bars of soap in each bathroom. In the kitchen there was 1 packet of dishwasher detergent, 1 packet of coffee, 1 roll of paper towel and not much else in terms of consumables. Extras are available for purchase in the clubhouse and the prices are not horrible. Really good coffee(regular and decaf) is always available in the clubhouse with "to go" cups but no real cream or milk. There is a Super Walmart close by where you can find ANYTHING that you need. We found the beds comfortable and I'm pretty picky. The screened porch was great! If you're looking for a party atmosphere and nightlife, this is not the place for you. It is quiet and isolated. Things are not far but you have to drive everywhere unless you are a hiker!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Disney - away from the crowds!”
Reviews.Author: YorkYorkist
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (senior citizens) stayed here two weeks in Februauy 2009. Apartment 2206 was superb, extremely well furnished and equipped for a two week stay, it was clean and quiet. The site management was highly efficient and we were well satisfied with the experience. Disneyland was not on our itinerary - we have been before - but both the Magic Kingdom and Epcot are only a short distance away. The great advantage of this location is that it is so easy to avoid the crowds of Orlando if, like us, one seeks a peaceful holiday exploring the less frenetic areas of West, North or Central Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have made a better choice”
Reviews.Author: oliver880
Reviews.Content: I know it's hard to read these so I will summarize this for you: Positives: 1 - Peaceful location but close enough to everything you need and I4 2 - Beautiful relatively new units 3 - Heated pool, 10 person hot tub, Sauna, Steam Room all clean, central location and not over populated 4 - Incredible value for the $$. Following a week long experience I would have paid even more then we did. An incredible value particulalry for a family or group. 5 - Fully stocked kitchen with big fridge and freezer, enough space for a weeks worth of food for 6 people. 6 - Clean, clean, clean. 7 - People complain about the beds and furniture, I found them to be very clean and comfortable. They are not the "Heavenly" beds but they are more European style, lower, harder, but comfortable. 8 - I have stayed all around the World, in every major chain and top quality hotels and have never experienced a comparable value for the money. 9 - Free high speed internet 9 - Upon check in I found the internet cable was not pugged in and within 5 minutes of calling the front desk maintenance arrived and followed up before leaving to make sure everything else was ok. 10 - Front desk found a way to print my tickets to Seaworld for me even though the print site did not work saving me over $50! All but one of the staff I encountered were extremely friendly and helpful. Negatives: 1 - The one front desk person could have been a little frinedlier but I admit I was trying to check in early even though it has been clearly spelled out here by multiple people that this is not an option. Don't even try. On the positive side we were able to use the pool and hot tub before check in and after check out as they have clean locker rooms right next to the pool that made this time enjoyable. A great alternative for us. 2 - Not a negative but a few tips: - remember this is more like a timeshare then a hotel, before you arrive bring with you some basics like extra garbage bags, toilette paper, paper towles etc. The best thing to do is get all your groceries before check in and get all the supplies you need as you clean and maintain your own unit during your stay. I shared this opnion with many of the friendly guests we met in the pool area, this place is a hidden gem and we all ageed we liked this place so much we almost didn't want to write our positive reviews so we could keep this to ourselves! Great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect your free upgrade to a bigger suite...”
Reviews.Author: wohrsy5
Reviews.Content: This is overall a nice place to stay. We booked on BookIt.com and were pleased to learn of an upgrade special to a 3 bedroom villa....Unfortunately when we arrived there were none available which made things very uncomfortable for the entire party staying.... Too bad that is only mentioned in the very FINE print.....

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay at an affordable price”
Reviews.Author: Andrea8673
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter (21 months) and I stayed at the Caribe Cove in early February 2009. I had looked everywhere online and read all sorts of reviews regarding condos in the Orlando area. I was so nervous since there were so many options. I found this place on BookIt.com for only $74 a night with an upgrade to a 3 bedroom villa. We didn't need a 3 bedroom but it was nice to have. We were in building 5, all the way in the back and on the 2nd floor. The villa was huge! It had a ton of space and places to put things. The kitchen was pretty well stocked. We did not encounter any problems with cleaniness that other reviewers had found. The place had obviously been cleaned and looked great. There were a ton of towels in the two bathrooms as well as extra pillows and blankets in all the closets. They had a pack ' n play in the closet as well as a high chair that came in handy. There was a large screen in porch that backed up to the woods and a pond. The one thing you have to remember about Caribe Cove is that it is not a standard hotel. They do not have housekeeping that comes in everyday. We have no problem with reusing towels and taking out our own trash. It's understandable with the price we paid. I would have liked to have some extra toilet paper, and some trash bags but that was about it. They do sell those up at the front store. It was very quiet. They did not have many amenties for children besides the pool but we knew that going in. The pool was very nice but nothing out of the ordinary. We did not interact with the staff other than check in and check out and that was fine. The woman at check out was extremely friendly. They also have free internet but it uses a cable, not wi-fi. They have free wi-fi in the office area. The location is farther out than many of the other hotels/condos but it can be nice to be away from it all. You are about a 20 minute drive to most of the Disney Parks as well as Sea World. It's a newer development area so there isn't a ton of stuff close but if you have a car there are plenty of things to drive to within 5-20 minutes. There is a Publix and Wal-Mart not far either to buy some groceries. We enjoyed our stay here and would stay again. As long as you aren't expecting a 5-star resort, you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great except the Fridge...”
Reviews.Author: Dirty_Injuns
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 nights. Had 6 of us in a 3 bed room. 4 small children ages 6 and under. The beds were a bit uncomfortable. Our refridgerator was broken from the time we moved in until we moved out. They did bring us a small fridge after we had been there 3 nights. The rooms were great though. Very nice through and through. The evening staff (1 person) seemed to be more courtious than the morning staff (2 people). I sort of felt like I was in South Georgia instead of South Florida by the way they acted and treated me. There is internet service if you bring your own laptop. They have two computers at the check in area but you have to buy time to use the computer.

Reviews.Title: “great place for the family”
Reviews.Author: diva040
Reviews.Content: this hotel is realy a great place to stay. huge appartements, clean, fully equipped. we will here stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Home Base”
Reviews.Author: havkidswilltravel30
Reviews.Content: Anyone with concerns on staying at Caribe Cove can put them aside!! Just got back from staying there for 10 days and it was fantastic. It is almost new, located a maximum 15 minutes from Disney, close to a grocery store, lots of restaurants. It has a nice pool, is quiet. A perfect spot to come back to after a long day at the parks. I would recommend this place 100% and it is a much better alternative to a hotel room!!!!

Reviews.Title: “How we almost had a great time...”
Reviews.Author: safemoney4u
Reviews.Content: We utilized Bookit Traveland arranged for a 5 day stay. We understood we had to pay a $200.00 damage depost and a $75 cleaning bill for maid staff. No problem. On the site they made a BIG deal of how were were upgraded to a 3 BR suite with no charge! Upon arriving we were told (Oh, that's only if we have rooms available). I suggested if that is the case they should at least asterisk the free upgrade and produced our papers from booking trip that had no such restrictions. A Mngr told me that it's in the contract small print. I was never shown. Next-If you go to Caribe Cove Resort it sounds romantic. Sit in the hot tub or a swim at sunset with your sweetheart. Romantic huh? Problem is pool,steam room, sauna and hot tob close at sunset or dusk. Strike 2. On to #3. Ever had a stool overflow and maintence take 2 1/2 days to repair it and clean up unsanitary mess. Well it happened. Then maintenance worker quipped off smart alec talk because he had tio be called in to fix it. The place could be nice but it was operated poorly. The service was bad. The Mngr. matter of fact (Tameria?) No safes on the property-don't bring anything of value. No alcoholic beverages to be bought on site,no bar by the pool etc. We travel alot and I wanted this to be a Romantic time with just my wife. It was dampened by this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: RJM1962
Reviews.Content: Received 4 star accommodations at bargain basement prices. There is no housekeeping service but it is really a time-share that rents out on a daily basis. There is a $65.00 room cleaning fee billed on check in but at the rates they charged the fee was reasonable. We stayed in a huge 3 bedroom 2 bath suite that was immaculate when we checked in. It looked like it had never been used! The property is quiet and a little off the beaten track which is ideal after a day of fighting crowds at the parks. There is a pool and hot tub as well as steam room, sauna, and excercise room. We stayed 6 nights and no one bothered us or tried to sell us anything. If you want to be pampered spend $300.00 a night on a 5 star hotel. If you want a good value for your money stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: bapeiper
Reviews.Content: The villa was very spacious. We had problems with the living room tv not working for most of our 2 day stay. The staff tried to resolve the problem but it never worked correctly. The beds were very uncomfortable. We will not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Had A Blast!!”
Reviews.Author: anaturalswagger
Reviews.Content: I got there and fell in love with this place. My pals & I have gone on trips all over but this place I would definitely come again. I think about making this a tradition to go back every year!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time at Caribe Cove, Highly recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: smilmoe
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Caribe Cove 3 times and have had a wonderful experience each time. I recommend it to all my friends that stay at the Disney Resorts. I can not tell you how nice it is to have seperate bedrooms, a full kitchen to do our own cooking and laundry within the condo. The noise level is very low and the facilities are very clean. The restaurants are good and the pools are very nice. The staff has always been very friendly. The bedrooms are the size of a hotel room with large spacious bathrooms all new fixtures, appliances, etc. While it is not on the disney property it is relatively close and it is nice to have things to do besides the parks every day. There is so much more to do in Orlando than the parks. With 3 children the space is much appreciated. It is nice after a long day to put the kids to bed and relax in the living room and watch tv without worrying about waking them up. Would definately recommend it and I wouldn't stay any place else.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Caribe Cove”
Reviews.Author: Leafs41
Reviews.Content: My family of four (children aged 10 and 7) checked into the Caribe Cove for some down time after our stay at one of the Disney Resorts. We had great expectations. We were very disappointed. Although the resort is new, our unit appeared to be "well used". We had travelled a distance with lots of bags and they didn't have luggage carts to transport our things. When I asked about this, there was no offer from staff to help either. My husband made several trips up and down the elevator to bring our luggage in. The rugs needed cleaning and the unit was not that clean. We had no hot water on our first night of arrival. I called the front desk multiple times to ask for help and finally they answered after the 5th try. The maintenance man arrived shortly there after with a lollipop in his mouth which remained the entire time we spoke. Very unprofessional. There were no blankets on the bed, just a sheet and bedspread. When I found the blankets to put them on myself, they were filthy and stained. When I took my son out of the shower to wrap him in a towel, I discovered it covered in long strands of black hair!! The frying pan handle was falling off and the dishwasher broke a wineglass, which when told about it, the front desk indicated I would have to pay for it. There is no business centre so the front desk attendant, who seemed very cranky, had to check us in online for our flights the next day. She refused to allow me come behind the desk to see the seat assignments. So I had to crane my neck and body over the counter to catch a brief glimpse. We found this place to be very disappointing with unprofessional staff and out to make a quick buck. They've put the place together as cheaply as possible. In hindsight, I wish we would have just stayed at our Disney resort for our last few days. It was amazing and this place just had us leaving Orlando with a bad taste in our mouth.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for a large group”
Reviews.Author: JTSchneider
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caribe Cove on a Saturday-Wednesday in January. Our party included myself, my husband, our 1-year-old, my sister, and my father. We rented a 3-bedroom villa which was less than $100 per night, plus a $65 cleaning fee (standard). First, the pictures we found on Booking.com actually did a very good job of representing what we saw in person. This isn't always the case, so it was a nice surprise. The villa was quite spacious. All of the rooms were very large with extra-tall ceilings. The master bath was enormous, with a separate tub and tiled shower, expansive double vanity, and a toilet room. Every room had plenty of closet/dresser space. The kitchen was full sized, the dining room seated 6, and the living room was plenty comfortable. There is a screened-in patio with a table and 4 chairs, lovely for breakfast, and a laundry room with full-sized washer & dryer. The villa would have absolutely accommodated 6 adults or a large family comfortably, even for an extended stay. The kitchen was very well stocked. This wasn't the usual kitchen you find in a "suite" with a small saucepan, a beat-up frying pan, and two each of plates, cups, and spoons. There was a toaster, blender, coffee pot, punch bowl, serving dishes, and silverware and tableware galore. There were pots and pans and baking sheets and a cutting board... they even had a plastic pitcher for mixing up juice! Just a mile or two down 192 is a very nice Publix (grocery) where you can stock the fridge. The property is new and very well kept up. The front desk staff was consistently helpful and pleasant. We didn't use any of the clubhouse amenities, but things at least appeared to be clean and well-kept. Pricing was generally fair: we broke a glass and a bowl and the replacement costs were surprisingly low - a total of $3.27! On the other hand, they aren't as generous as some with the odds-and-ends: after you've used the first coffee pod/dishwasher detergent/etc you have to pay for replacements. There is a convenience store type shop in the clubhouse, which was nice at least. Even without advanced warning, the room was stocked for tots. One of the master bedroom closets had a portable crib and full-sized high chair ready for use. None of the usual waiting for 4 hours to get a crib. There were plenty of pillows and extra blankets, though the bedding was definitely of a low quality. Clean, but cheap. The bed was, shall we say, very firm. In that cheap spring mattress sort of way. The bedrooms all have vents through the wall directly into the main living area. Strange, and made it so you could hear just about anything between the rooms. Things you may want to watch out for: We weren't too happy with the check-in/out hours of 4pm and 10am. It seems this is not uncommon in the Orlando area, but still a bit of a pain. The $65 cleaning fee would be a bit of a nasty surprise if you weren't already aware of it. And finally, it's a bit out of the way - about 10-15 minutes to Disney and 20-30 minutes to the airport. (Though it's very quiet and pretty because of this.) Overall we were all very happy with our choice. For reference, we're Midwestern Americans and fit pretty snuggly in the middle-class slot. This villa fit well with our expectations and budget and was perfect for accommodating our group, which otherwise would have had to book 3 standard hotel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Herrishia
Reviews.Content: Quiet area. Not to far from Disney!!! The kitchen was fully loaded. Perfect location! The resort was magnificent and we have never experienced such incredible service before. IDuring our stay it wasn't that hot so we didn't spend much time there. By the end of the day we couldn't wait to get back to the peace and tranquility of the resort. The pool is lovely, Our kids are 9 and 10 and they enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Not so family-friendly”
Reviews.Author: hazelmaeby
Reviews.Content: We were generally pleased with our stay with a few big caveats. The suite was nice, and we liked that our kids (2 and 1 years old) had a separate bedroom. But, it was chilly when we were there, and despite what the website said, the pool was DECIDEDLY NOT heated. The girls and I refused to go in, and my husband lasted for one lap. We all crowded in the jacuzzi for a few minutes, but that was it for lounging on our 4-day stay. We were also VERY disappointed that when our two exhausted toddlers napped beyond the late check-out time, we were forced to pay for a whole additional day. They claimed that they couldn't clean the room in time, but the big empty parking lot made it pretty obvious that there were a lot of other rooms available. I don't want to be a jerk, but forcing parents to wake up a two-year-old and a one-year-old from their naps in order to avoid paying more then $100 extra does not seem at all family-friendly to me.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: NJ Family Traveler
Reviews.Content: Who: Family of 6 (kids 15, 12, 10 and 6) When: Aug. 1-13, 2008 Why: Vacation to WDW, SeaWorld and Kennedy Space Center ---------------- (*WARNING - This is a long review!) The HUNT: This would be our 5th trip to Orlando, having stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge in 2002 and then off-site at the Caribe Royale Resort (no relation to Caribe Cove Resort) in 2003, 2004 and 2007) and assumed we would return to the Caribe Royale Resort (deluxe 2BR/2BA villa with full kitchen, and washer/dryer, almost 1250 square feet). However, I searched the Internet to see what other options were available. I first found a Marriott Residence Inn (our hotel of choice when we travel due to their accommodations for 6 with kitchen, free daily hot buffet breakfast and free afternoon snack/light dinner during the week and laundry facilities) in Lake Buena Vista which had rave reviews here and was only $169 per night (the Caribe Royale Resort was $239 per night), a savings of $70 per night over a 12 night stay which translated into $840! Add in the free daily hot breakfast buffet and afternoon snack/light dinner - I figured we would save about $1,000. The only potential drawback was that the Residence Inn was further away form the parks and didn’t have in-room washer/dryer like the Caribe Royale Resort but, heck, I thought for $1,000 I could send our dirty laundry out daily and have it delivered and still save several hundred dollars (I wasn’t serious about doing this of course but it made me feel good to find the Residence Inn option). So sorry, but it was goodbye to the Caribe Royale Resort - you were good for us in the past. However, being the compulsive vacation planner (and value-seeker) that I am, I continued to scour the Internet for other options and came upon the Caribe Cove Resort (CCR) (similar name, I know, but totally unrelated). The reviews on tripadvisor were generally positive, although I had a few concerns - no daily housekeeping (they charge a one-time $65 cleaning fee, no matter your length of stay), it was farther from the parks than the Caribe Royale Resort and the Residence Inn and was described as being in a rather remote, new and mostly undeveloped area, completely unknown to us. At least both Caribe Royal Resort and the Residence Inn were known commodities to our family. Hmm . . . quite the dilemma. The reviews did rave about the super size of the villas and that everything was so new and clean. CCR only opened in August, 2007 so the resort was virtually still brand new and would only be a year old when we would be there. Enough time for the resort to work out the “kinks” and be fully operational, right? Keeping fingers crossed . . . During May and June, the rates for CCR went from $149 for a 2BR/2BA or $169 for a 3BR/2BA to $99 for 2BR and $109 for 3BR and it was bye-bye to the Residence Inn. Aside from the savings and convenience of the daily breakfast with the Residence Inn and our prior good experience at other Residence Inns, the CCR was so new and much larger (the 3BR unit was nearly 1,600 square feet and included a third bedroom, which we have never had before). One of the reviews that I read about the CCR mentioned that they got a great price by booking their reservation for CCR through bookit.com, a website which I had never heard of or used before. After then reading reviews of this website, I checked out their rate for CCR, which had reduced rates at $109 for 2BR and $129 for 3BR. Could I justify the extra $240 for a third bedroom? That could buy a lot of Mickey ice cream bars and Dole Whips! I continued to check bookit.com daily just to see if the rates would go down (along with our economy and presumably the tourist industry in Florida) as we were getting closer to August and soon bookit.com was advertising a special for CCR - the same price for the 3BR as the 2BR. Looking better . . . a 3BR villa for only $109 a night! A couple of weeks later, bookit.com was offering the 3BR villa for an absolutely unbelievable rate of only $99 per night (while the price for the 2BR was still at $109 - still can’t figure that one out)! I waited several days as my skepticism over both CC R and bookit.com kept me from jumping on this deal (you know, the old adage - if it’s too good to be true . . . ). Finally, after calling bookit and CCR directly (although I am a huge fan of the Internet and do plenty of shopping and other business on-line I still like talking with the people I am dealing with), I was convinced that there were no gimmicks or hidden charges with either business and that it would be safe to make the reservation. After all, as I explained to my DH, if we hated it or they tried to add on additional fees, we would cancel through our credit card to get a full refund and move to the Residence Inn (they still had plenty of available rooms during our vacation period). We happily stayed at CCR and did not have to change hotels. So, with the mighty click clack at the keyboard, I made our 12 night reservation through bookit.com at the CCR for our deluxe 3BR/2BA 1,600 square foot villa for $99 per night (plus tax and the $65 cleaning fee) and said a silent prayer that I wasn’t risking ruining our big annual family vacation in hopes of saving some money. (If you’re keeping track, what should have been about $2,900 to stay at the Caribe Royale Resort was now drastically reduced to $1188 for our stay at the CCR, a real savings of over $1700!!) --------------------- Review of Caribe Cove: We absolutely loved staying here and had no problems whatsoever with the reservation, the price or with our villa! Everything was brand new, so spacious, quiet and a lovely place to come back to relax after a long and tiring day in the parks. Our villa (#1305) was ready (they are very strict that 4:00 PM is the earliest you can check in). There are 4 buildings to this resort and buildings 1 and 2 are the closest to the entrance and pool. We were in building 2 on the third floor. We unloaded as much as we could fit into the elevator and went up to our villa. We opened the door and were so pleased with what we saw. Indeed, everything in the villa was new and the place was HUGE! The boys staked out which bedrooms they were sharing (the bathroom between their bedrooms even had a separate bath tub and shower stall), tons of drawers to put their clothes away in. The kitchen was well-equipped and stocked and the washer and dryer in the laundry room were full-sized units, not those small stackable units. The master bedroom was so grand (it had 2 separate walk-in closets, which honestly you could have tucked away another person to sleep in - LOL!), whirlpool tub and a large square separate shower stall, double vanity sinks and a balcony. There was also a large wrap around screened-in balcony with ceiling fan from the living room (with 4 chairs and a table). There were 2 rocking chairs on our balcony. Every TV was a flat screen, too. We were pretty happy and I finally breathed a sigh of relief over choosing the CCR! Outdoor pool - small with no slide or anything but was clean and adequate for our purposes (there were always available loungers). Exercise room - small with maybe 4 or 5 pieces of equipment. We never saw anyone in there. You definitely need to rent a car if you stay here - there is nothing within walking distance. Overall, we were very pleased with our 2 week stay here and would definitely stay here again. However, Caribe Cove is not a resort as I think of a resort - there are NO amenities here at all (no on-site restaurant, spa or activities or anything else), which was fine for our purposes. We felt more like we were staying at a brand new home borrowed from a friend than staying at a hotel or a "resort". We literally had no contact with anyone from the hotel except for checking in and checking out - it was a little strange but we got used to it. Just to be safe, we videotaped the entire villa on the morning we checked out showing that all of the supplies (towels, kitchen utensils, etc.) were all there. I'm happy to report that we didn't hear from the hotel about any additional charges for missing items or excessive cleaning that we needed. If you have any questions or any hesitation about staying here, please send me a message. I have a lot of helpful hints to share if you decide to stay here but this is already too long! Give Caribe Cove a chance - you will not be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “A Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: luvtravol
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the caribe cove from September 15-22nd while visiting the Disney parks. We opened the door to our 2 bedroom condo and It felt like walking into a new model home! It still had that new home smell! This condo had everything we needed including a full size washer and dryer and a fully equiped kitchen. The condo was super clean and had 3 TVs that was great after being at the parks all day and allowed everyone there own space to unwind. The pool was beautiful and 3 of the 4 times we went down to the pool no one was there. Previous posts state the caribe was difficult to find. True it's not on GPS yet but when we visited there was a big yellow bill board on the 192 that said "Bahama Bay and Caribe Cove next left on Westside Blvd". This really helps to find it. I imagine this sign will be there for a while. If you're looking for a relaxing place to stay this is it. There's no restaurant on site but plenty on the main road to choose from. No extras for the kids like splash pads or arcades but my 2 boys (5 and 7) didn't complain as our days were so busy at the parks and they loved the pool. Pool does close at dusk but we were never asked to leave when it got dark out. We had no problems getting to the parks. It was about 10min to Hollywood studios and 15min to the Disney parking lot. Overall when compared to a Moderate hotel in Disney that costs you $150/night for 2 beds and washroom I'd pick the Caribe Cove again. A home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Accomodations great, short on services”
Reviews.Author: bbatNL
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Caribe Cove from Aug 20 to Sept 3, 2008. This property is a sister property to the Bahama Bay Resort. It is almost band new and the accommodations are great. We stayed in a 3 bedroom, tons of room, very clean. The unit has wired high speed internet connection which was nice to have. Also the building have elevators which was a nice change from Bahama Bay. The resort itself is limited in terms of services. It has one nice pool which was great during our stay because the resort was mostly empty. I can see it being very crowded at peak season. There is no restaurant or bar on the resort. Overall a nice place to stay as a stepping off point for visiting the parks, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Quiet and well worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Lucavigg
Reviews.Content: Very impressed by our two bed apartment. Even with 70% occupancy, the pool area was almost always empty and we had exclusive use of a steam room, hot tub and sauna. The gym is a bit small and got crowded in the morning. The staff were very friendly and always smiling and keen to help. The apartment was large, very comfortable and had everything you could want. It had a washing machine and dryer, a very large kitchen with more cupboards than you would possibly want, a double door fridge with icemaker and a dishwasher. The sitting room had a television, master bed had a TV and DVD and the other bedroom had a TV. Both rooms had en-suite, the master had a very large bath and a shower that sleeps seven! The only thing I was not too happy about was the soft beds. I'm used to a very firm mattress and I guess it's just a matter of personal preference, but it didn't make a huge difference once I got used to it. I would definately return to Caribe Cove and it's ideal if you want to spend part of your vacation relaxing away from the parks and the crowds of International Drive.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, but beware of traffic”
Reviews.Author: Wanderluster2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 3-bedroom unit at the Caribe Cove Resort in August. The hotel is nice and the staff are very helpful and friendly and the price is good, keeping in mind that it's a self-catered condominium and cannot be compared to a regular hotel. The unit was new and clean except the carpet had stains, which was a surprise considering how new the property is. However, I wonder how long it will stay in this condition, if not properly maintained. Our biggest concern / complain is the location of the hotel. While close to WDW, it is hard to get in and out of the area as the main roads are always congested. We spent approx. 2 hrs in traffic every day traveling, doubling the expected travel time. I'd recommend this property because of its great value, however, be aware that you'll be spending lots of time in the car wherever you go!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Tidy and Quite”
Reviews.Author: Peggy100
Reviews.Content: We stayed middle of August 2008. Arrived mid afternoon after getting lost out of Orlando airport!! Chap on reception could have actually taken his feet off the desk and looked away from his computer when we checked in. Information regarding resort not forthcoming. Internet in lobby expensive (take your lap top)! Could not print airline check in confirmation as computer not connected to printer. Units wonderful. Clean, tidy and quite. Plenty of room. We had a 3 bedroom unit, beautiful. Pool clean. Free home made cookies and coffee in lobby. Just needed fresh milk instead of powder. Address of resort still not on GPS. Publix is the nearest supermarket has everything you need. Huge washing machine and dryer. Plenty of storage space. Had a great time. The reception guy (the young one) just needs a lesson in customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Caribe Cove experience”
Reviews.Author: sugey
Reviews.Content: I stayed here rencently with my family ( 8 people) when I called to make the reservation the lady who answered the phone was barely paying attention to what I was saying, she kept laughing with someone else which I tought was pretty rude. she kept answering my questions with a yes or a no like she was annoyed with me for asking. when I received the e-mail confirmation, the amout per night and the dates of arrival/departure were wrong, so I called to ask why and to correct it but she told me that the system was not working properly and that she could not do anything about it, I told her as long as they would charge me the correct amount it was ok (which they did), during this call I asked her for directions and she had no idea and didn't transfer me to anyone who knew. This place was not easy to find because it does not show up on your GPS. when we finally got there the lady that was there was very nice , we checked in without problem went to our room on the 4th floor and everything was very nice, very clean and spacious. Next day in the morning my husband steps out to the grocery store and when he came back the key did not work, we went to the lobby before leaving to the parks (since we knew we were coming very late and tired and wanted to make sure the keys worked !) so she gave us a brand new key. When we came back around 11pm guess what??? the key did NOT work, so we were forced to stay outside the door with two small children sleeping in our arms while my husband drove the car to the lobby (very far from our building) to get a new key... bythis time we were pretty annoyed with this resort as you can imagine. But that is not all... next day again when we came back from the parks at night with the children sleeping, we find out the elevators are not working!!! ( we were on the 4th floor) I called from my cell to see if anyone could come over to help, the lady's response was sorry the maintenance people are gone for the day you have to take the stairs.... 4th floor, mind you it was eight of us, one eldery person three kids and two of them sleeping!! total night mare. If you have small children do not stay there there is nothing for them to do, no play ground no kiddie pool etc. The only thing I was happy about twas the price $123 taxes included per night for three rooms is not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: finlady12
Reviews.Content: We liked Caribe Cove Resort a lot! Friendly customer service, clean and very spacious. Nice interiors. We liked the firm beds. Personally we are not very fond of carpeted floors (in the bedrooms, dining room and living room) but they were clean, so it is an issue of taste Wished we would have had the possibility to stay for more nights. It is fairly far away from Disney World. We got stuck inte 192 traffic and it took us an hour to get to Disney World. Maybe the GPS would have found a faster route for us but we didn't happen to use it at that time.

Reviews.Title: “Far surpassed expectations!”
Reviews.Author: boilers5
Reviews.Content: We stayed from July 12 - July 20, 2008. We had read the reviews and expected the place to be decent, but it far surpassed our expectations. The resort is 5.5 miles from the Disney maingate exit on 192 - in traffic, it takes 10 to 15 minutes tops to hit the Disney parking lots. The 3 bedroom unit is very spacious. The kitchen is the best equipped kitchen we've had staying in both private homes and condos for over 5 years (both in the Outer Banks and Florida). The resort could use another pool and, as others have posted, the pool hours could be longer, but overall the resort offers top-end accommodations at incredible nightly rates. We will definitely return to Caribe Cove again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place! Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: MyFamiilyOf6
Reviews.Content: We literally found this place by accident after searching the internet for a less costly suite to stay than we had booked close to Disney. THIS PLACE IS TERRIFIC! It is a little out of the way on US 192 and most restaurants are about 2-4 miles away but we drive ourselves to Florida so it's not a big deal. The whole facility is well managed and really clean. These are owner investment properties managed by a independent management company for the owners I think but they do a totally awesome job! Check in at 4 PM no exceptions! So if you arrive early be prepared to do something before 4PM. The suites are beautiful and very well maintained. They have a small clean heated pool, sauna and stream room but forget the excersize equipment room it's nothing but a few machines in a small room in the lobby of the club house. Also when we stayed we could use the Bahama Bay facility (about 1 mile away) for free and they have a better pool and activity center but don't get me wrong Caribecove is really nice and my statement is not meant to be a negative. We went with our 4 children and had plenty of room to relax and the Internet service was good too! THIS PLACE IS TERRIFIC I know I wrote that twice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Home Away From Home!!!!”
Reviews.Author: informme
Reviews.Content: I booked this 3bed 2bth with only limited reviews on AOL travel, however you can find plentiful reviews on www.tripadvisor.com and pictures of the rooms. The room was very clean and the resort is new. The room came with all the amenities you would find in your own home and then some. It was over 1500 sqft and all the rooms were a decent size. The bathrooms were just amazing with recessed lighting - definitely a romantic get-away can be possible even if the kids are along with the large master suite and bathroom with 2 closets hers/his and a sliding door to exit onto the nice screened in balcony. This property is very peaceful since it is about 10-15 minutes from disney off 192 and it doesn't offer much to do for the children, so you don't have a bunch of kids running around. So, if you are looking for that type of atomosphere, than you won't find it here. My husband was so impressed with the set-up of the room that he didn't want to leave to return home. This place is larger and nicer than some peoples homes. I am very particular and I fell in love as well. The space we had was enough room for 6 people to move around comfortably, although I believe it sleeps 8 if you utilize the sleeper sofa in the living area. There was also a DVD in the master to watch movies, so you can bring some family movies if you like. We actually plugged the DVD up to the TV in the living area and moved it back when we left. PROS: Space, amenities, cleanliness, cable, internet access in room (Free) and lobby, washer & dryer (full-size), comfortable beds, peaceful Cons: Limited things for the children to do

Reviews.Title: “Just Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: travelingemi
Reviews.Content: Pros: Nice location, easy to find. The grounds and pool are very well kept. Good price. The room is amazing, just beautiful and private. The staff is friendly and helpful. Free internet, nice screen patio. Huge master bathroom. All that you need and better than a regular hotel. Cons: The beds are hard as a rock, TV in the room is tiny. Overall, very good stay, worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “I wanted to move in!!”
Reviews.Author: alexedy
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 24th June to the 6th July and had a lovely time. First impressions of the apartment where simply WOW. The 3 bedroom apartment is absolutely massive. It felt very homely and had every amenity you could think of down to a huge salad bowl and blender for smoothies/ margaritas. A little out of the way of all the hustle and bustle of the big resorts but i liked that, (when i mean out of the way i mean 10 mins drive so its not a problem) We drove to citywalk universal for the nightlife most nights as there where lots of bars and clubs. I'd definately stay again and can't imagine staying in a standard hotel room ever again ! One good tip is book your car rental through www.hotwire.com first as we saved loads from pre booking from the UK with an american website, as car rental is a must . Also you get to use the facilities of Bahama Bay which is just round the corner which isn't really advertised when you get to the resort apart from on the carib cove website. Here they have a restaraunt, 2 pools, bars etc and a sandy artificial beachfront for sunbathing and a pontoon for spying crocodiles over the lake. Very good value for money and lots and lots of space and luxury, the only drawback is no maid to clean your sheets which i think maybe they should include once or twice if your staying for 2 weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Clean Stay”
Reviews.Author: DisneyDadNeedSleep
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 12-Day stay at Caribe Cove. Family of four (kids 7&6) and had a 7 day disney pass(w/ waterpark). I can tell you that we'll definately recommend this place to any of our friends. Items you have to remember about this place (which I was expecting), there is no daily cleaning service, no room service and the front-desk was OK and polite for the 1 time I needed them. You will have to take your garbage to the bins in the parking lot, and there was no exceptional ammenities (wife said that the complimentary coffee was empty on a few occasions in the main lobby). That being said, the place is clean and huge...we had the 3-bedroom model with large screened-in balcony overlooking the woods. The kitchen was perfect as we enjoy our homecooked meals most of the time. There's a WalMart within 5 minutes with everything you need, yet the place is a remote and quiet new street...pool was clean and big enough for all guests to enjoy. The 3 bedrooms is a huge bonus, 3 TVs make life perfect after a long day of disney....eveyone can get their space after being on each others nerves all day ;) Hollywood studios is about 10 minutes away with no traffic, Disney is about 15 minutes.... Things that would have made the place perfect: 1> playground for the kids....can never get enough of those. 2> being able to BBQ would have been great! 3> basketball net would be a bonus. 4> Garbage pickup or easier to dispose of garbage on each floor (have to walk to the garbage down to the parkling lot). Some Advice, stay in building #2 to be close to the pool for walking. Turn off your A/C when you are on the balcony, the A/C is on the balcony so the noise disturbes your peace! Bring your notebook and make sure you know how to use it with an ethernet cable (cable provided), wireless doesn't work in the rooms, only in the lobby. Holihans (sp?) is a few minutes away and has a great patio and food is good. Overall, best value I've seen on vacations in a long time!

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong staying here!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: thingoneDuluth_mn
Reviews.Content: This is a resort I would highly recommend to all. It opened last August and is still unknown to many. It is located in a new development and is very quiet but close to shopping and restaurants. One great surprise is that it is a block from 192, and once on the highway and down the road a couple of miles, the exit goes directly into Disney property. I will agree with other reviews about the grumpy lady at the front desk. I went to buy a few items in their mini-store and she was a bit put out that she had to stop what she was doing and wait on me. The man that checked us out was very polite. Only two negatives that I could see. #1........pool was only open from dawn 'til dusk. It would've been nice to have it open a little longer considering most people are at the parks until early evening. The pool is far enough away from the units that noise would not be a major factor. #2. The third bedroom with the twin beds definitely needs better window coverings. The window faces the hallyway and we had to put a spread over it to keep the brights lights from keeping the two girls awake. A bit tacky, but necessary. All in all, I would go back here in a heartbeat. Our unit was well-maintained and the grounds were beautiful. If you're considering staying here you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karagrl213
Reviews.Content: It took us like 2 hours to find this hotel because even though I knew it was not in the GPS system yet, we typed in the closest street to the hotel and that did not show up either. Type in Avalon Road. It is pretty much the same road, except seperated by a light and one end is Treasure Cove (the road the hotel is on) and the other end is Avalon. Weird. My BF and I had the Aruba 2-bed style room. It was amazing! We felt like it was ours. You are provided one single dishwasher cleaner - I never had a dishwasher so this was like amazing for me. We tried to only use the dishwasher once so we wouldn't have to buy more detergent but that didn't work and we went to the supermarket 2 seconds away and bought more. Although, they do have little packets in the lobby you have to purchase but we are dumb dumbs and didn't look. Try to savor the trashbags, you wont be provided more than two. I guess we eat alot because we needed more so we just used grocery plastic bags. Overall, the room was beautiful. Very big. I felt like I shouldn't be walking so much in a hotel room haha. The pool was okay. It was kind of small and there were some teenagers there with awful mouths. I'm only 21 and I was kind of shocked. It was always a nice temperature. The hotel is on a good strip with lots of food. From Dennys to Steakhouses. If you like Prime Rib and all that good stuff I definitely reccommend Black Angus and Colorado House of Beef. SOOO Good! In the hotel book thing that you'll find in your room it says you can purchase theme park tickets at the desk. I went and asked to save time and they said they dont have that service. Weird. UMMMM It was very nice though. Off the beaten path a little. Oh yeah, for some reason they thought we were checking out like 4 days before we were and one day the maid just walked in on my boyfriend in his boxers lol. She got scared and ran off. Then the next day, the doorbell rang and he went to open it and saw the maid running around the corner..He yelled to her and she said "Sorry!" then the phone rang and it was the front desk asking when we were checking out and who we booked it through. It was weird, but kind of amusing. Those were the only weird things other than that the place was great. hahahh.

Reviews.Title: “Family Cafe Getaway Weekend....”
Reviews.Author: TiredMom2D3JS
Reviews.Content: We just got home from a 3 night stay in the 3 bedroom suite. It was wonderful. Before I get started I want to make a note of 2 things. 1st since the street is new, you cannot find it on your GPS so do call for exact directions. 2nd do not take 192 if you are coming from the turnpike. Take Ocacola (?) parkway to 192 west. If you take 192 direct it will take over 40 minutes to get there with traffic and lights. The property is beautiful, quiet and relaxing. My few complaints are 1. the "boys" at the front desk are still learning what to do. 2. there is an automatic $200 hold on your card for incidentals. that is not mentioned any where. 3. though you are charged a $65 plus tax for cleaning, they do not clean every day. 4. they have wireless internet access, if you did not bring your lap top, there are no public computers on property. The rooms were large and the kitchen was well equipped for cooking. there is a wal-mart and publix not far for shopping and lots of places that deliver. the kids loved the pool and freshed baked cookies. the fact that there was a washer and dryer came in handy, but, you do need to buy your own soap. We will be going back to this "hotel" when traveling with the family to disney. There was so much room for the 6 of us we never even go on each others nerves. I hope they get all the kinks worked out and some public computers installed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoVacation4
Reviews.Content: I have to say that our family of four found this place to be exceptional! We were upgraded to a three bedroom with a huge, private balcony overlooking a wooded area. A really beautiful, relaxing view. The only complaint that we had was with the window coverings in the second and third bedrooms. The management/owners really need to put some light blocking window coverings in both of these bedrooms. Oh, and my husband would have enjoyed a sports channel, as another reviewer mentioned also....although not having one didn't bother me! Our 6 and 7 year olds enjoyed the pool area and having their own bedrooms. The rooms were huge, and were decorated beautifully! The full kitchen was great and the bathrooms were so large and beautiful, it made it easy for all four of us to get ready at the same time in the mornings. A short drive to the Magic Kingdom and Epcot. We didn't have any problems with traffic and made it to both parks in 10 - 15 minutes. A very quiet, relaxing retreat for families looking for a place to stay away from all the commercial disney properties!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, clean place - only 2 minor complaints....”
Reviews.Author: stpeter06
Reviews.Content: I spent months trying to find a nice, clean place to stay for our Disney vacation and Caribe Cove was just that. We walked into our unit and it was beautiful and clean!!! We asked to be next to the (heated and very clean pool) pool and they said no problem. I only had 2 minor complaints. 1. Their website states they offer discount tickets to the theme parks. When I got there and asked to buy the tickets, the woman said we don't sell them here. I explained that I read on their website that they did. Her reply was, "Did you not hear me the first time, do I need to say it again?" We ended up getting them at the gate that morning with only 5 lost minutes.... 2. The same woman also told us that she could not print our Southwest boarding passes because the printer didn't always work, which was a bummer because I have 4 small children and wanted us all to be able to sit together on the plane ride home. My suggestions are If you stay there only deal with the young girl -she is so sweet and polite. At checkout when she asked how our stay was, I told her it was excellent. I said the only thing that could have been better was if their printer was more reliable to print out our boarding passes to make it easier at the airport. She told me there was nothing wrong with the printer and printed them out within seconds. Sounds like the other woman was just feeling lazy... Other than those 2 minor complaints. The place is beautiful! I would still recommend it because of the cleanliness and beauty!

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: tofloridafromtherock
Reviews.Content: Well, we researched suites and villas to stay while in the area, and am so glad we booked here! The villa was just like the pictures on websites, soooo spacious. We were winding down after two weeks already spent on a busy vacation with a toddler, and this place was quiet and definitely above average for the $. The downfalls would be that pool is not heated, so early mornings are quite cool there, even in late May, and for toddlers there is no outside play area other than the pool area. A little out of the way but that's what made it relaxing! We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “not the best not the worst”
Reviews.Author: carolinatide
Reviews.Content: the rooms were nice the amenities were lacking we booked a three bed which is very spacious unit was very clean the owners choice of tv channels was ridiculous there was 5 shopping channels cartoons and the basic 3 abc, cbs, nbc there was no espn or any sports channels not good for a condo that has steam room and sauna for adults but nothing on tv after a long day at the parks also no grills no basketball courts all pretty cheap amenities to add

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Clean Property!”
Reviews.Author: evilstepmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Caribe Cove with our two children 8 and 10 from May 3 - 10, 2008 in a 3 bedroom suite. Getting there: Print off a Google map before you go! This was my big mistake as the GPS does not have the location yet. If you have a GPS set the intersection to 192 W and Avalon, and when you arrive your destination, turn left at Westside sign, there is lights and a brand new bank on your left. We were really lost for an hour at 1 a.m. so we called the hotel and the really nice front desk clerk stayed on the phone with us giving us directions for 20 minutes until we arrived. Location: It is really close to Disney, but quite a ways from Universal and Seaworld and the airport (up to 40 minutes on a busy highway) so keep this in mind if you are spending time at Universal. Two Publix grocery stores on the main 192W out of the complex on the main highway, close to Walmart too! Rooms and property: AMAZING, one of the largest, cleanest places we have ever stayed. It is so quiet and someone is always cleaning the property. Our first night we were in a ground floor suite with a parking lot view, but easily moved rooms in the morning when we asked. The staff was friendly and helpful with this, and did not charge us 2 cleaning fees, which may have been an oversight as I offered to pay. Our second room was on the 5th floor, close to the pool, with sunset views over the forest (building 2). The pool itself was smaller than pictured it seems, but not very busy at all especially during the day. The TV remotes did not work in any of the rooms (to be fair, we never asked for batteries), but the internet did, you had to sign on every day using the room number on your phone. It is NOT WIRELESS as advertised, only by the pool. Also, this is a self-catering facility, so bring laundry and dishwashing soap, and anything else you do not want to buy. You get toilet paper, 1 set of garbage bags, 1 roll of paper towels, a couple of loads of dishwasher soap, and a few days of coffee. Towels are provided can easily wash in the in-room laundry (so convenient!) but no blowdryer, so make sure you bring one. In summary, we loved this property, but liked Universal Studios much more for theme parks, so might not stay again, because of the location, which is unfortunate, as we loved it, and it will be hard to top. As for the area in general, I have never met any friendlier people anywhere I have been. Everyone from the grocery store to the theme parks was so nice and helpful. Note: confirm your reservation when you arrive, and take a copy of your confirmation. The hotel had us booked in for three extra days, and had charged us for the full stay at check in, but promptly refunded us when I produced my confirmation from BOOKING.com.

HotelInfo.Name: Caribe Cove Resort Orlando
HotelInfo.Address: 9000 Treasure Trove Lane, Kissimmee, FL 34747
